title: AMICULUM
description:
Established in 2001, AMICULUM has grown into a mid-sized business that offers a comprehensive range of services to pharmaceutical, biotechnology, and health technology companies around the globe. This independent consortium of 11 uniquely branded agencies distinguishes itself through an agile, collaborative approach that tailors expertise from various facets of their business to deliver high-quality, technically accurate, and persuasive content for diverse audiences.

Operating from its headquarters in Bollington, Cheshire, GB, AMICULUM's global presence spans across multiple sites in the United Kingdom, the United States, Singapore, Switzerland, and the United Arab Emirates. This allows the company to tap into different markets and cater to the unique needs of clients from different regions.

AMICULUM provides a broad range of services from abstracts, biostatistical design, clinical protocol design & development, to pricing strategy, publication planning, and sales training modules, among others. Their multi-faceted services are aimed at engaging with healthcare professionals, enabling market access, and providing medical writing and editing services. Furthermore, they specialize in health technology assessment submissions, and life cycle assessment and management.

Their continuous growth over the years is evidenced by significant repeat business and recommendations from leading experts in the industry. Today, AMICULUM's team comprises over 350 healthcare communications professionals based across Europe, Asia-Pacific, the Middle East and North Africa (MENA), and the USA. The company holds the SBTI certification, highlighting their commitment to setting near and long-term targets.

title: Clinical Pathology Services
description:
Clinical Pathology Services is a boutique enterprise based in the vibrant heart of Dubai, United Arab Emirates. This esteemed company, while small in size, boasts an impressive range of in-depth pathology services. Their expertise spans across several intricate disciplines such as histopathology, cytopathology, serology, hematology, biochemistry, and microbiology. 

Being a small business with a revenue range of 1-10 million TTM, Clinical Pathology Services has successfully carved out a niche for itself in the competitive medical industry. Despite not having a specified year of establishment, the company has managed to create a strong presence in its local market of Dubai, as well as make a significant mark in the broader United Arab Emirates.

Their unique blend of services makes them a one-stop solution for a multitude of pathology needs. From understanding cellular and tissue study through histopathology and cytopathology to exploring the immune system's responses via serology, they cover a broad spectrum. Their services also extend to hematology for blood-related studies, biochemistry for chemical reactions in the body, and microbiology for investigating microscopic organisms.

In summary, Clinical Pathology Services is a dynamic and versatile small business that delivers a host of pathology services. Situated in the bustling city of Dubai, the company continues to thrive and serve its clients with unparalleled dedication and professional expertise.

title: CNC
description:
Founded in 2021, CNC is a small business, with a TTM revenue between 1-10M, based in New Delhi, India. The company operates from several sites located at 2E/21 Jhandewalan, New Delhi.

CNC excels in providing an array of services, including Biobanking, Clinical Research and Trial Consulting, Integration Analysis, and Reporting, among others. The company's offerings extend to Cryo-based and Paraffin-based Histology, Data and Text Mining, Digital Pathology, Endotoxin Testing, and various Human Tissue Assays. They also provide Creative Design support and a Virtual Clinical Trial Monitoring Platform. 

The company boasts a Good Clinical Practice (GCP) certification, a testament to their commitment to adhering to globally recognized standards and regulations. 

CNC specializes in curating a wide-ranging collection of Formalin-Fixed Paraffin-Embedded (FFPE) blocks, each enriched with a plethora of unique features. These blocks, coupled with detailed pathology reports, become a critical resource for conducting diverse research studies and diagnostic investigations.

For researchers seeking in-depth genetic insights, CNC offers FFPE blocks with mutation analysis. These specimens undergo exhaustive genetic characterization, allowing researchers to delve into the complex molecular structure of each sample. Furthermore, the company's advanced Next-Generation Sequencing (NGS) Data Analysis enables investigators to unearth hidden genetic information, thereby contributing to a more detailed understanding of disease mechanisms.

CNC also offers FFPE blocks that have undergone Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) and Fluorescence In Situ Hybridization (FISH) assays. These provide a focused perspective, enabling researchers to explore specific genetic markers with high precision. 

A distinguishing attribute of CNC's biobank is the availability of Tissue specimens, offering valuable insights into disease progression and treatment response. With a commitment to advancing medical and scientific knowledge, CNC's diverse collection is designed to propel investigations and progress in pathology, and beyond.

title: Getz Pharma Research
description:
Established in 2006, Getz Pharma Research is a small-scale business specializing in the pharmaceutical industry. With headquarters in the cosmopolitan city of Dubai, United Arab Emirates, and a significant presence in Karachi, Sindh, Pakistan, the company has effectively positioned itself in two key strategic locations. 

Operating within the 1-10M TTM Revenue range, Getz Pharma Research has carved a niche for itself by providing a wide array of services in the pharmaceutical domain. Their offerings include impurity profiling, stability testing, Active Pharmaceutical Ingredient (API) development, formulation development, characterization, and screening services. 

These specialized services ensure that Getz Pharma Research plays a crucial role in the drug development process, catering to the diverse needs of the pharmaceutical sector. With the precise and comprehensive testing methods they employ, the company guarantees the production of reliable and high-quality pharmaceutical products. 

Their expertise in formulating and characterizing pharmaceuticals, combined with their capability for thorough impurity profiling and stability testing, make Getz Pharma Research a preferred partner for many in the industry. The company's commitment to delivering high-quality services is reflected in their impressive growth since their inception in 2006. 

Getz Pharma Research's unique blend of services, strategic locations, and dedication to quality makes it a standout player in the competitive pharmaceutical research arena.

title: Genetrics
description:
Established as a small business, Genetrics is headquartered in the United Arab Emirates and has carved a niche for itself with an annual turnover of 1-10M TTM Revenue. This dynamic company works in a collaborative framework with an array of partners, boasting an impressive range of technical and scientific capabilities. 

Genetrics' primary mission is to assist a variety of laboratory types in the design and execution of large-scale projects. This includes hospitals, research labs, universities, forensic labs, environment labs, food and drug control labs, and genome centre labs. They provide comprehensive support, from project conception through to completion and beyond. 

Moreover, Genetrics partners with premier institutions and laboratories to offer cutting-edge Diagnostics and Genomics Reference testing services. These services are comprehensive, encompassing Microarray, Next Generation Sequencing (NGS) and Bioinformatics services. Clients for these services span across domestic and international pharma and biotech companies, as well as academic institutions. 

By integrating the above-mentioned services, Genetrics continues to make significant contributions to the scientific and technical sectors. The company's commitment to excellence, innovation, and strategic alliances makes it an indispensable partner for labs and institutions aiming for breakthroughs in their respective fields.

title: IBS GL
description:
Established in 2023, IBS GL is a rapidly expanding Contract Research Organization (CRO) based in Dubai, United Arab Emirates. As a new startup, it boasts impressive TTM revenue between 0-1 million. The company's headquarters are nestled in the thriving tech hub of Dubai Silicon Oasis, DDP, Building A1.

IBS GL's unique strength lies in its extensive network of clinical sites that enable access to a diverse range of biospecimens. This network comprises a collaboration of medical professionals, research groups, hospitals, and testing laboratories, all working together to advance the field of medicine. 

The company specializes in a variety of services, including anatomic pathology, clinical pathology, and the provision of Human Biological Samples (HBS). They also have expertise in histology, human blood, human cell products, human DNA & RNA, along with human fixed, fresh, and frozen tissue. Additionally, they offer human leukopaks and mouse biofluids.

Apart from these services, IBS GL is also adept at providing technical assistance to its clients. Their project office is well-equipped to aid in the creation of technical tasks and can provide bespoke biomaterial collections as per client specifications. 

In conclusion, IBS GL is a dynamic and innovative startup in the field of biospecimen research, offering an array of specialized services and technical assistance to meet the diverse needs of its clients.

title: Modeling and Simulation Decisions FZ - LLC
description:
Established in 2022, Modeling and Simulation Decisions FZ LLC is a small, independent consultancy firm based in Dubai, United Arab Emirates. With a primary focus in the pharmaceutical sector, the company offers model-informed drug development solutions tailored for global pharmaceutical businesses and biotech startups.

The company's services extend across the entire R&D pipeline. They specialize in addressing recurring inquiries concerning compound selection, dosage and regimen, therapeutic window, and optimization of preclinical and clinical study design. Other services include making informed choices for combination treatments and more.

Modeling and Simulation Decisions FZ LLC boasts a team of highly skilled scientists who excel in a plethora of quantitative techniques. These include population PKPD modeling, model-based meta-analysis, quantitative systems pharmacology, joint modeling, agent-based modeling, and machine learning. This expertise allows them to provide modeling experience across diverse therapeutic areas such as oncology, immuno-oncology, cardiovascular and metabolic diseases, neuroscience, respiratory, and infectious diseases.

The company's commitment to scientific and technical rigor is evident in their published works. These are featured in peer-reviewed disease-domain journals, reflecting their comprehensive understanding and application of their diverse skills. Their location in the Dubai Science Park further solidifies their standing in the scientific community, offering a strategic advantage for fostering innovation and collaboration. With revenue between 1-10 million TTM, Modeling and Simulation Decisions FZ LLC is a small yet robust player in the pharmaceutical industry.

title: Truven Health
description:
Truven Health is a mid-sized business with an estimated revenue of 10-100M TTM. They are known for their commitment to enhancing the healthcare industry by lowering costs, improving quality, and achieving better results. Although these are complex concepts, Truven Health, along with its smart and passionate professionals, is dedicated to managing changes and implementing strategies that will realize these outcomes.

Their clientele includes healthcare payers and providers from both the private and public sectors. They also work with researchers, suppliers, and regulators who are key players in the healthcare industry. Data drives Truven Health. They are recognized for their meticulous data collection and secure management, having dealt with clinical evidence, claims, clinical, and other types of healthcare data for over 40 years. They understand the challenges to anticipate and how to address them, like finding new ways to measure risk for providers and payers, or integrating data to deliver the solutions that today's converging healthcare interests require.

Not just a data company, Truven Health also offers proven analytics. Their methodologies and algorithms are trusted across the industry to deliver critical information that leads to confident decisions. This, coupled with flexible reporting, integration, and consulting services, empower their customers to enhance their part of healthcare quickly and effectively.

With deep domain expertise, Truven Health knows their customers' environments intimately. This understanding, combined with their leading data management capabilities and advanced analytics, makes them a trusted partner in delivering quality, reducing costs, and yielding greater value in healthcare. They have multiple sites worldwide, from the United States to the United Kingdom, Germany, China, India, the United Arab Emirates, Japan, Belgium, Brazil, and more.

title: Advanta Seeds
description:
Advanta Seeds, based in Dubai, United Arab Emirates, is a burgeoning startup specializing in agronomic and vegetable seed production. With a 20-year history of success and expansion, Advanta Seeds has made a significant impact on the global agricultural sector. The company boasts direct operations across Asia and South America, including India, Australia, Argentina, and Thailand, along with product exports to an additional 25 countries. 

In 2006, Advanta Seeds was acquired by United Phosphorous Ltd., a prominent Indian conglomerate in the international Agro Chemical industry, making it a part of the esteemed UPL Group of companies. This pivotal acquisition was followed by a successful Initial Public Offering (IPO) in 2007, leading to its listing on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and the National Stock Exchange (NSE) in India.

The company's competitive edge lies in its unique, superior, and proprietary germplasm, which when combined with advanced technology and bioscience capability, forms a solid platform for future growth. Advanta Seeds is committed to innovation and has adopted cutting-edge technologies such as Dihaploid and Molecular Marker technology to expedite crop research. Moreover, it's also formed strategic alliances with leading technology innovation companies worldwide for adding value through biotech traits like pest resistance, herbicide, and drought tolerance. 

As it forges ahead, Advanta Seeds is adopting a highly aggressive growth strategy, aiming for substantial organic growth complemented by strategic acquisitions to achieve its ambitious objectives over the next five years. With an experienced management team at the helm, Advanta Seeds is poised for dynamic growth and expansion.

title: Akay
description:
Akay is a small business, headquartered in the vibrant city of Dubai in the United Arab Emirates. Despite its compact size, the company has established a significant global presence as a leading provider of paprika and spice oleoresins. These key ingredients, sourced from India, are renowned for their quality and depth of flavor.

Being a small business with a revenue of 1-10 million TTM, Akay is able to maintain a high degree of attention to detail and quality control in its operations. This focus on excellence is reflected in their products, which have gained recognition worldwide. The company's location in Dubai, a city known for its cosmopolitan blend of cultures and cuisines, places it at the crossroads of the global spice trade.

Although the year of establishment is not specified, Akay has managed to carve out a niche for itself in the highly competitive global spice market, demonstrating its resilience and capacity for innovation. The company's expertise lies in its sourcing of premium quality paprika and spice oleoresins from India, bringing the rich flavors of Indian spices to kitchens and industries around the world. 

In conclusion, Akay is not just a small business based in Dubai; it is a global player in the spice market, specializing in the supply of high-quality Indian paprika and spice oleoresins.

title: ATC- Agro Trial Center GmbH
description:
Agro Trial Center GmbH, also known as ATC, is a small business based in Rohrau, Lower Austria. Established in 1986, ATC has built a solid reputation on its unwavering commitment to high quality. ATC was initially part of the research facilities of Stauffer Chemicals, where the focus was primarily on the development of maize herbicides. 

Over the years, ATC has maintained its quality standards, and this has been a driving force behind its success. The company was established with a clear focus on creating representative test environments - taking into account the soil and climate conditions relevant to Central and Eastern Europe. This strategic approach, coupled with excellent infrastructure, laid a robust foundation for the company's growth and development.

Today, ATC's reputation for quality and flexibility is recognized internationally. Despite being a small business with revenue between 1-10 million TTM, ATC has carved a significant niche for itself in the agro trials industry. 

The company's headquarters and primary site are located in Rohrau, Lower Austria, a location that has proven advantageous due to its representative soil and climate conditions. As ATC continues to evolve, it remains true to its original guiding principle of highest quality, a testament to its commitment to providing top-tier services in agro trials.

title: Archimed Life Science GmbH
description:
Archimed Life Science GmbH, a small business based in Vienna, Austria, is dedicated to revolutionizing the field of laboratory testing. With a mission to develop highly innovative and novel tests, it aims to identify both common and rare diseases at their earliest stages. This not only gives patients the opportunity for personalized therapeutic treatment but also increases the possibility of achieving the best possible health outcomes. 

The company acknowledges the significant challenge in diagnosing rare disorders, especially among children, where the process can take months or even years while the disease progresses. However, Archimed Life Science GmbH is committed to changing this narrative by making superior laboratory tests more accessible. 

Operating from its headquarters at 20 Leberstraße Wien, Vienna, and another site at Leberstrasse 20/2, Vienna, the company is at the forefront of pioneering new methods and strategies to provide enhanced laboratory services. Under the banner 'Personalized Diagnostics for Better Health,' Archimed Life Science GmbH strives to provide diagnostic solutions that are tailored to each patient's unique condition, thus ensuring better health outcomes. Despite being a small business, its impact and contribution to the medical field are, indeed, significant.

title: AIT Austrian Institute of Technology

The AIT Austrian Institute of Technology is dedicated to exploring numerous fields, including health and environment, energy, mobility, and safety and security. Its prime location at Donau-City-Straße in Vienna, Austria, allows the institute to tap into the country's rich technological resources and expertise. With an annual revenue ranging between 1 to 10 million, the AIT Austrian Institute of Technology exemplifies how small businesses can lead the charge in technology and innovation. 

The AIT Austrian Institute of Technology is not just a company but a hub of innovation, dedicated to the continual development of technologies that will shape the future of our world. Its commitment to research, development, and innovation in various fields underlines its importance in the technological landscape.

The company operates from two strategic locations; one at its headquarters in San Diego, CA, USA, and the other one across the globe in Graz, Steiermark located at Reininghausstraße 49, 8020 Austria. This dual presence helps them maintain a global reach and serve their clients better.

title: Attoquant
description:
Established in 2012, Attoquant is a small business headquartered in Vienna, Austria. Operating within the 1-10M TTM revenue range, this business primarily functions from its site at Brehmstraße 14A, Vienna. Attoquant offers an array of services such as assay development, handling human frozen tissue, in vitro assay development, LCMS analysis, and method development and validation. 

The company has carved a niche in pharmacokinetic (PK) screening, extending its expertise to diverse species including dogs/canines, monkeys/non-human primates, mice, and rats among others. Attoquant specializes in the biochemical characterization of peptide hormone cascades, primarily focusing on the Renin-Angiotensin-Aldosterone-System.

They offer high-quality LC-MS/MS based peptide quantification services, significantly contributing to the field of diagnostics. Furthermore, Attoquant provides the quantification of different functionally related angiotensin metabolite panels through its unique RAS-Fingerprint™. This service is complemented by their highly sensitive activity assays for proteolytic enzymes, which are based on natural peptide substrates. 

In addition to these robust services, Attoquant extends support in bio-analytical planning, sample measurement, and data interpretation, thereby providing comprehensive, end-to-end solutions to its clients. Emphasizing their dedication and commitment, Attoquant's tagline resonates as "providing MORE THAN JUST DATA", reinforcing their role as a reliable partner in the industry.

With their strategic locations and wide range of services, Analytical Services is geared to serve their clients with efficiency and expertise, thereby embodying their commitment to quality and precision. title: Anopoli Biomedical Systems
description:
Anopoli Biomedical Systems is an established small business that was founded in 1997. This innovative company is headquartered in Hinterleiten, Niederösterreich, Austria, with two key sites located at 84 Hauptstraße and 7a Holunderstraße in the same region. With a revenue stream between 1-10M TTM, Anopoli Biomedical Systems has positioned itself as a significant player in the biomedical field.

The company provides a vast array of services, making it a comprehensive solution for various biomedical needs. Its offerings include, but are not limited to, Amplicon 16s rRNA Sequencing, Anatomic Pathology, Antibody Conjugation, and Antioxidant Assays. They also specialize in Clinical Research, Custom Nanostructures, DNA Products, and Electrophoresis. Notable services also extend to Histopathology, Human Adult and Neural Stem Cells, Immunostaining, and a broad spectrum of Lab Equipment Services.

Anopoli Biomedical Systems is also recognized for its work in Liposomes, Low Density Lipoprotein (LDL) Uptake Assay, Methylation Analysis, and Microbiome Services. Furthermore, they offer services related to Nanoparticle Synthesis, Oligo Synthesis, Quality Control, and RNA Extraction. The company also excels in Stem Cell Analysis, Targeted Bisulphite Sequencing, Toxicity Test for Veterinary Drugs, Veterinary Environmental Assessment, Virus Detection Assays, and Whole Genome Sequencing, among others.

Anopoli Biomedical Systems is a multifaceted company that continually strives for excellence in the biomedical sector. Their comprehensive service offerings, coupled with their commitment to quality, make them a go-to resource for a wide range of biomedical needs.

title: Biobanking and Biomolecular Resources Research Infrastructure Institute BBMRI
description:
The Biobanking and Biomolecular Resources Research Infrastructure Institute (BBMRI) is a small-scale business, based in Graz, Styria, Austria. Although the year of its establishment is not provided, its significant contributions in the health research sector are undeniable. 

BBMRI plays a pivotal role in understanding the complexities of human diseases. It collects and preserves biological samples along with the corresponding data which are indispensable for the development of new drugs or diagnostic assays. The work carried out by BBMRI is critical for advancements in health research, as it paves the way for the future of personalized medicine. 

Moreover, BBMRI's biobanks are not just repositories for biological samples but are also treasure troves of key information about the influence of environment and lifestyle on health. This information forms the foundation for disease prevention programs, thereby, contributing to the betterment of public health.

The institute's competence lies in its ability to provide resources that are integral for the development of effective healthcare solutions. Over the years, BBMRI has proven to be an influential player in the health research industry, by aiding in the development of personalized medicine and disease prevention strategies. Despite being a small business, BBMRI's impact on the health and wellbeing of the public is substantial.

title: Biomay
description:
Biomay, established in 1984, is a small business headquartered in Wien, Austria, with an annual turnover between 1 and 10 million. The company's main office is located at Lazarettgasse 19, Wien, 1090 Austria. 

As a leading player in the industry, Biomay specializes in an array of services, offering high-quality recombinant proteins and plasmid DNA. In addition to these, the company is also adept in providing manufacturing services that cater to the needs of its diverse customer base.

Their expertise in the field is backed by years of experience and commitment to innovation. Biomay has carved a niche for itself in the industry, recognized for its unwavering dedication to producing superior quality products and services. The company takes pride in its ability to meet the demands of its clients, consistently delivering reliable solutions in the form of recombinant proteins and plasmid DNA.

The company's robust manufacturing services offer a distinct edge, further solidifying its position as a trusted and reliable partner in the industry. With a focus on quality and customer satisfaction, Biomay continues to set the bar higher in its field, consistently exceeding expectations with its cutting-edge products and services.

title: Biomerx Vermögensverwaltung GmbH
description:
Biomerx Vermögensverwaltung GmbH is a newly established startup situated in Oberösterreich, Austria. While the company is new, its laboratory in the heart of Linz has been successfully conducting microbiological analyses of food and industrial hygiene since 1991. 

In 2008, the laboratory was awarded accreditation according to DIN EN ISO / IEC 17025 standards by the Federal Ministry of Economics, Research and Youth. This accreditation is a testament to Biomerx's commitment to maintain high quality standards through continuous quality controls.

A distinguishing feature of Biomerx is its team of qualified personnel who are dedicated to ensuring quick processing of samples and rapid transmission of test results. The team's dedication extends to working weekends for further processing of samples. 

Additionally, the company collaborates with government-authorized appraisers in compliance with § 73 LMSVG. These appraisers are authorized at the customer's location to issue internationally recognized findings. 

Despite being a startup, Biomerx Vermögensverwaltung GmbH demonstrates a successful history through its laboratory operations, a commitment to quality, a dedicated team, and a strategic alliance with government-authorized appraisers. Its headquarters are located at 1 Schärdinger Straße Oberösterreich, 4061 Austria.

title: Biobank Graz
description:
Biobank Graz, a small-scale business located in the heart of Graz, Styria, is a renowned establishment within the medical community, with an operational reach reflected in its impressive annual revenue of 1-10M TTM. Housed at the Medical University of Graz, this biobank boasts an extensive collection of biological samples, meticulously organized and recorded for optimal usability. 

The remarkable collection comprises approximately six million diverse biological samples, making it one of the largest collections of its kind throughout Europe. The significant size of this collection underscores the breadth and depth of Biobank Graz's operations, while also highlighting its commitment to quality and comprehensive data collection. 

But it's not just about quantity for Biobank Graz. The primary aim of this esteemed institution is the betterment of public health care. By maintaining and consistently expanding their collection, Biobank Graz strives to contribute to the advancement of medical research, thus improving the health care services provided to the population. 

Biobank Graz is more than just a repository; it's a cornerstone of medical research and a testament to the power of organized, systematic data collection in the pursuit of better health care. A visit to Graz, Styria, 8010 Austria, will bring you to the heart of this remarkable establishment. Biobank Graz, where quality, quantity, and a commitment to public health come together.

title: Biotechnology Consulting
description:
Biotechnology Consulting is a specialized firm that operates within the dynamic and ever-evolving biotech industry. Established in Vienna, Austria, where it also houses its headquarters, the company has positioned itself as a leading companion for businesses in the field of drug development and regulatory affairs. 

Despite having a more modest size, with revenues reported to be within the range of 1 to 10 million dollars, Biotechnology Consulting carries a significant impact in the industry it serves. Its core services revolve around offering insightful advice and comprehensive solutions in drug development, a critical area in today's healthcare landscape. Coupled with their expertise in managing regulatory affairs, the company ensures that their clients can navigate the complex pathways of bringing new drugs to the marketplace within the stringent legal frameworks.

Biotechnology Consulting's strategic location in Vienna allows them to take advantage of Austria's robust biomedical environment, rich with opportunities for collaborations and knowledge sharing. The company's commitment to delivering superior consulting services to its clients, coupled with its deep understanding of the biotech industry, sets it apart in the field. 

In summary, Biotechnology Consulting is a small but vital player in the global biotech industry, offering a unique blend of services in drug development and regulatory affairs management. The company's strategic positioning, comprehensive service suite, and dedicated team make it a trusted partner for businesses seeking to navigate the complex terrain of biotech development.

title: bit.bio discovery
description:
Bit.bio discovery is a groundbreaking organization that seamlessly integrates industry-leading induced Pluripotent Stem Cell (iPSC) models with unbiased functional genomic CRISPR screenings. This unique blend of technologies allows for knock-out, activation, and interference at a single cell resolution, enabling a comprehensive interrogation of human biology. 

The company's robust technology platform is multifaceted, offering a wide range of applications. It serves as a vital tool for drug target discovery and validation, assisting researchers in identifying potential therapeutic targets. The platform also facilitates drug mechanism of action studies, providing critical insights into how drugs interact with biological systems.

Furthermore, bit.bio discovery's technology is instrumental in disease modelling. It helps in creating accurate models of diseases at a cellular level, paving the way for better understanding and potential treatments. Lastly, the company's platform is used for variant-to-gene mapping, a crucial process in genetic research that links genetic variations to specific genes.

Despite having no specific year of establishment, headquarters, or company type, bit.bio discovery has positioned itself as a leader in the field of genome research and drug discovery. Its unique services and cutting-edge technology platform set it apart from traditional research organizations, making it a go-to resource for researchers worldwide. Overall, bit.bio discovery is reshaping the way we understand and approach human biology.

title: Bender MedSystems
description:
Founded in 1998, Bender MedSystems is a small yet industrious business stationed in the heart of Wien, Austria. With its headquarters and primary campus located at the Vienna Biocenter 2, the company operates in a strategic location that provides easy accessibility and a conducive environment for innovative work in the medical sector. 

Despite generating a revenue between 1-10M TTM, Bender MedSystems has proven itself to be a significant player in the healthcare industry. Specializing in an array of services, the company continually pushes the boundaries of modern medicine. It excels in assay development, a critical component in diagnosing diseases and measuring the effectiveness of treatments. 

Beyond assay development, Bender MedSystems has established itself as a provider of custom antibodies. These are crucial tools in the field of immunology, aiding in the detection and neutralization of harmful substances. The company's expertise doesn't stop there; it also offers in vitro diagnostics, which are tests performed outside a living organism in a controlled environment, usually a lab. 

Last but not least, Bender MedSystems is known for its ELISAs (Enzyme-Linked Immunosorbent Assays). This biochemical technique is widely used in medicine and plant pathology, playing a role in diagnosing infectious diseases and measuring immune responses. 

In summary, Bender MedSystems is a dynamic and innovative company, contributing significantly to advancements in the medical field despite its small size. With a focus on quality and innovation, it continues to make a mark in the global healthcare industry.

title: biolution GmbH
description:
Established in 2002, biolution GmbH is an international scientific communications and consulting small business, generating between 1-10M TTM revenue, and headquartered in Vienna, Austria. The company has carved a niche for itself in the life sciences sector, specializing in poster design and development, poster symposium, and poster galleries.

biolution GmbH is renowned for its efficient and high-quality services, thanks to its highly experienced and well-trained full-time staff. This experienced team of life scientists hails from diverse scientific backgrounds and is complemented by a professional media design team. Leveraging its multidisciplinary expertise and over a decade of science communication experience, the company has developed a state-of-the-art 3D visualization pipeline for creating scientifically accurate 3D models for instructive visualizations and videos.

The company's scope of services spans 3D visualization (still and animated videos) for various purposes including education, marketing, broadcasting, documentaries, fundraising, public relations, and social media. It also provides corporate communication services, including corporate design, web and graphic design, print material, social media, video recording, and text editing.

In addition, biolution GmbH offers consulting services for EU-funded cooperation in H2020, ERC, FET, SME calls, Marie Skłodowska-Curie, Eurostars, EMBO fellowship, FWF, WWTF, LBG Institutes, and project management services such as communication, project controlling, legal/financial/administrative support, corrective measures, and meeting organization and moderation. The company also assists in the planning and execution of events, providing strategy and concept development, advice and support with presentations, moderation, public funding and sponsoring, event marketing, public relations inquiries, and technical setup and implementation.

title: Biovest Consulting GmbH
description:
Biovest Consulting GmbH, established in 2002, is an Austria-based consulting firm specializing in the life science and drug development sectors. With its headquarters in Woerdern, Austria, Biovest Consulting GmbH exhibits expertise in the design and management of rabbit monoclonal antibody development projects. 

The firm operates as a general contractor for its clients, who are predominantly from the pharmaceutical and biotech research and development departments. Its services are sought-after for the scientific design and logistical management of complex projects. Biovest Consulting GmbH's clientele includes a select group of dedicated patrons who rely on their unique capabilities and knowledge in the field. 

With the company's services extending beyond consultancy alone, they have positioned themselves as a crucial player in the biotechnology and pharmaceutical industries. Their offices located at Dr.-Bruno-Klein-Strasse 2 Woerdern, 3423 Austria, and 2 Doktor-Bruno-Klein-Straße Sankt Andrä-Wördern, Niederösterreich, 3423 Austria, serve as the epicentres for their innovative and cutting-edge work. 

As a firm with more than five employees, Biovest Consulting GmbH is committed to providing high-quality consulting services that are both efficient and reliable. Their focus on rabbit monoclonal antibody development projects sets them apart, marking their unique contribution to the field. Their dedication to excellence is evident in their continuous growth and the ongoing trust of their clients.

title: Biocrates Life Sciences
description:
Biocrates Life Sciences, established in 2002 and headquartered in Innsbruck, Tirol, Austria, is a small business specializing in targeted metabolomics kits and services. This reputable company, with revenue between 1-10M, addresses the primary challenges faced in metabolomics - the acquisition of high-quality, reproducible data, and the interpretation of meaningful results.

Biocrates Life Sciences offers extensive, quantitative coverage of over 1000 metabolites using LC-MS/MS approaches, ensuring high throughput and standardized methods. These methods are scalable, making them ideal for longitudinal and large cohort studies. With a highly applicable workflow, the company caters to a wide range of species and sample types - from plasma and feces to tissue, requiring as little as 10 uL for most biofluids.

The company is agile in adapting its methods to the unique needs of specific projects. Its expertise goes beyond data acquisition to include result annotation and biological interpretation. Biocrates Life Sciences has applied its techniques to a variety of diseases and systems, with recent applications in nutrition and wellbeing, neurology, infectious disease, and microbiome studies.

The company offers an array of assays, metabolomics kits, and services, covering a multitude of small molecules, metabolites, lipids, and more. These offerings have applications in various areas, including Alzheimer’s disease, nutrition, aging, heart disease, diabetes, obesity, and many others.

Biocrates Life Sciences holds certifications from the International Organization for Standards 13485 (ISO 13485) and International Organization for Standards 9001:2015 (ISO 9001:2015), emphasizing its commitment to quality and industry standards. Alongside its physical services, the company also provides data analysis services, including data interpretation, statistical analysis, and metabolite sum and ratio calculations.

title: Biosynth International, Inc.
description:
Biosynth International, Inc., established in 1966, is a globally recognized life sciences company headquartered in Staad, CH. As a large business with over 100 million dollars in revenue, Biosynth has numerous sites across Switzerland, United Kingdom, Netherlands, United States, Austria, Slovakia, and Germany.

Biosynth offers an extensive range of services, including API and Drug Product Stability Testing, Antibody Conjugation, Bulk Manufacturing, Custom Synthesis, Drug Delivery Technology, and High Throughput Screening among many others. These services are backed by certifications such as the Small Business (SB) - US only.

This firm is a trusted provider of innovative reagents, custom synthesis, and manufacturing services for the pharmaceutical and diagnostic sectors. With a focus on customer needs and scientific excellence, Biosynth supplies key reagents on a large scale with guaranteed quality.

Their capabilities extend across a wide range of areas, including the production of fine chemicals and small molecules, peptides, and biologics. They manufacture and source an extensive range of chemical and biochemical products, boasting a catalog of over a million research products.

Biosynth's small molecule chemistry specialties encompass enzyme substrates, carbohydrate and nucleoside chemistry, as well as intermediates, APIs, and controlled substances. They offer a seamless product life cycle service, from initial idea to the finished product, including GMP or ton-scale production at their various international sites.

Biosynth's peptide division, with a presence in the US and Europe, has over 40 years of expertise in assisting pharmaceutical and diagnostics customers. Their services range from custom peptide synthesis to GMP NCEs and neoantigens.

In addition to their peptide and small molecule offerings, Biosynth also provides essential biological raw materials, including mono- and polyclonal antibody production. They are also a leading provider of enzyme products and solutions, including custom enzyme development and production. Biosynth's robust service offerings are designed to support a broad array of life science research and development needs.

title: Center for Advanced Bioanalysis GmbH (CBL)
description:
Center for Advanced Bioanalysis GmbH (CBL) is a forward-thinking small business based in Linz, Oberösterreich, Austria. While the exact year of establishment remains unspecified, the company has carved a niche for itself in the realm of advanced bioanalysis, being recognized in the 1-10M TTM Revenue category.

Occupying a prominent location at 40 Gruberstraße Linz, CBL is deeply committed to the development of sensitive analysis methods. These methods are primarily designed for early detection of diseases and analysis of biological samples. The vision that drives the company is not just about creating tools; it's about reshaping the landscape of research, diagnostics, and drug development.

The mission of CBL is rooted in its vision. It is about delving deep into the molecular level to unravel an in-depth understanding of immunology and cancer biology. The company's aspiration is to offer its partners and customers unique solutions to their challenges. This is achieved through their expertise and the application of the latest biophysical analysis methods.

In other words, CBL is not just about business; it's about creating a better world through advanced bioanalysis. It's about turning visionary ideas into practical tools that can help detect diseases early, advance research, and facilitate drug development. Through their work, the Center for Advanced Bioanalysis GmbH is making a significant contribution to the field of immunology and cancer biology.

title: CoaChrom Diagnostica GmbH
description:
CoaChrom Diagnostica GmbH, established in 1994, is a mid-sized business based in Maria Enzersdorf, Vienna, Austria. As a dynamic and knowledge-oriented company, CoaChrom Diagnostica GmbH specializes in the development, production, and distribution of innovative and high-quality reagents used in haemostasis diagnostics. 

This established company has made it its mission to be a competent, progressive, and reliable partner in the field of coagulation and fibrinolysis. Their strategic orientation is not only to offer top-notch products but to provide information and solutions to both scientific and practice-oriented questions. 

With a revenue ranging between 10 to 100 million dollars, CoaChrom Diagnostica GmbH has proven its capability in the industry. The company's headquarters, located at Hauptstraße 5, Maria Enzersdorf, Vienna, 2344 Austria, are a testament to its solid presence in the market. 

Above all, CoaChrom Diagnostica GmbH prides itself on being the friendliest partner to its customers, a quality that sets it apart from competitors. This, combined with its commitment to innovation and quality, makes CoaChrom Diagnostica GmbH a notable player in the field of haemostasis diagnostics.

Chiesi Farmaceutici is a thriving player in the pharmaceutical industry, specializing in the development and discovery of new drugs. The company is also deeply involved in conducting clinical trials, contributing significantly to the progress and advancement of medical science and patient care. Its extensive international network is a testament to the global reach of Chiesi Farmaceutici's services and its commitment to innovation and excellence in the realm of pharmaceuticals. With over eight decades of experience, Chiesi Farmaceutici continues to be a dynamic force in the global pharmaceutical landscape, fostering advancements in healthcare worldwide.

title: Clinical Investigation Support
description:
Established in 1990, Clinical Investigation Support is a small-scale business enterprise with its headquarters nestled in the heart of Wien, Austria. Despite its compact scale, with its Time to Market (TTM) revenue falling between the range of 1-10 million, the company has made a significant impact in its field. 

The company's primary commitment is to the provision of support in the clinical sphere, with a particular emphasis on maintaining top-tier quality assurance. This focus on quality assurance sets Clinical Investigation Support apart from its counterparts, as it ensures that all services delivered meet the highest possible standards of efficiency and accuracy. 

The company operates primarily from its site located in Wien, Austria. This strategic location provides them with the unique opportunity to tap into the rich, scientific community of the region, thereby enhancing their capacity to deliver comprehensive clinical support. 

In the three decades since its inception, Clinical Investigation Support has cultivated a reputation for excellence and reliability. They have consistently demonstrated a steadfast commitment to their mission, thereby solidifying their standing in the industry. Despite being a small business, the company has shown that quality, dedication, and a keen focus on their niche can lead to substantial success.

title: Cyprumed
description:
Established in 2015 and headquartered in Obsteig, Tirol, Austria, Cyprumed is a dynamic startup in the pharmaceutical industry. With an annual revenue ranging between zero and one million, Cyprumed is steadily carving a niche for itself in the competitive field of drug delivery. The company operates from two sites in Austria, located at Lorettostrasse 26 2nd stage Hall in Tyrol and at 27 Kreidweg Obsteig, Tirol.

Cyprumed specializes in the development of innovative drug delivery systems, focusing on the oral and nasal delivery of therapeutic peptides and proteins. The company has secured a patent for its unique platform technology, which is used to formulate novel and generic biologics, including peptides and larger proteins. The distinct feature of Cyprumed’s delivery technology is its reliance on Generally Recognized as Safe (GRAS) excipients. These are substances added to medication to improve its usability, and Cyprumed ensures that all of its single excipients have monographs available as per the United States Pharmacopoeia (USP) and European Pharmacopoeia (EP).

In essence, Cyprumed is a promising startup committed to refining the drug delivery process through its patented technology, thereby enhancing the effectiveness of therapeutic peptides and proteins. Its use of GRAS excipients underlines its dedication to safety and quality.

title: Delta4 GmbH
description:
Delta4 GmbH, founded in 2019 and based in Vienna, Austria, is an innovative startup operating in the intersection of artificial intelligence and drug discovery. This young company offers a range of comprehensive services including bioinformatics, clinical data science and modeling, cloud computing, database management, and a wide array of discovery and translational capabilities. 

Delta4's primary expertise lies in the identification of undetected relationships between established drugs and diseases, with the goal of uncovering new therapeutic possibilities. At the heart of this operation is Hyper-C, a technologically advanced platform that harnesses the power of algorithmic intelligence to analyze vast amounts of data and generate unique insights. 

Functioning as a vast neural network, Hyper-C feeds on big data to construct intricate molecular models. These models are then subject to continuous refinement, effectively matching compounds to diseases to streamline biological testing and clinical trials. The result is a highly efficient process that allows Delta4 to provide a range of tailored solutions for its clients. 

Such solutions include finding new applications for existing drugs, identifying new drugs for specific conditions, ranking disease-modifying drug targets, predicting protein biomarkers, and providing detailed information on drug effects and side effects. 

Delta4's groundbreaking platform has already been tested by several major pharmaceutical organizations, demonstrating its capability and potential for transforming the drug discovery process. Delta4 GmbH is undoubtedly positioning itself as a trailblazer in the field of AI-based drug discovery.

title: Eurofins Genomics Europe
description:
Established in 1990, Eurofins Genomics Europe is a mid-sized business based in Ebersberg, Germany. The company has a substantial presence with sites spread across Germany, Denmark, and Austria. Eurofins Genomics Europe is a leading provider in DNA sequencing services, genotyping services, DNA synthesis products, and bioinformatics services, operating on an international scale with facilities in Europe, the USA, and Asia.

The company offers a comprehensive range of services, from research to application. This includes diverse genomic services such as Amplicon - HLA Typing, Antibody Sequencing, DNA Library Screening, and more. They also specialize in various forms of Sequencing, Biomarker Discovery, and Genomic DNA purification among other services. Eurofins Genomics Europe is committed to delivering reliable and highly-accurate results, supported by their lean-optimized lab processes.

The company's expertise expands to various industries including academics, pharmaceuticals, food, diagnostics, agriculture, and biotechnology. This makes them an ideal partner for not just standard research projects, but also complex strategies for large interdisciplinary companies.

Eurofins Genomics Europe holds prestigious certifications like Good Clinical Practice (GCP), Good Laboratory Practice (GLP), and the International Organization for Standards (ISO) 13485, 17025, and 9001:2015. These demonstrate the company's commitment to maintaining high standards of quality and reliability in its operations and services. They remain steadfast in their promise to deliver fast, complete, and reliable genomic services to their clients.

title: Favorgen Biotech Corporation
description:
Favorgen Biotech Corporation is a small-scale enterprise that specializes in the delivery of high-quality DNA/RNA extraction kits and other related consumables. Despite the company's relatively small size, with annual revenues falling between 1 and 10 million on a trailing twelve-month basis, it has a substantial impact in its field. Favorgen Biotech Corporation's commitment to excellence is evident in its extensive range of products, all designed to support and streamline the complex processes involved in DNA/RNA extraction.

The company is strategically located in the heart of Europe, at Shuttleworthstraße 19, Wien, 1210 Austria, enabling it to efficiently serve both local and international clients. Despite not having a specified year of establishment or a known corporate headquarters, Favorgen Biotech Corporation has managed to carve a niche for itself in the biotech industry and establish a strong presence in the market. 

Favorgen Biotech Corporation is a testament to the fact that size does not necessarily equate with influence or capability. With its focus on providing top-tier DNA/RNA extraction solutions, it has quickly become an indispensable partner for professionals navigating the intricate world of biotechnology.

title: Fresenius Kabi Product Partnering
description:
Fresenius Kabi Product Partnering is a small-scale enterprise that specializes in offering a variety of high-value services. Though it's a small business generating between 1 to 10 million TTM revenue, it has a substantial presence in several locations across Europe. Its headquarters are in Darmstadt, Hessen, Germany, with additional sites in Linz, Oberösterreich Austria, and Bad Homburg, HE Germany. The company also operates from multiple locations in Darmstadt, including Borkenberg 14 and Else-Kröner-Straße 1, and Linz, Upper Austria.

Fresenius Kabi Product Partnering stands out for its unique offering of services. It provides expert solutions in formulation and aseptic filling, which are crucial processes in many industries such as pharmaceuticals. In addition to these, the company also offers quality control services, ensuring the highest standards are met in every project they undertake.

Moreover, Fresenius Kabi Product Partnering provides specialized services in API synthesis and manufacturing. This makes it a valuable partner for businesses that require complex and high-quality API development and production.

Despite the lack of information about its year of establishment, Fresenius Kabi Product Partnering has proven to be a reliable and efficient service provider. Its diverse range of services and expansive presence across Europe highlight its commitment to delivering high-quality solutions and contributing to its clients' success.

title: F-star
description:
F-star is a nascent biopharmaceutical startup nestled in the heart of Wien, Austria. Despite its recent inception, the enterprise is already making significant strides in the medical field. The company's primary location can be found at 7 Schwarzenbergplatz in Wien's 1030 district.

The primary focus of F-star is the development of innovative bispecific antibody products. These products are designed with the aim of revolutionizing cancer treatment. The company's mission is to advance the standard of care for cancer patients by improving the efficacy of current treatments. 

This young enterprise, with its revenue currently within the 0-1M TTM bracket, is rapidly establishing itself as a significant player in the biopharmaceutical industry. Its unique approach to dealing with one of humanity's most persistent foes - cancer - sets it apart from other companies in the field. 

Despite its relative novelty in the industry, F-star is committed to bringing ground-breaking solutions to the forefront of cancer treatment. Its innovative focus on bispecific antibody products could potentially transform the way cancer is treated and managed, and it is this dedication that is driving the company forward. F-star is continuously working towards its vision of creating a healthier future for all.

title: Globopharm
description:
Established in 1978, Globopharm is a small-scale business, generating between 1-10M TTM revenue, with its headquarters nestled in the heart of Wien, Wien, AT. Over the years, the company has successfully built a strong reputation in the field of pharmaceuticals. 

Globopharm's primary site is located at Breitenfurter Straße 251 Wien, Wien, 1230 Austria. This strategic location allows them to work in close proximity with important stakeholders, thereby ensuring efficient and effective operations. 

At its core, Globopharm is dedicated to the development and manufacturing of pharmaceutical products. Their commitment to innovation and quality has enabled them to deliver top-notch products that contribute to the betterment of human health. 

Globopharm's services are not limited to just the creation of pharmaceutical products. They also provide comprehensive solutions that encompass the entire life cycle of a drug - from its initial development to its final manufacturing. This holistic approach allows them to meet the diverse needs of their clients, making them a reliable partner in the pharmaceutical industry. 

As part of their commitment to quality, Globopharm continuously strives to adhere to the highest standards in pharmaceutical manufacturing. This dedication to excellence is reflected in their products and services, reinforcing their position as a trusted name in the pharmaceutical industry. 

In summary, Globopharm's rich history, strategic location, comprehensive services, and commitment to quality make it a preferred choice for those seeking reliable pharmaceutical solutions.

title: Hiebler Agricultural Engineering
description:
Hiebler Agricultural Engineering is a small business, generating between 1 to 10 million TTM revenue, with its headquarters based in Steiermark, AT. It was established as a stand-alone agricultural consultancy on January 1, 1995, after its founder spent several years in the chemical industry and working as an official pesticide consultant. 

For the first two years, Hiebler Agricultural Engineering primarily focused on trials and tests in the fields of fruit and wine farming, expanding its scope in 1997 to include maize tests with the addition of another team member. They conduct field trials on their sites located in Styria, the main growing area for fruits and maize in Austria, and a significant wine-growing region. They also lease sites across Austria to ensure geographical diversity.

This wide geographic spread enables Hiebler Agricultural Engineering to select the most fitting location for investigating a specific pest at any given time. For instance, they can conduct trials in areas with high rainfall or in regions with drier climatic conditions, based on the requirements of the investigation. This flexibility allows them to adapt to various environmental factors, further enhancing the quality and reliability of their tests and trials.

title: Horizon Discovery Biosciences Limited
description:
Horizon Discovery Biosciences Limited, headquartered in Waterbeach, Cambridge, UK, is a mid-sized business established in 2007. The company operates additional sites in Vienna, Austria and Cambridge, Massachusetts, USA. 

Horizon Discovery is recognized for its expertise in cell line engineering, RNA synthesis, and bioinformatic design. The company offers an extensive range of services which include 3D Cell Culture, Animal Model Development, Bioinformatics Consulting, and Biomarker Services amongst others. They also specialize in advanced techniques such as CRISPR, Cell Line Characterization and Construction, Genome Editing, and High Throughput Screening. 

The company's certifications include ISO 13485, ISO 9001, and ISO 9001:2015. These certifications reflect their commitment to maintaining high-quality standards, ensuring customer satisfaction, and meeting regulatory requirements.

Horizon Discovery's services are instrumental in three key areas of the therapeutic ecosystem: basic research, drug discovery and development, and therapeutic applications. The company has engineered BioProduction cell lines designed for efficient biologics manufacturing and provides Screening & Cell line engineering services designed to improve drug discovery outcomes. 

The company boasts a diverse customer base, including biopharmaceutical and diagnostics companies, contract research and manufacturing organizations, and academic researchers worldwide. Horizon Discovery serves over 2,000 unique customers in more than 60 countries, including 19 of the top 20 biopharmaceutical companies by revenue. 

As part of Revvity, Horizon Discovery continues to revolutionize healthcare by providing health science solutions, technologies, and services that span the spectrum from discovery to development and diagnosis to cure. The company maintains a specialized focus on translational multi-omics technologies, biomarker identification, imaging, prediction, screening, detection, diagnosis, and informatics.

title: Innovacell Biotechnologie
description:
Innovacell Biotechnologie, situated in the heart of Innsbruck, Tyrol, Austria, is a small-scale business that generates between 1 to 10 million dollars in trailing twelve-month revenue. The company's primary focus is the development of personalized cell therapies, with a particular emphasis on the treatment of urinary incontinence. 

Despite its small size, Innovacell Biotechnologie is on the forefront of groundbreaking research and development in cell therapy. Its headquarters, located at 24 Mitterweg in Innsbruck, Tyrol, serves as both the administrative hub and the research center for the company. 

The primary service offered by Innovacell Biotechnologie is the development of personalized cell therapies. By harnessing the power of modern biotechnology, they are pioneering the use of tailored therapies to address a pervasive and often overlooked medical concern - urinary incontinence. Their innovative approach is a testament to the company's dedication to improving patient outcomes, and their location in Innsbruck allows for collaboration with local research institutions and medical professionals. 

While the company's year of establishment isn't explicitly stated, their work speaks volumes about their experience and commitment in this highly specialized field. Despite being categorized as a small business, Innovacell Biotechnologie's groundbreaking work is making a significant impact in the biotechnology industry and the lives of those affected by urinary incontinence.

title: Inte:Ligand
description:

Despite its relatively small scale, with a total through the year (TTM) revenue between 1 and 10 million, the company has managed to make a significant impact on the industry. 

Inte:Ligand specializes in a range of niche services, including not only pharmacore development and modeling but also lead structure optimization. This particular service is integral for enhancing the efficacy and safety of drugs, thereby playing a crucial role in the pharmaceutical industry. 

Additionally, Inte:Ligand has expertise in virtual compound library generation. This innovative approach to chemistry and pharmacology allows for the efficient creation and testing of new compounds in a virtual environment, significantly reducing both costs and time.

The company's proficiency in virtual screening services is another notable feature. This technique, used to search libraries of compounds, enables the rapid identification of active structures and significantly accelerates the drug discovery process.

title: Innsbruck Medical University
description:
Innsbruck Medical University is a distinguished academic core facility situated in the heart of Innsbruck, Tirol, Austria. It is an illustrious institution recognized for its superior contributions in various domains such as education, research, science, and patient care. Along with its associated university hospital, the organization strives to be the premier hub of medical expertise in Western Austria.

The university prides itself on its highly skilled educators who are committed to delivering top-tier training to their students. The faculty is engaged in forward-thinking research, particularly in the areas of oncology, neurosciences, immunology, and infectiology. Their remarkable findings consistently receive global recognition and are published in esteemed scientific journals.

Innsbruck Medical University is set on a path of continuous growth and development. It is dedicated to expanding its science campus and focusing on pioneering research. An additional aspect of its mission is to foster an environment that encourages scholarly interaction. This involves promoting scientific exchange programs with other leading European universities to ignite collaborative innovation and further enhance its academic stature.

The university's location at 52 Innrain in Innsbruck, Tirol, adds to its unique charm, nestled in the beautiful landscape of Austria, making it a compelling destination for students and researchers alike. Through its commitment to excellence in all aspects, Innsbruck Medical University continues to forge its path as a beacon of medical education and research.

title: Innsbruck Medical University, Department for Biomedical Physics
description:
The Department for Biomedical Physics at Innsbruck Medical University is an academic core facility based in Innsbruck, Tirol, Austria. This prestigious institution does not have a defined year of establishment, denoting its long-standing history in the field of biomedical physics. 

The department primarily focuses on the development of new methods in optical micro-manipulation and optical microscopy. They have particular expertise in computer-generated holography, utilizing advanced spatial light modulators. This facet of their work is primarily applied to answer complex biomedical questions, showcasing their dedication to the advancement of medical science.

Furthermore, the Department for Biomedical Physics holds a keen interest in the various aspects of solar radiation, with a specific emphasis on the ultraviolet (UV) spectral range that is most relevant for humans and the biosphere. They are committed to the development of spectroradiometric instruments and analysis techniques. 

The department also plays a crucial role in measuring solar radiation spectra and aerosol optical depth, both in Innsbruck and during dedicated campaigns. They are responsible for operating the Austrian UV measurement network, further illustrating their integral role in the field of biomedical physics.

Situated at 52 Innrain Innsbruck, Tirol, 6020 Austria, the department invites innovation and discovery within its esteemed walls, making significant contributions to the field of biomedical physics.

title: Institute of Science and Technology Austria (IST Austria)
description:
The Institute of Science and Technology Austria (IST Austria) is a vibrant, international institute focused on fostering fundamental research and graduate education within the natural and mathematical sciences. Nestled in the beautiful city of Klosterneuburg, on the periphery of Vienna, the institute is characterized by its youthful energy and commitment to expanding the horizons of scientific knowledge. 

The institute was brought to life via a joint initiative between the federal government of Austria and the provincial government of Lower Austria and ceremonially opened its doors to the scientific community in 2009. IST Austria has set ambitious growth plans and anticipates hosting around 90 research groups by 2026. 

At the heart of the institute's operations is an unwavering commitment to maintain its independence and safeguard its freedom from any political and commercial influences. The governance and management structures have been meticulously designed to uphold these principles. The institute is under the stewardship of the President, whose appointment is facilitated by the Board of Trustees and guided by the Scientific Board. The inaugural President of IST Austria was Thomas A. Henzinger, a distinguished computer scientist and former professor of the University of California at Berkeley and the EPFL Lausanne in Switzerland. 

As a small business entity with an annual revenue of 1-10 million, IST Austria stands as a testament to the potency of dedicated research and the pursuit of scientific excellence.

sites.name: Institute of Science and Technology Austria (IST Austria)

title: innoPhore
description:
Established in 2018 and headquartered in Graz, Austria, innoPhore is a small yet promising bioinformatics firm. Operating within the revenue range of 1-10M TTM, the company has carved a niche for itself in the realm of bioinformatics, compound docking, discovery computational chemistry, data science and modeling, and discovery machine learning/AI. 

InnoPhore's primary goal is to pinpoint and cultivate high-value industrial and therapeutic enzymes. These enzymes play a pivotal role in augmenting the efficiency of 'green' chemical production processes, thus contributing to an eco-friendly industrial environment. Boasting a robust portfolio of services, the company is also proficient in protein binding, protein interaction, protein structure, protein targets, structural chemistry, and virtual screening. 

Moreover, innoPhore's proprietary 3D point-cloud Catalophore™ technology gives it a competitive edge in the market. This groundbreaking technology is not only instrumental in discovering novel biosimilars for medical treatments but also plays a key role in drug repurposing and side-effect prediction. 

With its strategic location at Am Eisernen Tor 3 Graz, 8010 Austria, innoPhore continues to shape the future of bioinformatics, making significant strides in the realm of green chemical production and medical treatments. The company's unwavering commitment to leveraging technology for environmental protection and medical advancement positions it as a dynamic and innovative player in its field.

title: JOANNEUM RESEARCH Forschungsgesellschaft mbH
description:
JOANNEUM RESEARCH Forschungsgesellschaft mbH is a prominent publicly owned research organization headquartered in Graz, Steiermark, Austria. This mid-sized business, with a revenue between 10-100M TTM, is a well-established entity in the field of medical research and health-related disciplines, straddling the intersection of technology and medicine.

The company's primary clients include pharmaceutical companies spread across various sectors such as R&D, early development, translational, and manufacturing, in addition to biotech and medical device companies. Committed to meeting industry needs, JOANNEUM RESEARCH has acquired various certifications including Good Laboratory Practice (GLP), International Organization for Standards 13485 (ISO 13485), International Organization for Standards 14001 (ISO 14001), and International Organization for Standards 9001:2015 (ISO 9001:2015).

The company offers a wide array of services, such as Bioequivalence Studies, Bioinformatics, Biomarker Analytical and Clinical Validation, Biostatistical Design, Clinical Research, and many more. They are also proficient in Metabolite Identification, Metabolomics Biomarker Discovery, Pharmacokinetic Studies, Protein Binding, and Real-World Evidence among other specializations.

JOANNEUM RESEARCH's areas of expertise extend to preclinical and clinical studies, bioequivalence testing for topical generics, bioanalysis, pharmaceutical analysis, targeted and untargeted metabolomics, data management for clinical studies, biostatistics for clinical studies, and the development of Clinical Decision Support systems. 

This organization is a formidable presence in the field of medical research and healthcare, offering a comprehensive suite of services and solutions that cater to a wide range of industry needs.

Situated in the heart of Austria at Nikolaiplatz 4/II Graz, KML Vision, despite being a new entrant in the market, is already carving a name for itself in the industry. title: Lifeprint
description:
Lifeprint, a small-scale business headquartered in Villach-Land, Kärnten, Austria, specializes in providing a range of niche services within the biotechnology sector. Despite the company's modest size, with an annual turnover between 1-10 million dollars, it has made significant strides in its respective field. 

Located on Industriestraße 12, Lifeprint's primary services are centered around plant-DNA analysis and DNA sequence detection. These services have numerous applications, ranging from agricultural research to genetic engineering. 

In addition to these core services, Lifeprint also provides food tests, aiding in quality control, food safety, and regulatory compliance. These tests are integral in maintaining high standards in the food and beverage industry, ensuring consumer safety, and upholding the integrity of products in the market.

However, Lifeprint's edge lies in its assays for genetic modification. This service caters to the rapidly growing sphere of genetically modified organisms, providing precise and reliable results. 

To summarize, Lifeprint, although a small business, is a significant player in the biotechnology industry. With its array of specialized services, it plays a crucial role in areas such as genetic research, food safety, and the realm of genetically modified organisms, contributing to advancements within these sectors.

title: Lipomed
description:
Lipomed is a small-scale business headquartered in Arlesheim, Basel-Landschaft, Switzerland, with a reputation for its noteworthy contribution to the healthcare sector. Despite the company's modest size, with a total through-the-year revenue ranging from one to ten million, Lipomed has made its presence known on a global scale. 

The company boasts an impressive network of sites spanning across three different countries: the United States, Austria, and Germany. These include an establishment at 1 Broadway Cambridge, Massachusetts, in the United States, another at Twin Tower Wien in Austria, one at Hegenheimer Straße 2 in Freiburg, Baden-Württemberg, Germany, and the main hub at Fabrikmattenweg 4 in Arlesheim, Basel-Landschaft, Switzerland. 

Lipomed's primary focus is on the provision of reference standards and pharmaceuticals. The company has carved a niche for itself by specializing in the treatment of rare diseases. This specialization sets Lipomed apart from many other businesses within the healthcare and pharmaceutical industries. These unique qualities, coupled with the firm's commitment to delivering high-quality services, make Lipomed a significant player in the global pharmaceutical industry. Despite the absence of a stated year of establishment, Lipomed remains a force to be reckoned with in its sector.

title: Myllia Biotechnology
description:
Myllia Biotechnology, established in 2018, operates from its headquarters in Vienna, Austria. As a small business with 1-10M TTM revenue, it holds a prominent position in the global biotech market. The company is well-known for its specialized services that encompass Assay Development, Biomarker Discovery, CRISPR, Cell-Based Assays, and much more. 

Myllia Biotechnology's innovative approach primarily revolves around the use of the CROP-Seq (CRISPR Droplet Sequencing) workflow. This method effectively creates a paradigm for next-generation CRISPR screens by mapping the impact of many genetic perturbations on the global transcriptome at a single-cell resolution. This powerful approach finds broad applications in identifying novel drug targets, elucidating unknown drug mechanisms, and understanding genetic variants linked to disease risk.

The company forms partnerships with biotech and pharma companies worldwide and conducts high-throughput CRISPR screens in cancer cells or primary human T cells on a fee-for-service basis. All CRISPR screens, whether using CRISPR KO, CRISPR interference or CRISPR activation workflows, are tailored to meet the specific needs of clients. This includes offering various read-outs such as fitness, FACS, flow cytometry, CITE-seq, and single-cell transcriptomics. It also provides computational biology analysis of NGS data.

Myllia Biotechnology offers an end-to-end workflow, from initial project design to wet-lab screening and the analysis of NGS data. The company takes pride in providing data that is fully owned by clients, ensuring no royalties or strings attached. With its commitment to innovation and client satisfaction, Myllia Biotechnology is a trustworthy partner in the field of biotechnology.

title: Lexogen
description:
Lexogen is an established mid-sized business that has been providing innovative solutions in the field of RNA analysis and Next Generation Sequencing (NGS) since 2007. With its headquarters located in Wien, Austria, and a significant presence in Greenland, New Hampshire, USA, Lexogen has successfully made a global impact in the biotechnology industry. 

The company specializes in a wide array of services including Bioinformatics, Biomarker Services, DNA/RNA Extraction & Purification, and much more. With a commitment to innovation, Lexogen has developed unique technologies like 3’ mRNA-Seq, adopted by thousands of researchers globally, marking a significant breakthrough in the field. The company also offers comprehensive solutions for NGS sequencing, which includes everything from experimental design to bioinformatics analysis.

Notably, Lexogen is certified as a Small Business (SB) in the United States. This certification is a testament to its robust business model and its capacity to deliver top-notch biotechnology services. Furthermore, Lexogen extends its expertise to provide specialized services such as Single Cell RNA Sequencing, Whole Genome Sequencing, and miRNA sequencing, among others. 

The company's ability to offer fully customizable NGS Services distinguishes it from its competitors, making it a reliable partner for researchers and scientists worldwide. By providing end-to-end solutions for RNA analysis, Lexogen is at the forefront of advancing scientific research and contributing to groundbreaking discoveries in the field of genomics and transcriptomics.
