title: MUW Biobank
description:
MUW Biobank, a small business based in Vienna, Austria, stands as an essential bridge between basic and clinical research. Their primary objective is to discover new diagnostic, prognostic, predictive biomarkers, risk markers, and therapeutic strategies. This aim not only enhances the medical community's ability to treat diseases but also deepens the understanding of disease etiology and pathogenesis. 

Operating as a service center at the Medical University of Vienna, MUW Biobank strongly adheres to the principles of "Good Scientific Practice" and is deeply committed to academia. They firmly believe that excellence in clinical research can only be achieved by maintaining high ethical standards. Therefore, obtaining informed consent is a strict prerequisite for any individual's inclusion in a project associated with MUW Biobank. 

Moreover, the organization emphasizes responsible use of the provided biological material and is committed to protecting the privacy of the subjects involved. Despite the lack of a specific year of establishment, MUW Biobank has demonstrated its significant contribution to the medical field, particularly in Vienna, Austria, where it operates. Through its operations and commitment to research, the MUW Biobank has proven its worth as a small business within the 1-10M TTM revenue bracket.

title: Max F. Perutz Laboratories
description:
Max F. Perutz Laboratories, situated at the heart of Campus Vienna Biocenter, is a small-scale business generating revenue between 1 to 10 million. Despite its modest size, the laboratory makes a significant impact in the field of biological sciences with its state-of-the-art facilities. 

Located in Dr.-Bohr-Gasse, Vienna, Austria, the laboratory provides a unique environment for fostering scientific discoveries and advancements. The laboratory's core areas of expertise include cell signaling, infection biology, RNA biology, computational biology, and structural biology. 

The dedicated team of experts at Max F. Perutz Laboratories leverages their skills to conduct in-depth research in these domains. The focus on cell signaling is aimed at understanding how cells communicate with each other, essential knowledge in the development of treatments for numerous diseases. 

In the realm of infection biology, the laboratory seeks to unravel the mechanisms of infectious diseases, contributing to the global effort to combat them. The RNA biology research focuses on the roles, functions, and regulation of RNA in cells, a vital aspect of genetic research. 

The computational biology branch uses advanced algorithms, data analysis, and simulation methods to understand biological systems, while structural biology aims to visualize molecules to understand biochemical processes. 

In summary, Max F. Perutz Laboratories is a small yet influential entity in the biological research landscape, with a commitment to advancing knowledge in several key scientific areas.

description:
The Medical University of Vienna - Genomics Core is an esteemed Academic Core Facility nestled in the heart of Wien, Austria. While its establishment date remains unknown, the institution's significant contributions to the field of genomics are undeniable. Strategically situated at 23 Spitalgasse Wien, 1090 Austria, it has become a vital center for advanced genetic studies.

The Genomics Core Facility primarily functions as a service unit dedicated to unraveling the genetic underpinnings of prevalent diseases. It accomplishes this through the utilization of high-throughput analyses, an innovative approach that allows for the simultaneous examination of numerous genetic sequences, thereby accelerating the pace of research and discovery.

As a leading player in the realm of genomics, the Medical University of Vienna - Genomics Core is committed to pushing the boundaries of what is currently known about the genetic causes of diseases. Its ground-breaking research and specialized services have made it an indispensable asset in the global effort to understand, prevent, and ultimately cure widespread diseases. 

In essence, the Genomics Core is not just an academic institution but an entity that bridges the gap between genetic research and real-world applications, transforming the way we understand and address various diseases at the genetic level. Through its efforts, it continues to shape the future of medicine and health, one genetic sequence at a time.

description:

In addition to its testing services, Mycoplasma Biosafety also provides culture media and reference standard products specifically designed for mycoplasma testing. The company assists clients not only with tests but also with process and test validations, ensuring a comprehensive approach to mycoplasma detection and control.

title: Molinspiration Cheminformatics
description:
Molinspiration Cheminformatics is a small business enterprise situated in the picturesque locale of Šentilj, Slovenia. Although the company does not have a disclosed establishment date, it has managed to carve a niche for itself in the domain of cheminformatics. The company operates from its site located in Nova ulica, Šentilj, and falls within the revenue bracket of 1 to 10 million dollars, denoting its status as a small business entity.

Molinspiration Cheminformatics specializes in providing unique services in the realm of cheminformatics. The company's expertise lies in offering virtual in silico screening and structure analysis services to its clientele. This involves the application of computational and informational techniques to a range of chemical problems and data, allowing for more efficient and precise solutions.

The company's services are pivotal in the process of drug discovery, pharmaceutical research, and in the broader chemical industry. By providing in silico screening, Molinspiration Cheminformatics sets the stage for initial testing of compounds in a virtual environment, thereby significantly reducing the time and resources spent on early-stage drug discovery.

In conclusion, Molinspiration Cheminformatics stands as a noteworthy player in the cheminformatics industry. With its specialized services and strategic location, the company continues to make significant contributions to the fields of pharmaceutical research and chemical analysis.

title: Microsynth AG
description:
Established in 1989, Microsynth AG is a mid-sized business (with 10-100M TTM Revenue) headquartered in Vienna, Austria. The company is well-known and respected in the field of DNA/RNA synthesis and analysis. With additional sites in Austria, Germany, and Switzerland, Microsynth AG offers a broad range of services that include De Novo Genome Sequencing, Exome Sequencing, Genomic DNA Purification, Metagenomic Sequencing, NGS: Next Generation Sequencing, Oligo Synthesis, RNA Extraction, RNA oligo synthesis, SELEX, Sanger Sequencing, Targeted Sequencing/Resequencing, Whole Genome Sequencing, mRNA synthesis, qPCR Analysis, shRNA Synthesis, and siRNA Synthesis.

Microsynth AG operates within three primary business areas. The first is DNA/RNA synthesis, which covers the development of DNA/RNA oligos and probes for research and development, antisense oligos for drug discovery, and DNA oligos for diagnostic applications. The second business area focuses on DNA/RNA analysis and sequencing, including Sanger sequencing, NGS sequencing, PCR, qPCR, digital PCR, genotyping, and DNA/RNA isolation. The third business area involves contract research and outsourcing, which includes assay development, assay validation, biological testing, and gene editing/gene therapy.

With a dedicated team of approximately 60 employees at its Balgach, Switzerland headquarters, Microsynth AG holds certifications in Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP), International Organization for Standards 13485 (ISO 13485), International Organization for Standards 17025 (ISO 17025), and International Organization for Standards 9001:2015 (ISO 9001:2015). The company's dedication to quality and innovation has positioned it as a leader in its field across Europe.

title: NBS-C BioScience
description:
Established in the vibrant city of Vienna, Austria, NBS-C BioScience is a small business that specializes in the intricate field of bioassays. With its primary location at 69 Brunner Straße in Vienna, the company has positioned itself as an essential player in the life sciences industry.

While the exact year of its establishment isn't specified, NBS-C BioScience has successfully carved out a niche for itself in the market, achieving a commendable annual revenue of 1 to 10 million dollars. Despite its small size, the company's influence and expertise are far-reaching.

NBS-C BioScience primarily offers assay development services, a crucial process in drug discovery and biological research. The company's main focus lies in target identification and validation, ensuring the accuracy and reliability of the assays they develop. Their work aids in the identification of suitable drug targets, contributing significantly to the development of effective treatments.

In addition, NBS-C BioScience provides Surface Plasmon Resonance (SPR) and Enzyme-Linked Immunosorbent Assay (ELISA) services. SPR is a powerful technique for measuring the interaction of molecules, while ELISA is a popular test that detects and measures antibodies in the blood. These services further enhance the company's repertoire, making it an invaluable resource in the field of bioscience.

NBS-C BioScience is more than just a company; it's a beacon of innovation, contributing to the growth and development of life sciences with each project it undertakes.

The company's commitment to their field of expertise is evident in their advanced approach and the high-quality output they consistently deliver. Their strategies and techniques are a testament to their dedication and passion, which have set them apart in this highly specialized field. 

In summary, ORIDIS Biomarkers, with its almost two decades of experience and dedication, offers a unique blend of scientific acumen and business prowess. Their work in the field of tissue-based cancer research and biomarker development continues to make notable contributions to the global healthcare industry.

title: Octapharma
description:
Octapharma is a pioneering entity in the health sector, vested with the responsibility of developing and producing medicines. Its innovative approach entails the use of human proteins in the production of these medicines. The production process involves the use of human cell lines, which are carefully selected and cultured to ensure the highest quality. 

Additionally, Octapharma maintains a steady supply of human plasma, primarily sourced from its own plasma donation centers. These centers follow strict protocols and guidelines to ensure that the plasma used in the production process is safe and of the highest quality. The company also leverages plasma from external sources, broadening its resource base to meet the growing demand. 

Octapharma's commitment is to provide quality, safe, and effective medicines. The company's use of human proteins and plasma in the production process is a testament to its innovative approach to medicine development. Through this method, Octapharma ensures the production of medicines that are not only effective but also well-tolerated by the human body. 

While the company does not specify its establishment year, headquarters, or company type, its unique approach to medicine production sets it apart in the health sector. The organization's innovative use of human proteins and plasma demonstrates its commitment to advancing healthcare provision and improving patient outcomes.

title: Opgen Inc
description:
Established in 2020, Opgen Inc is a small business with offices located in Rockville, Maryland, USA, and Vienna, Austria. The company, with its extensive services, serves as a revolutionary platform in the field of rapid molecular detection of severe infectious diseases. Its innovative solutions are designed to provide clinicians with actionable data to enhance patient outcomes, infection prevention, control, and antibiotic stewardship.

Opgen Inc's genomics offering includes the ARES isolate sequencing service (ARESiss), available in both its American and Austrian labs. This service is complemented by ARESid, a 16S/ITS amplicon metagenomic sequencing solution for pathogen identification, and ARESupa, a culture-free universal pathogenome assay employed for comprehensive AMR marker screening of native patient and environmental samples.

This small, yet dynamic company also offers AREScloud, a user-friendly web application designed for AMR surveillance and outbreak analysis. Powered by the proprietary AMR reference database, ARESdb, it includes microbial sequences with annotated AMR biomarkers covering resistance genes and mutations. This function enables the AI-powered prediction of phenotypic resistance directly from genome data. 

The company's broad range of services also includes Amplicon 16s rRNA Sequencing, Bioinformatics, Biostatistical Design, Discovery Computational Systems Biology, Machine Learning/AI, Metagenomic Sequencing, Metagenomics Data Analysis, Microbiome Data Analysis, and Microbiome Services. With its commitment to innovation and effective solutions, Opgen Inc is truly a game-changer in its field.

title: Polymun Scientific GmbH
description:
Established in 1992 and headquartered in Klosterneuburg, Niederösterreich, Austria, Polymun Scientific GmbH is a family-owned small business with revenues in the range of 1-10 million. The company, originally founded by Prof. Hermann Katinger, specializes in the development and manufacturing of biopharmaceuticals, with a particular focus on mammalian cell technology and innovative liposome technology. They also have a significant presence in the creation of liposomal drug formats for contract partners.

Polymun Scientific GmbH's revenue streams are mainly from contract development and manufacturing. The earnings are then reinvested into the development of their proprietary product pipeline and enhancement of their technology platforms. Their research and development projects and technologies are available for co-development and licensing.

The company operates in compliance with the current Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP) guidelines and holds an Austrian production license for pharmaceuticals, adhering to the EU requirements for drug manufacturing. Their last inspection by the Austrian regulatory authority AGES on behalf of the European Medicines Agency (EMA) took place in June 2015 and by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) in October 2013.

Polymun Scientific GmbH has a strong commitment to applying their drug delivery platform across all types of pharmaceutically active ingredients. Keeping industrial applicability in scale and price at the forefront, they ensure a common focus across all projects and technologies.

Its primary sites of operation are located at Biochemiestraße 10, Kufstein, Tirol, Austria, and Industriestraße 25, Villach-Land, Kärnten, Austria. 

Sandoz has carved a niche for itself in the pharmaceutical industry with its comprehensive range of services. The company specializes in the production of Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients (API) intermediates, which are key components in the manufacture of medicines. In addition to this, Sandoz also provides peptide and protein synthesis services for the healthcare sector. 

Moreover, Sandoz is known for its production of generic pharmaceuticals, offering cost-effective solutions without compromising on the quality of the products. Its scale-up services make it an ideal partner for businesses looking to expand their operations. 

In a nutshell, Sandoz brings a blend of expertise, innovation, and commitment to its operations, underlining its position as a reliable player in the pharmaceutical industry. The company continues to make strides in its field, fuelled by a dedication to providing high-quality, affordable healthcare solutions.

title: QPS
description:
QPS, established in 1995, is a mid-sized global contract research organization (CRO) dedicated to delivering a wide array of discovery, preclinical, and clinical drug development services. Headquartered in Newark, DE, US, QPS also operates out of multiple sites including Grambach, Austria; Newark, Delaware, US; Hyderabad, India; Taipei City, Taiwan; and Groningen, Netherlands. 

The company offers top-tier research and development services with a focus on Toxicology, DMPK, Bioanalysis, and Translational Medicine, along with Clinical Trials and Clinical Research Services. QPS's range of services include, but are not limited to, absorption studies, behavioral testing models, biostatistical design, clinical research, drug distribution studies, genotyping, histopathology, in vitro and in vivo pharmacokinetics, and metabolic stability. 

Over the years, QPS has grown from a small bioanalysis firm to a full-service CRO with more than 1100 employees across the US, Europe, and Asia. Through continuous enhancements in resources and capacities, QPS maintains its commitment to provide superior quality, skilled performance, and trusted service to its valued clients.

QPS holds numerous certifications that reflect its commitment to high standards of practice. These include the Assessment and Accreditation of Laboratory Animal Care (AAALAC), Biosafety Levels 1 and 2 (BSL 1, BSL 2), Clinical Laboratory Improvement Amendments (CLIA), Good Clinical Practice (GCP), Good Laboratory Practice (GLP), and the Office of Laboratory Animal Welfare (OLAW). Notably, in 2020, QPS added CLIA-certified and GLP-compliant laboratories that are equipped to support coronavirus testing assays and vaccine and therapy development programs.

title: Research Center Pharmaceutical Engineering GmbH (RCPE GmbH)
description:
Research Center Pharmaceutical Engineering GmbH (RCPE GmbH) is a mid-sized business founded in 2008 and headquartered in Graz, Steiermark, Austria. With a focus on process and product optimization within the pharmaceutical landscape, this esteemed company is dedicated to conducting innovative research and development projects. RCPE GmbH aims at enhancing the competitive edge and economic success of its partners, helping them develop groundbreaking products and production processes.

The company's main focus is on the development of novel drug delivery systems, the manufacturing processes involved, and their monitoring. It offers a wide range of services, including API Physical Characteristics, API Stress Testing Studies, API and Drug Product Stability Testing, Accelerated Stability, Analytical Development and Validation, Discovery Machine Learning/AI, Drug Formulation, and Thermal Analysis, among others.

The high standard of quality and customer orientation within all areas of RCPE GmbH's operations is reflected in its certifications. The company implemented a quality management system in the field of "Research and Development in Pharmaceutical Science and Pharmaceutical Process Engineering," earning it an ISO 9001 certification in 2015 from TÜV AUSTRIA GmbH. The subsequent year, RCPE GmbH demonstrated its commitment to environmental protection and energy-efficient resource utilization, earning an ISO 14001 certification. This makes it a reliable partner for industry collaborations, with a commitment to quality, innovation, and sustainability at its core.

title: Research Institute of Molecular Pathology
description:
The Research Institute of Molecular Pathology is a small business with an annual revenue ranging from 1 to 10 million dollars. Though the exact year of establishment and headquarters location are not specified, it is known to operate from Dr.-Bohr-Gasse in Vienna, Austria. 

This institute is particularly dedicated to advancing knowledge in various scientific domains. Its primary focus lies in conducting extensive research in molecular biology, cellular biology, circuit neuroscience, and diseases. Through this multi-disciplinary approach, the Research Institute of Molecular Pathology not only contributes to a broader understanding of these fields but also fosters an environment for scientific discovery and innovation. 

The institute's work is instrumental in uncovering the intricacies of molecular and cellular mechanisms, exploring the complexities of the neural circuits, and understanding the basis of diseases. With a strong commitment to scientific excellence, the Research Institute of Molecular Pathology continues to be an active player in global research efforts, pushing the boundaries of biomedical science.

title: Research Institute of Molecular Pathology IMP (Institut für molekulare Pathologie GmbH)
description:
The Research Institute of Molecular Pathology (IMP), officially known as Institut für molekulare Pathologie GmbH, is a premier research institution that is renowned for its foundational research work in molecular biology. Established in 1985 and headquartered in Vienna, Austria, the IMP is a small business, generating between 1-10M TTM Revenue. 

The IMP houses 15 research groups that include scientists from over 40 nations, who are dedicated to addressing critical questions in molecular biology. The institute is primarily funded by Boehringer Ingelheim, allowing researchers the freedom to conduct curiosity-driven biomedical research without constraint. 

As a part of the Vienna Biocenter (VBC), the IMP is part of one of Europe's most extensive life science hubs, home to 1400 researchers. This vibrant community has been addressing significant research areas since its inception, including molecular and cellular biology; structural biology and biochemistry; gene expression and chromosome biology; stem cell biology and development; immunology and cancer; and neuroscience.

In their quest for knowledge, IMP's scientists utilize the latest methodologies and equipment in molecular genetics, imaging, biochemistry, and structural biology across a range of model systems. This is made possible by the cutting-edge core facilities available to all research groups at no cost. The IMP's research initiatives are backed by an annual budget of approximately 28 million Euros, reflecting its commitment to driving advancements in biomedical research. The IMP is located at Campus-Vienna-Biocenter 1, Vienna, 1030 Austria.

sites.name: Research Institute of Molecular Pathology IMP (Institut für molekulare Pathologie GmbH)

title: Ribbon Biolabs
description:
Ribbon Biolabs, established in 2018, is a burgeoning startup in the synthetic biology industry, headquartered in Philadelphia, PA, with additional sites in Vienna, Austria. The company's cutting-edge focus lies in the assembly of intricate, highly precise DNA molecules. 

What sets Ribbon Biolabs apart is its unique integration of advanced algorithmics, biochemistry, and adaptable automation via its proprietary InfiniSynth® platform. This convergence of technology and science enables the production of DNA characterized by unparalleled accuracy and complexity.

The range of services offered by Ribbon Biolabs is extensive and highly specialized, catering to the needs of the scientific community. These services include bacterial and insect expression, cloning and subcloning, DNA products, fusion proteins, gene synthesis, genomic DNA cloning, and cDNA cloning & subcloning. 

Ribbon Biolabs' innovative approach allows customers to order linear, adapter-free double-stranded DNA up to 12 kilobases (kb) and clonal plasmid DNA up to 20 kb. This pioneering service underscores Ribbon Biolabs' commitment to pushing the boundaries of synthetic biology, asserting its position as a trailblazer in this rapidly evolving field. 

Despite being relatively new to the market, Ribbon Biolabs is already making significant strides in its niche, demonstrating the potential to reshape the landscape of synthetic biology in the coming years.

title: Siesta Group
description:
Established in 2002, Siesta Group is a small business that specializes in supporting the investigation of sleep, wakefulness, and brain activity in clinical trials and research. With its headquarters situated in Wien, Austria, Siesta Group is a highly reputed service provider in its niche market. The company's expertise expands across high-quality services such as polysomnography (PSG), pharmaco-electroencephalography (pharmaco-EEG), and event-related potentials (ERP). 

As a comprehensive service provider, Siesta Group has solidified its place in the industry, offering invaluable assistance in the field of sleep study and brain activity research. The company's main site is located at 11 Schloßhofer Straße, in the heart of Wien, where the team of professionals strive for excellence and continuous advancement in their field. 

With a track record of nearly two decades, Siesta Group has grown into a trusted name in the realm of clinical trials and research, particularly in the specialized areas of PSG, pharmaco-EEG, and ERP. Despite its classification as a small business with an annual revenue between 1-10M, Siesta Group has made significant contributions to the field and continues to uphold its commitment to aiding in the understanding and advancement of sleep and brain activity research.

title: Szabo-Scandic HmbH
description:

With its headquarters situated in Wien, Austria, this company has a rich history spanning over six decades in the Austrian Life Science Marketplace. As a prominent trade and service partner for medical and laboratory products in Austria, Szabo-Scandic HmbH specializes in the distribution and maintenance of consumables, research products, laboratory instruments, and specific diagnostic products. 

The company has an impressive portfolio of over 1.7 million products and a plethora of services. Its offerings range from Human Biological Samples (HBS), Human Blood, Human Buffy Coats, Human Cell Products, Human Leukopaks, Human Peripheral Blood Mononuclear Cells (PBMCs), Human Plasma, Human Red Blood Cells, Human Serum, Human Umbilical Cord Blood, to Human Whole Blood. 

Szabo-Scandic HmbH's primary site is located on Quellenstrasse 110 in Wien, Austria. The consistent growth and success of the company can be attributed to its extensive experience and expertise in the field. The company's reputation as a leading small business in the industry with a revenue range of 1-10M TTM is a testament to its commitment to quality and customer satisfaction. Moreover, it continues to demonstrate its strength through its innovative solutions and comprehensive services in the field of medical and laboratory products.

title: Scantox A/S
description:
Established in 1977, Scantox A/S is a mid-sized enterprise headquartered in Lille Skensved, Denmark, with additional sites in Austria, Sweden, and other locations in Denmark. As a recognized leader in pre-clinical research, the company is well-versed in various areas of expertise, including toxicology, pharmacology, pathology, and medical devices.

Scantox A/S provides a wide array of services, from Anatomic Pathology and Clinical Chemistry to more specialized procedures like Intravitreal Toxicity and Toxicokinetic Studies for various species including dogs, minipigs, and rabbits. The company also conducts critical research related to ongoing health crises, offering SARS-CoV-2 (COVID-19) Assays. Furthermore, it has significant experience with GLP and non-GLP small molecule bioanalysis, oncology xenografts, neuroscience models, and other areas of scientific exploration.

With an emphasis on quality and timeliness, Scantox A/S employs a highly trained team of professionals ready to deliver exceptional results. Whether servicing small biotech firms or large pharmaceutical conglomerates, every client is considered a valued partner. The firm prides itself on its early engagement with dedicated scientists to ensure effective collaboration and optimal results.

In addition to its rich service portfolio, Scantox A/S is fully equipped to handle and formulate test items, including radioactive labelled compounds and controlled substances. The company's clinical pathology and histopathology department manages dose formulation analysis, blood sample analysis, as well as production of tissue slides for skilled pathologists. Its animal facility maintains high standards of care to ensure the health and wellbeing of all animals.

title: SGS Life Science Services
description:
SGS Life Science Services, established in 1878, is a leading global enterprise in the healthcare and pharmaceutical industry, with its headquarters situated in Rutherford, NJ, US. The company is a large business, generating revenue exceeding 100 million. SGS Life Science Services operates an extensive network of sites across the globe, including locations in France, Germany, Austria, Belgium, Ireland, Switzerland, the United Kingdom, China, India, Canada, and the United States.

The company offers an extensive range of services including 3D Cell Microscopy Assay, API Physical Characteristics, API Stress Testing Studies, Antibody Products, Antibody Purification, Antibody Sequencing, Antioxidant Assays, Assay Development, Atomic Absorption Analysis, Bacterial Cell Culture, Bioequivalence Studies, Biomarker Services, Biotin-Antibody Conjugation, Cancer Systems Biology, Capillary Electrophoresis, Cell Based Assays, Consumer Care Testing and Substantiation, Cytotoxicity Testing, DNA/Protein analysis, Drug Formulation, Drug Product Stability, and many others.

SGS Life Science Services' primary focus lies in supporting pharmaceutical, biopharmaceutical, and medical device companies by providing services throughout the entire drug development pathway. With a global team of Health Science experts, the company offers integrated solutions ranging from preclinical activities to Phase I-IV clinical trials, bioanalytical, pharmaceutical development, biologics characterization, biosafety, and quality control testing of small and large molecules, raw materials, containers, and finished products. 

The company's commitment to quality is demonstrated by its possession of Good Laboratory Practice (GLP) and Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP) certifications. With the rapid pace of technological advancement, SGS Life Science Services assists its clients in navigating the complex process of delivering high-quality, safe medical devices to the market. This is achieved through the expert staff's in-depth knowledge of their fields and understanding of the business needs of their clients.

title: Technoclone
description:
Established in 1987, Technoclone is a small scale enterprise based in the heart of Wien, Austria. With its headquarters and main site located at Brunner Straße 67, the company has carved a niche for itself in the business landscape with a remarkable revenue performance of 1-10 million TTM. 

Technoclone specializes in providing a range of reagents essential for diagnostic analysis. The company's offerings encompass a wide spectrum of products, including plasma, inhibitors, proteins, and chromogenic reagents. These materials are integral to various diagnostic procedures, cementing Technoclone's position as a vital player in the healthcare industry. 

Despite being considered a small business, Technoclone's contribution to the medical and healthcare sector is substantial. Its products play a crucial role in enhancing the accuracy and efficiency of diagnostic tests, thereby facilitating better patient care and outcomes. 

In summary, Technoclone, with its headquarters in Wien, Austria, is a small but significant player in the healthcare industry, contributing to better diagnostic services through its range of essential reagents. With an impressive revenue track, it continues to make strides in its field, a testament to its commitment to quality and innovation.

title: TB AGRARTECHNIK Service GmbH
description:
Established in 1992 by Hermann Koroschetz, TB AGRARTECHNIK Service GmbH has since grown to a dedicated team of seven experienced employees, each boasting exceptional expertise in the fields of agriculture, biology, and biotechnology. Anita Olson, who joined the company as a partner in 1994, currently serves as the managing director. Olson brings with her a wealth of well-founded experience in plant protection and biocidal products.

The company is nestled in the heart of Bad Vöslau, Niederösterreich, Austria, a town known for its intensive agricultural activities. As a small business generating between 1-10M TTM Revenue, TB AGRARTECHNIK has proven itself as a significant player in the agricultural industry.

TB AGRARTECHNIK is not only a company but also an officially recognized testing facility by the Austrian Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry. The company operates in line with the Austrian plant protection product law and Directive 91/414/EEC (93/71/EEC). The facility's testing results contribute significantly to the registration of the tested products within the European Community.

The company's primary specialization includes the implementation and management of the registration of plant protection products, biocidal products, and other chemicals, marking it as a pivotal entity in the world of agricultural technological services.

title: ThioMatrix
description:
ThioMatrix, a small-scale business situated in the heart of Innsbruck, Tirol, Austria, is a leading pioneer in the specialized sector of in vitro/ex vivo studies, formulation development, and preclinical studies. The company, boasting its prestigious address at Trientlgasse 65 Innsbruck, Tirol, 6020 Austria, is renowned for its cutting-edge services that make a significant impact in the field of medical and scientific research.

Although specifics regarding its establishment year are not disclosed, ThioMatrix has managed to carve out a notable presence in its niche. With an annual turnover of 1-10 million (TTM Revenue), this small yet robust business stands as a testament to the profound impact a focused approach and commitment to excellence can have on a company's growth and reputation.

ThioMatrix's core competencies lie in conducting in vitro/ex vivo studies, which are essential in understanding the interactions within a biological system. Additionally, the company excels in formulation development, a crucial process in creating new medicinal products. Moreover, it also provides preclinical studies, a necessary step in the drug development process to ensure safety and efficacy before human trials.

In essence, ThioMatrix is more than just a business; it's a vital contributor to the world of scientific research and medical advancement. With its unyielding dedication, innovative approach, and high-quality services, ThioMatrix continues to set the bar high in its field.

title: Technoclone Herstellung von Diagnostika und Arzneimitteln GmbH
description:
Technoclone Herstellung von Diagnostika und Arzneimitteln GmbH, established in 1987 by Prof. Dr. Bernd R. Binder, holds a pioneering position in the global diagnostics industry. Located in Vienna, Austria, this mid-sized business has an annual revenue of 10 to 100 million dollars.

Initially, Technoclone focused on monoclonal antibodies against components of the coagulation and fibrinolytic systems. However, it expanded rapidly from 1998 through the acquisition of the former Immuno diagnostics from Baxter AG, establishing a worldwide distribution system. 

As a leading producer of diagnostics tests, equipment, and research products in blood clotting, Technoclone offers both global and specialty coagulation tests. Its commitment to innovation helps tackle complexities in diagnosing hematological and cardiovascular disorders. The company's Ceveron 100 series, the first fully automated coagulation analyzer series, is a significant contribution to specialty hemostasis diagnostics. 

Technoclone’s high-quality in vitro diagnostics and test systems are marketed worldwide, not just under the Technoclone label, but also as OEM products for international diagnostics companies. 

The company's research and development efforts are concentrated on thrombosis and cardiovascular diseases, the leading cause of global mortality and morbidity. It collaborates closely with universities and international and national research consortia, holding over 10 international patents in the field of diagnosis and therapy of vascular diseases. 

With its continuous advancements, Technoclone remains at the forefront of addressing tomorrow's diagnostic challenges.

title: TAmiRNA
description:
TAmiRNA, a Vienna-based biotech company established in 2013, specializes in the identification and validation of microRNA biomarkers for use in the medical field. They provide an array of services that include biomarker discovery and validation, cardiovascular toxicology, RNA sequencing, and miRNA sequencing among others. 

Their work involves high-level expertise in dealing with miRNAs, using sophisticated techniques to screen microRNA transcript levels in any type of cell tissue or biological sample. With a successful track record, TAmiRNA has developed a promising pipeline for creating novel miRNA biomarkers for toxicology studies and disease prediction.

As a Contract Research Organization (CRO), TAmiRNA offers a wide range of high-quality, validated microRNA services. These include transcriptomics with RNASeq, small RNA-Seq, and qPCR analysis of biofluids, cells, tissues, and extracellular vesicles (EVs) for the discovery and validation of various RNA biomarkers. They also provide spatial omics, which involves the coupling of laser-assisted microdissection of complex tissues and RNA-seq to decipher gene expression in complex tissues in-situ.

TAmiRNA offers customer-tailored microRNA biomarker discovery and validation using proprietary small RNA-Seq normalization strategies, machine learning, and customized protocols. They also perform proteomic, lipidomic, and transcriptomic analysis of extracellular vesicles, exosomes, and nanovesicles, adhering to the guidelines of the International Society for Extracellular Vesicles. Additionally, they provide toxomiR, a microRNA-based screening assay for organ injury, and hepatomiR, a CE-certified assay for the quantification of liver biomarkers. 

TAmiRNA operates as a small business with 1-10M TTM revenue and is located in Leberstrasse 20, Vienna, Austria. The company holds the ISO 13485 certification from the International Organization for Standards.

title: University Of Vienna - Cell Imaging and Ultrastucture
description:
The University of Vienna - Cell Imaging and Ultrastucture is an esteemed Academic Core Facility located at 1 Universitätsring in Wien, Austria. It is recognized for its significant contributions to the field of basic biological research, with a specific focus on the understanding of cellular structure.

As a core facility of the reputed University of Vienna, this institution is a pivotal hub for pushing the boundaries of scientific discovery in the field of cell imaging and ultrastucture. Leveraging the academic prowess of the University of Vienna, this facility has been instrumental in pioneering research and innovation in its domain.

The facility's primary area of expertise lies in the domain of cell imaging and ultrastucture, emphasizing the profound importance of structural knowledge in the realm of basic biological research. The facility undertakes rigorous studies and research to understand the complexities of cellular structure, contributing significantly to the global body of knowledge in this field.

Although the exact year of establishment is not specified, the University of Vienna - Cell Imaging and Ultrastucture facility continues to grow and evolve, providing a dynamic platform for academic research and discovery in the heart of Austria's capital, Wien. This facility stands as a testament to the University of Vienna's commitment to fostering an environment of intellectual curiosity and academic excellence.

title: Vienna BioCenter Core Facilities GmbH (VBCF)
description:
The Vienna BioCenter Core Facilities GmbH (VBCF) is a publicly-funded, non-profit research institute located at Vienna Biocenter, in Wien, Austria. Although the year it was established is not specified, records show that VBCF was formed in 2010 as a limited liability company (GmbH) under Austrian law. The organization's stakeholders include the Campus Vienna Biocenter Association with a 50% stake, the Max F. Perutz Laboratories GmbH with a 25% stake, the Institute of Molecular Biotechnology holding 15%, and the Gregor Mendel Institute of Molecular Plant Biology with 10%.

This academic core facility benefits from funding by the Federal Ministry of Science, Research and Economy (bm.wfw) and the City of Vienna. Aside from government funding, the operation of VBCF is also financed by the fees charged for the services it provides and by additional research grants it receives.

VBCF operates 11 scientific core facilities. Additionally, it oversees the shared Child Care Center of the Vienna Biocenter. The organization's headquarters and facilities are situated at 3 Doktor-Bohr-Gasse Wien, Wien, 1030 Austria. VBCF continues to contribute significantly to the scientific community, facilitating research and breakthroughs in various fields of study.

title: vivo Science
description:

Furthermore, Vivo Science has expertise in conducting in vivo studies in rodents, a critical component in the early stages of drug development and disease modeling. In vivo studies are essential for understanding the complex biological systems and the interactions within them, thereby contributing significantly to the advancement of medical and scientific research.

Despite the absence of disclosed certifications, Vivo Science's diverse range of services, strategic locations, and significant revenue underscore its credibility and potential. This small business in Austria is making considerable strides in the realm of scientific research, contributing to the global scientific community's progress.

description:

With a revenue ranging from 1 to 10 million TTM, it has carved a niche for itself in the field of biosafety and bio-distribution testing. Its primary location is situated in Donau-City-Straße 1, Wien, which is recognized as a premier hub for conducting key operations. At this site, a team of dedicated professionals operates to provide specialized services in virus validation and prion clearance studies. The company's main offerings include not only these specialized services but also a comprehensive range of bio-distribution and biosafety testing services.

ViruSure's unique quality lies in its ability to offer a blend of services that combine traditional techniques with cutting-edge technology. This ensures that their clients receive reliable results, aiding them in their research and development efforts.

In summary, ViruSure is a small yet robust organization that provides a variety of services in the field of biosafety testing and virus validation. title: Vela Laboratories
description:
Established in 2006, Vela Laboratories is a mid-sized business, headquartered in Wien, Vienna, AT. The company operates out of a site located at Brunner Strasse 69 Objekt 3, Wien, Vienna, 1230 Austria. As a global entity, Vela Laboratories is a contract laboratory certified by Good Laboratory Practice (GLP) and Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP).

The company's extensive services encompass a wide array of analytical solutions for Biologics, including ATMPs, Biopharmaceuticals, Originator products, Biosimilar Candidates, Biosimilars, Blood and blood components, and Vaccines. In addition, it provides services for Chemicals and Excipients throughout the product development stages, from non-clinical and clinical until market release testing.

Moreover, Vela Laboratories offers an impressive range of consulting services, including Assay Development Consulting, Bioanalysis Consulting, Biomarker Services Consulting, In Vivo PK Consulting, Product Testing Consulting, and Safety Pharmacology Consulting. In particular, the company excels in ADCC and CDC Assay Services, Antibody Detection, Apoptosis Assays, Assay Development, Cell Based Assays, and Protein Binding HPLC.

Vela Laboratories prides itself on its storage facilities that facilitate long-term stability studies and all types of microbiological services, making it an essential partner for Pharma and Biotech companies. The company is also a proud member of the Tentamus group, further consolidating its standing in the industry.

title: Arsanis
description:
Arsanis, with its headquarters nestled in the heart of Wien, Austria, operates as a small business that generates a revenue between 1 to 10 million. Since its inception, the company has diligently committed itself to the biotechnology sector with a specific focus on generating therapeutics based on human antibodies. These therapeutics are aimed at combatting severe and life-threatening infectious diseases. 

The company is housed in an office at 2 Helmut-Qualtinger-Gasse in Wien's 1030 district, a location that is as unique as the work it produces. Despite its size, Arsanis' impact in the biotechnology field is profound. Its dedication to research and development in the biomedical sphere makes it a key player in the fight against serious infections. 

In essence, Arsanis is a beacon of hope in the biomedical world, striving to create innovative solutions to counter severe infectious diseases. Its commitment to harnessing the power of human antibodies for the development of therapeutics sets it apart in the industry, and its location in Wien, Austria, places it in the heart of one of the world's most vibrant biotech hubs.

title: acib - Austrian Centre of Industrial Biotechnology
description:
The Austrian Centre of Industrial Biotechnology (acib) is a prominent research center that amalgamates the proficiency of leading researchers from over ten global universities. Specializing in various disciplines of industrial biotechnology and bioengineering, the center is based in Graz, Austria. Acib is a small business entity with a revenue ranging between 1 to 10 million TTM.

The center's physical presence at 14 Petersgasse Graz, Steiermark, 8010 Austria, serves as a hub for both national and international biotechnological industry and globally recognized research institutions. These institutions are seamlessly integrated as project partners to foster innovation and collaboration.

Acib aims to be the top choice for precompetitive research in industrial biotechnology. The focus areas include biocatalysis, bioprocesses, enzymes, and pharmaceutical protein production. Partners of acib benefit from innovative scientific concepts, a rich pool of academic intellect, and a broad range of methodological expertise necessary to develop distinctive bioprocesses and products.

The research program at acib is ambitious and comprehensive. It includes the development of novel microbial and mammalian expression systems and concepts, broadening the innovative applications of biocatalysis, enhancing bioprocesses, and understanding bioproduction on both molecular and genome-wide basis. This detailed approach aids in the creation of unique and groundbreaking biotechnologies.

title: Albert Einstein College of Medicine Immune Monitoring Core
description:
The Albert Einstein College of Medicine Immune Monitoring Core, established in 2022, is an academic core facility that operates from two key sites in Gölding Oberösterreich, Austria, and Morris Park Avenue, New York, United States. This institution specializes in the monitoring and understanding of the immune system's interaction with the tumor microenvironment. 

Employing advanced tools such as the Vectra Polaris automated slide scanner and the NanoString GeoMx Digital Spatial Profiler (DSP), the core provides a comprehensive view of the cellular and molecular landscapes within tumor tissues. The Vectra Polaris capability of performing multispectral imaging of 6 markers across 40 slides in a single run facilitates rapid and precise phenotyping and spatial distribution of immune cells, tumor, and stroma with minimal manual effort from the researcher. 

In addition, the GeoMx DSP allows for spatial RNA sequencing from distinct individual regions of interest, enabling the examination of a few hundred cells for up to 800 unique transcripts. Among the services offered are whole slide scanning with multispectral separation, Nanostring nCounter Analyzer, and GeoMx digital spatial profiler. This academic core facility thereby provides vital resources for the in-depth study of the tumor microenvironment and its interaction with the immune system.

description:

title: ZANDR - CCRI
description:
ZANDR - CCRI, established in 2019, is an Academic Core Facility based in Vienna, Austria. This unique entity is notably housed within the premises of St. Anna Children’s Cancer Research Institute, an organization dedicated to improving treatment for children and adolescents suffering from cancer. The institute achieves its objectives by harmoniously integrating translational and clinical research with an open-minded examination of basic disease mechanisms.

ZANDR - CCRI offers a specialized platform for phenotypic screening of small compounds on zebrafish models of human diseases. The use of zebrafish, and particularly zebrafish larvae, provides a well-suited vertebrate model system to investigate a wide array of human diseases. This approach also allows for the cost-effective screening of small molecules with potential therapeutic benefits. 

Funded by FFG, ZANDR - CCRI has successfully established a zebrafish-optimized and automated screening platform. This advanced platform is readily accessible to the scientific community and is located at their headquarters on Zimmermannplatz 10, Vienna, 1090 Austria.

Their primary services include the investigation of Immuno-oncology Targets and the utilization of Zebrafish Animal Models. Through their intensive research and innovative approaches, ZANDR - CCRI continues to make significant strides in the realm of cancer research and treatment, particularly for children and adolescents.

title: ART-Biopharma LLC
description:
Established in 2019, ART-Biopharma LLC is a proficient consultancy firm headquartered in Yerevan, Armenia. With more than five consultants, the firm specializes in the biomedical research sector, primarily focusing on clinical sample procurement across various medical domains. Their operations are conducted from their office located at 13 Aram Khachaturian Street, Suite #26, Yerevan, 0033 Armenia. 

ART-Biopharma LLC provides an array of comprehensive services including Anatomic Pathology, Assay Development Consulting, Biomarker Discovery, Clinical Chemistry, Clinical Pathology, Complete Blood Count, Complete Metabolic Panel Testing, and Data - Oncology. Additionally, they offer services in Diagnostic Biomarkers Discovery, Genomic DNA Purification, Histology, Histopathology, In Vitro Oncology Models, and Paraffin-based Histology. 

Furthermore, they specialize in providing human biological samples, including Human Blood, Human Plasma, and Human Serum. The firm also holds expertise in Predictive and Prognostic Biomarkers Discovery and Tissue Microarray. 

ART-Biopharma LLC has pre-established contracts with clinical sites and biobanks worldwide, ensuring a streamlined administrative process to accelerate access to retrospective collections and efficiently establish prospective studies. They only collaborate with institutions that strictly adhere to the highest standards of ethical research, emphasizing their commitment to integrity and transparency in their operations. This unique approach sets ART-Biopharma LLC apart as a trusted consultant in the biomedical research industry.

title: Laboratory Azatyan LLC
description:
Established in 2022, Laboratory Azatyan LLC is a Yerevan-based consulting company specializing in the ethical sourcing, processing, and characterisation of human biospecimens. Despite its small team of fewer than five employees, the company operates a site in Davitashen, Yerevan, Armenia, showcasing its commitment to offering professional services in the biotechnology industry.

Laboratory Azatyan LLC offers a comprehensive range of services, including Biobanking, Cell Free DNA Assay, DNA/RNA Extraction & Purification, as well as handling and processing various Human Biological Samples (HBS). These include Human Ascites, Human Biofluids, Human Blood, Human Bone Marrow Aspirates, Human Breast Milk, Human Buffy Coats, Human DNA, Human Fixed Tissue, and more.

The company's expertise further extends to handling Human Peripheral Blood Mononuclear Cells (PBMCs), Human Plasma, Human RNA, Human Saliva, Human Serum, Human TMA, Human Tears, and Human Urine, demonstrating its broad capability in the field.

Moreover, Laboratory Azatyan LLC provides services related to RNA, such as RNA Amplification, RNA Extraction, RNA Profiling, and RNA Sequencing, including Single Cell RNA Sequencing and mtDNA Sequencing.

Through these services, Laboratory Azatyan LLC has positioned itself as a comprehensive, professional, and ethical provider of human biospecimen sourcing and processing, catering to the needs of the rapidly evolving biotechnology sector.

title: National BioService
description:
Established in 2014 and headquartered in Saint-Petersburg, Russia, National BioService (NBS) is a small but impactful business specializing in the ethical sourcing, processing, and characterization of human and primate biospecimens. As a fully compliant Contract Research Organization (CRO), NBS holds a prestigious ISO 9001:2015 certification, a testament to its unwavering commitment to quality.

NBS boasts an impressive network, consisting of over 125 formally contracted and managed clinical centers sprawled across 30 cities in Russia. This expansive coverage is further bolstered by six owned laboratories staffed by highly trained personnel who adhere to uniform Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and quality standards. These laboratories offer a wide range of standard and custom laboratory protocols, including complex molecular and cellular analyses.

With its prospective collection capabilities and extensive biofluid cell and tissue biobank, NBS caters to all disease areas and biospecimen formats. Serving clients worldwide, NBS operates with strict adherence to local and international medical, customs, and data protection rules and regulations. This rigorous compliance ensures full traceability of biospecimens, providing clients with unparalleled confidence in the validity and authenticity of their data.

To learn more about National BioService and its range of capabilities, visit the company's official website at https://nbioservice.com/en/home. With sites at 7-ya Sovetskaya 22A Saint-Petersburg, Russia, 24 Azatutyan avenue, office 504 Yerevan, Armenia, and 17-A, Litovskaya Street Saint-Petersburg, Russia, NBS is well-positioned to serve the global research community.

title: International Centre for Diarrhoeal Disease Research (icddr,b)
description:
The International Centre for Diarrhoeal Disease Research (icddr,b) is a small-scale business based in Dhaka, Bangladesh, with a revenue range of $1-10 million. The organization is dedicated to addressing public health issues prevalent in low- to middle-income countries through innovative scientific research. This encompasses a broad spectrum of research fields, including laboratory-based, clinical, epidemiological, and health systems research.

Their services are specifically tailored for resource-deficient settings, with a mission to enhance the health and wellbeing of individuals residing in the world's most impoverished nations. For over half a century, the icddr,b has been conducting high-quality research and advocating for the implementation of evidence-based interventions.

Initially, the organization's primary focus was on diarrhoeal diseases. However, over time, it has broadened its research scope, studying multiple infectious diseases, other public health threats, and healthcare delivery methods. The icddr,b's work has significantly influenced local and global health policy and practices, and it continues to be a key objective for the organization's future.

Their headquarters are located at GPO Box 128, Dhaka, 1000, Bangladesh. Despite not having a disclosed year of establishment, the organization's enduring commitment to public health improvement is apparent through its 50+ years of research and impact.

sites.name: International Centre for Diarrhoeal Disease Research (icddr,b)

title: Biocartis
description:
Biocartis, a small business based in Jersey City, NJ, is known for its exceptional work in the field of molecular diagnostics and multiplex detection platforms. Despite its size, with a trailing twelve-month revenue between 1 and 10 million dollars, the company has made significant strides in its niche sector. 

Even though it does not disclose the year of its establishment, Biocartis has managed to expand its operations beyond the borders of the United States. The company has additional sites in Lausanne, in the scenic Swiss canton of Vaud, and in Mechelen, a bustling city in Belgium. These locations are strategically chosen, enabling Biocartis to maintain a global presence.

The services provided by Biocartis are centered around molecular diagnostic solutions. The company's multiplex detection platforms are at the forefront of technological innovation, ensuring accurate, efficient, and reliable results. Its cutting-edge technology aids in the detection and diagnosis of various diseases, contributing significantly to the healthcare industry.

Biocartis holds a unique position in the market, with a commitment to providing advanced diagnostic solutions. It is a shining example of how small businesses can make a big impact in their respective industries. With its innovative technologies and dedication to improving healthcare, Biocartis is undoubtedly a significant player in the field of molecular diagnostics.

title: AML Clinical Services
description:
Founded in the year 2000, AML Clinical Services is a small-scale business that has carved a niche for itself in the realm of clinical research services. Specializing in the delivery of comprehensive research solutions, the company lends its expertise to a diverse range of sectors including contract research organizations, pharmaceutical firms, medical device manufacturers, biotechnology companies, research sites, and universities.

With its headquarters nestled in the heart of Lubbeek, Vlaanderen in Belgium, AML Clinical Services has firmly established itself in the dynamic healthcare industry. The company operates from its primary site located at 8 Tempelzicht, Lubbeek, Vlaanderen, 3210 Belgium, further cementing its presence in the region.

Despite being categorized as a small enterprise with an annual turnover between 1M and 10M TTM Revenue, AML Clinical Services has made significant strides in its field. It has consistently demonstrated its ability to deliver high-quality, reliable and efficient clinical research services to its clients, thereby fostering strong professional relationships.

In summary, AML Clinical Services is a distinguished provider of clinical research services, leveraging its extensive expertise to cater to the evolving needs of diverse sectors within the healthcare industry. With nearly two decades of experience, the company has built a robust reputation for excellence, reliability, and customer satisfaction. The commitment to quality and innovative approach to clinical research continues to drive its growth and success in the highly competitive healthcare industry.

title: Alpa-Vet
description:
Alpa-Vet, an emerging small business located in Torhout, België, NL, stands as a unique and dedicated service provider within Europe's thriving alpaca farming industry. With a primary base at 11 Bruggestraat Torhout, Vlaanderen, 8820 Belgium, and a secondary location in the Netherlands, Alpa-Vet establishes itself as a central hub for alpaca breeders across Europe.

The company specializes in delivering veterinary services tailored particularly for alpacas, a species distinct from our traditional domesticated animals. Alpacas, part of the Tylopoda genus and the Camelid family, ruminate but are technically not ruminants. Due to their unique physiological characteristics - including stomach compartments, reproductive systems, and dental structures - alpaca healthcare can pose a significant challenge to many veterinarians. 

However, Alpa-Vet, with its profound experience in dealing with small camelids, rises to the occasion. The team offers not only services to alpaca breeders but also acts as a referral practice for specific, complex issues. 

Located in Geluwe, right at the heart of the European alpaca market, Alpa-Vet ensures easy accessibility and prompt service for its international clientele. As the alpaca farming business continues to grow both as a hobby and a livelihood in Europe, Alpa-Vet is well-positioned to address the unique veterinary needs of this unique species.

title: Ajinomoto Omnichem
description: Ajinomoto Omnichem is a small-scale business specializing in the development and manufacturing of pharmaceutical fine chemicals. Although the year of establishment is not specified, the company's proven expertise is reflected in its sustainable revenue generation between 1 and 10 million dollars. The company is strategically headquartered in Région wallonne, Belgium, which is also the location of its primary site. Ajinomoto Omnichem's unique focus on fine chemicals distinguishes it within the pharmaceutical industry, demonstrating its commitment to contribute to the global healthcare sector. Despite its small size, the company has made considerable strides in the field, showcasing its competitive edge and potential for growth. Ajinomoto Omnichem's business model is a testament to the fact that size does not limit the impact a company can make in a niche sector.

title: Ad Hoc Clinical
description:
Ad Hoc Clinical is a small business based in Ieper, Vlaanderen, Belgium. Established with an aim to serve the pharmaceutical industry, the company has also extended its services to Contract Research Organizations (CROs), biotech companies, and research sites. With a small yet dedicated team, Ad Hoc Clinical has managed to generate a revenue between 1-10M TTM. 

Operating from the site at 33 Ter Waarde Ieper, Vlaanderen, 8900 Belgium, Ad Hoc Clinical has developed a niche for itself in the field of clinical research. The company's expertise lies in initiating, coordinating, and supervising clinical studies, ranging from phase I to phase IV. 

This comprehensive involvement in clinical trials ensures that Ad Hoc Clinical is not just a service provider, but a valuable partner in clinical research. By handling a study from inception to finish, the company is able to maintain a consistency of quality and streamline the process for all involved parties.

In addition to its exceptional services, Ad Hoc Clinical is also recognized for its commitment to excellence and adherence to the highest standards of research ethics. The company's dedication to its clients and the broader scientific community has made it a trusted name in the industry. Ad Hoc Clinical continues to grow and evolve, always striving to improve its services and meet the ever-changing needs of the pharmaceutical and biotech sectors.

title: Arche Consulting
description:
Arche Consulting is an emerging startup based in the heart of Ghent, Flanders, Belgium. Despite being a newly established company, Arche Consulting has quickly become a valuable asset in its industry due to its extensive experience and knowledge. The team is made up of experts from both the academic and industrial sectors, offering a comprehensive overview of their field of work. 

The company's headquarters is strategically located in Ghent, one of the two most prominent university towns in Europe, known for their dynamic energy and creative vibe. This location allows Arche Consulting to maintain close ties with the academic community, staying abreast of the latest advancements and discoveries in their industry.

Arche Consulting primarily focuses on a range of specialized services. These include the preparation of risk assessments for inorganic substances like metals, alloys, and slags, and risk assessment of organic chemicals, such as flame retardants. The company also provides Chemical Safety Assessments and Reports in compliance with current REACH regulations. 

Furthermore, Arche Consulting handles the registration of biocides and plant protection products. They also offer the development of specific tools catered to both the inorganic and organic sectors. With these services, Arche Consulting is positioning itself as a significant player in the industry, leveraging its unique blend of academic and industrial expertise.

title: Andaman7
description:
Andaman7, established in 2014 and headquartered in Seraing, Wallonie, Belgium, is a startup dedicated to improving health outcomes by empowering patients. It specializes in managing chronic diseases by providing cost-effective and user-friendly solutions that integrate seamlessly into the existing patient care workflow. 

Andaman7's innovation lies in its combined personal health record (PHR) for patients and an electronic health record (EHR) for health professionals, both of which are mobile-only (Apple and Android). This technology platform enables secure and effortless data exchange and synchronization, promoting interoperability within the health ecosystem.

For patients, Andaman7 provides access to health records anywhere and anytime. It allows them to collect and add health data, such as medical, mental, fitness, nutrition, and genetic information, manually or from external sources like hospitals or connected devices. Importantly, it empowers patients to control their data sharing preferences within their 'Circle of trust' (™).

For caregivers and institutions, Andaman7 facilitates quick and effective interaction with patients, real-time access to Real World Data, and a comprehensive patient profile. It enables patient e-consent acquisition, information dissemination, and treatment adherence monitoring. Plus, it allows for the sending of dynamic questionnaires to conduct patient-reported experience and outcome measures (PROM / PREM) studies, ensure continuity of care, and conduct outcomes-based clinical studies.

Additionally, Andaman7 offers an array of services including clinical outcome assessments, data curation, health and pharmacoeconomics, market access, non-interventional studies, real-world data and evidence, and more. Customers appreciate its GDPR compliance, flexible database and user interface, and cost-effectiveness, making Andaman7 a standout choice in the healthcare technology sector. The company has sites in Redwood City, California, and multiple locations in Belgium.

title: Active Motif
description:
Established in 1999, Active Motif is a mid-sized biotechnology business based in Carlsbad, California, with additional sites in Belgium and Japan. The company specializes in the development of cell and molecular biology-based research tools designed to help understand the functions, interactions, and regulations of proteins. The company caters to the global medical research industry.

Active Motif is recognized as a leader in delivering epigenetic services. This includes a wide array of assays such as ATAC-seq, ChIP-Seq FactorPath, ChIP-Seq HistonePath, ChIP-Seq TranscriptionPath, ChIP-Seq Tissue, MeDIP-Seq, hMeDIP-Seq, RNA-seq, RRBS, CUT&Tag (cells & Tissue), Hi-C and ChIP antibody validation. Additionally, the company offers cutting-edge epigenetic mass spectrometry services for co-factor identification (RIME) and histone modifications (Mod Spec).

The company's expertise extends to the development of custom B-cell antibodies for epigenetic marks and factors. Active Motif also offers the latest single-cell assay services in partnership with 10x Genomics technologies, such as 3' scRNASeq, scATACSeq, 10X Multiome, and TotalSeq. 

With a robust portfolio of services including Antibody Products, Antibody Purification, Bioinformatics, Biotin-Antibody Conjugation, DNA Hydroxy Methylation Seq, and Proteomics, among others, Active Motif is capable of providing all services at scale to meet the diverse needs of the pharmaceutical research markets.

title: Aesculape CRO BVBA
description:
Aesculape CRO BVBA, established in 2010, is a global clinical research organisation based in the dynamic city of Singapore and with a presence in Belgium, Malaysia, and Italy. As a small but robust business, Aesculape CRO BVBA offers comprehensive services that cover the entire clinical trial spectrum, from Phase I to IV.

The company boasts a dedicated team of professionals with strong scientific and medical backgrounds who specialise in all aspects of clinical research. These include meticulous clinical operations such as site selection, regulatory submissions, and clinical monitoring. The team also excels in medical writing, pharmacovigilance, and marketing authorization, ensuring that all trials reach their full potential.

Aesculape CRO BVBA prides itself as a reliable partner, exemplifying knowledge, expertise, and an unrivaled infrastructure. The company is committed to providing precise services needed by their clients, ensuring unwavering quality and execution. With a tailored approach, Aesculape CRO BVBA accelerates the pace of clinical trials while delivering exceptional, client-centric service.

The company's services also include Bioequivalence Studies, Case Report Monitoring & Auditing, Central Institutional Review Board Services, Claims Data & Database Analysis, Clinical Development Planning, and much more. Offering a broad range of services, Aesculape CRO BVBA stands as a beacon of excellence, where commitment meets success, making it the perfect choice for those seeking precision in clinical research management.

title: Amatsigroup
description:
Established in 1987, Amatsigroup has grown into a mid-sized business with a revenue range of 10-100M TTM. Headquartered in Fontenilles, France, the company has strengthened its global presence with additional sites in Gent, Vlaanderen, Belgium, and Parc de Génibrat Fontenilles, France. 

Amatsigroup holds a prestigious position as a Contract Development and Manufacturing Organization (CDMO). It offers a broad spectrum of services in the preclinical and clinical phases of drug development. Their expertise is not limited to human medicine, but extends to veterinary use as well, showcasing their versatility and comprehensive approach. 

The company's consistent commitment to excellence has earned it certification from the respected Product Development and Management Association (PDMA). This recognition further solidifies Amatsigroup's reputation as a trusted and reliable partner in the pharmaceutical sector. 

In summary, Amatsigroup, with its significant industry experience and robust global footprint, is well-equipped to provide comprehensive and high-quality preclinical and clinical drug development services for both human and veterinary applications. The PDMA certification serves as a testament to their unwavering dedication to product development and management excellence.

title: AnaSpec
description:
Founded in 1993, AnaSpec is a leading large-scale business with headquarters located in Fremont, California. With an annual revenue that exceeds 100 million, AnaSpec has positioned itself as a significant player in the biotechnology sector. The company's primary site of operations is located at 34801 Campus Dr, Fremont, CA, 94555.

AnaSpec is renowned for its wide array of services that cater to different facets of the biotechnology industry. These services include, but are not limited to, antimicrobial peptide synthesis, assay development, chemistry, manufacturing and controls (CMC), and GMP synthesis. The company also specializes in providing building blocks, cell-based assays, HTS libraries, kits and reagents, and optical rotation. 

AnaSpec's services extend to peptide synthesis, polyclonal/monoclonal antibody production, protein sequencing, and shRNA synthesis. Furthermore, the company boasts a strong background in the production of antibody products and the development of stable isotope synthesis.

Being a part of Eurogentec, AnaSpec has the capacity to provide expertise in PCR, qPCR, Oligos, cloning and expression, and custom dye synthesis services. As a global supplier of products and services for life science research and molecular diagnostic development, AnaSpec plays a vital role in transitioning R&D into product launch and commercialization, thereby offering a truly collaborative partnership.

title: Antibodies-Online
description:
Established in 2006, Antibodies-Online is a leading small business specializing in the biotechnology sector. With an annual revenue between 1-10M TTM, this enterprise has carved out a significant space in the global market. 

Antibodies-Online operates from two major sites. One is located at 321 Jones Boulevard, Royersford, PA, 19468, United States, and the second one is based at 15 Schloss-Rahe Street Aachen, NRW, 52072, Germany. Despite not having a traditional headquarters, the business maintains a robust and efficient operation from these locations.

The company's primary services encompass a broad range of antibody products, peptide/protein products, and target gene expression. They have developed an online marketplace featuring more than 2 million research reagents sourced from over 250 suppliers. This vast selection makes Antibodies-Online a go-to resource for biotechnologists worldwide. 

Furthermore, Antibodies-Online has dedicated efforts to support relevant, timely research. They offer a comprehensive range of research tools designed to aid in the study and understanding of the Coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2). More information about these can be found on their website at https://www.antibodies-online.com/resources/18/5405/.

In conclusion, Antibodies-Online has positioned itself as a global leader in the supply of antibodies, ELISA kits, proteins, and other related products, thereby supporting the scientific community's research and development initiatives.

title: Avroxa
description:
Avroxa is a distinguished company based in Gent, East Flanders, Belgium. Although the year of establishment is not specified, Avroxa has managed to command a significant presence in the industry. The company operates from two strategic sites located at Krijgslaan 281-S4 Gent, East Flanders, 9000 Belgium and Technologiepark-Zwijnaarde 82 Gent, East Flanders, 9052 Belgium, ensuring a widespread reach and operational efficiency.

Avroxa's primary area of expertise lies in a range of specialized services including Antibody-Drug Conjugation, Chemical Stability, Chemistry, Manufacturing and Controls (CMC), Drug Formulation, Nanoparticle Synthesis, and PEG Protein Conjugation. Each of these services is crucial in the realm of scientific research and pharmaceutical development, demonstrating Avroxa's commitment to contributing to these cutting-edge fields.

Despite the lack of information about their specific certifications, Avroxa's broad and diverse service offering underscores their proficiency and capacity to meet various needs in the pharmaceutical and scientific research sectors. The company has built a reputation for delivering quality and reliable services that adhere to the highest professional and industry standards.

In essence, Avroxa showcases a robust blend of knowledge, experience, and dedication to service. Through their strategic location and comprehensive service offerings, they have positioned themselves as a vital contributor to the scientific and pharmaceutical landscapes. Their commitment to quality and innovation sets them apart, making them a preferred choice for many in the industry.

title: Ardena
description:
Ardena is a reputable player in the pharmaceutical industry, offering a comprehensive suite of services aimed at expediting the drug development process. Established in 2017 and headquartered in Gent, Oost-Vlaanderen, Belgium, this mid-sized business has an impressive global footprint with sites in Sweden, Spain, and multiple locations in the Netherlands. 

Ardena's integrated service platform is designed to streamline the journey from initial concept to first-in-human clinical verification, thereby reducing risk, time, and cost associated with bringing a drug to the market. The company offers an extensive array of services, including but not limited to 3D Cell Culture, API Physical Characteristics, API Stress Testing Studies, API and Drug Product Stability Testing, Accelerated Stability, and Atomic Absorption Analysis. 

Moreover, in line with its commitment to quality and compliance, Ardena holds a Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP) certification. This certification attests to their adherence to stringent regulatory standards, ensuring the highest quality of their drug development services. 

From GMP manufacturing services for clinical trials and Phase 1 to Phase 3 clinical trials, to drug substance and product development, Ardena provides a one-stop solution. The company also conducts ICH stability studies and offers clinical packaging, labeling, supply services, and bio-analytical services. 

In summary, Ardena is a trusted partner in the pharmaceutical landscape, offering a seamless, efficient pathway to navigate small molecules from conception to clinical verification.

title: anacura
description:
Anacura, a mid-sized business located in Evergem, Belgium, is a leading provider of a comprehensive range of services geared towards the development and validation of analytical methods. This company employs its more than two decades of experience to assist clients in product development and filing, while ensuring risks are mitigated and timelines are accelerated. 

Anacura's extensive suite of services includes API and Drug Product Stability Testing, Apoptotic Cell Staining, and Assay Development Consulting, among many others. The company also offers specialized services such as Cell Transfection, Chemical Stability, and Cytochrome P450s. Leveraging its expertise in Capillary Electrophoresis, Cell Proliferation, and Chemistry, Manufacturing and Controls (CMC), Anacura is proficient in managing complex formulations/mixtures, low solubility products, and liposomal products. 

Beyond these, the company's diverse analytical capabilities extend to small molecules, mAbs, derivatives, plasmids, vaccines, mRNAs, stem cells, CAR-T cells, PBMCs, oligonucleotides, and peptides. Their experienced project managers are adept at connecting the dots in clients' projects, anticipating needs, and safeguarding milestones.

Anacura operates with a Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP) certification, guaranteeing the consistent production of high-quality products. Its headquarters are conveniently located at Noorwegenstraat 4 Evergem, 9940 Belgium. Whether your business requires advanced Flow Cytometry, Freeze-Thaw Testing, or Genomic DNA Purification, or needs to conduct Impurity Synthesis or Ion Exchange Chromatography, Anacura provides the analytical insight you need to succeed.
