title: BIORIUS
description:
BIORIUS, based in Manage, Wallonie, Belgium, stands at the forefront of the regulatory industry in the European Union (EU) as a dynamic startup. Despite its relatively recent inception, it has gained significant prominence in the field, boasting an impressive registration production capacity of 100 products per week. BIORIUS has registered over 6,000 products in the EU and has expanded its reach to multiple countries beyond the EU borders. 

The company has been recognized by the International Cosmetic Trade Association (ICMAD) as a valued partner for their EU program, underscoring its quality and commitment to regulatory excellence. BIORIUS's clientele is vast and diverse, with more than 300 brands, a significant number of which are based in the USA and Canada, relying on its services. 

In addition to its core services of cosmetic registration and compliance, BIORIUS also offers testing and medical device services. With its broad range of services and an ever-growing customer base, BIORIUS is rapidly shaping the landscape of the regulatory industry. Despite being a startup, BIORIUS has successfully established itself as the go-to resource for cosmetic enterprises looking to navigate the complex regulatory environment of the EU.

title: Bio Analytical Research Corporation
description:
Bio Analytical Research Corporation, also known as BARC, is a small but thriving business that specializes in providing comprehensive support for clinical trials. Despite its humble classification as a small business with a total revenue ranging from $1 million to $10 million, BARC's impact in the industry is substantial and global. 

The firm's headquarters are strategically located in Nassau, New York, but its influence extends far beyond U.S borders. BARC has established multiple sites worldwide, operating in diverse and dynamic regions. These include Industriepark-Zwijnaarde in East Flanders, Belgium, the bustling city of Kogarah in New South Wales, Australia, the vibrant City of Johannesburg in Gauteng, South Africa and additional sites in Nassau, NY and Lake Success, NY in the United States.

BARC's core services are centered around clinical trial support, project management, and data management. This trifecta of services ensures that the company can effectively oversee clinical trials from inception to completion, managing every aspect in between. The company's commitment to meticulous project and data management assures clients of rigorous and accurate results, thereby fostering confidence and trust in the outcomes of the clinical trials they support.

While the establishment year of the Bio Analytical Research Corporation remains undisclosed, its reputation and global footprint affirm that it is a seasoned player in its field, adept at navigating the complex world of clinical trials and research.

title: Biotheque Wallonie Bruxelles
description:
Biotheque Wallonie Bruxelles (BWB), a small-scale business based in Brussels, Belgium, is prominent in the scientific and research community for their exemplary management of a virtual catalog of human tissues and cell samples, or biospecimens. This catalog serves as a critical resource for researchers, providing a platform where they can easily locate the necessary biospecimens for their projects. 

To ensure smooth transactions and provide further assistance, BWB serves as a bridge between researchers and biobank managers, which significantly streamlines the supply process of required materials. This efficient system not only fulfills the needs of the researchers but also helps biobank managers to effectively distribute their resources.

Moreover, BWB plays a vital role in situations where requests cannot be satisfied within existing collections. The company collaborates with its partners to identify and implement appropriate solutions, demonstrating their commitment to meeting the diverse needs of the research community.

In addition, BWB places high importance on ethical considerations. The company ensures that all necessary approvals for the use of biospecimens have been obtained from the Ethical Committee. This safeguards the ethical use of human tissues and cell samples in research, underlining BWB's dedication to maintaining the highest professional standards in their operations.  

Despite the lack of information regarding its establishment, BWB's efforts in managing biospecimens have made it a valuable asset in the scientific and research community.

title: BioMARIC
description:
BioMARIC is a small business specializing in the complex fields of protein development, diagnostic assays, and vaccine technology. Despite its compact size, it boasts an impressive revenue range of 1 to 10 million TTM. While the year of its establishment remains undisclosed, the company has made its mark in the industry with its high-quality services that cater to a broad spectrum of scientific needs. 

The company's headquarters are strategically positioned in Oost-Vlaanderen, part of the vibrant Vlaams Gewest region in Belgium. This location serves as a central hub for its operations, allowing it to efficiently cater to its clientele. In addition to its main office, BioMARIC also operates from its site in Technologiepark-Zwijnaarde, a well-known scientific and technological park in Ghent, Flanders, Belgium. 

BioMARIC's core competencies lie in three main areas. It excels in protein development, a critical aspect of biotechnology, which involves creating and modifying proteins to serve specific functions. The company also offers diagnostic assays, which are essential tools in detecting and measuring the presence or amount of a target entity. Lastly, BioMARIC is also at the forefront of vaccine technology, contributing to the protection of public health worldwide. 

Overall, BioMARIC is a formidable player in the world of biotechnology, combining its expertise in protein development, diagnostic assays, and vaccine technology to provide comprehensive solutions to its clients.

title: Bio4ward
description:
Bio4ward, a newly established startup based in Bordeaux, Nouvelle-Aquitaine, France, is a unique fusion of major industry experience and practical startup culture. The company is dedicated to providing bespoke solutions for various sectors including Pharma, Biotech, and Medical Devices. These tailored solutions are crafted by leveraging a network of highly qualified industry experts, each possessing a set of complementary skills to address the specific needs of any project.

Bio4ward serves as a single point of contact for startups and SMEs in the life sciences field, offering high-value expertise on both temporary and long-term bases. The company's support empowers bio-entrepreneurs to concentrate on their core business operations, while avoiding the common pitfalls of development and optimizing value creation.

With its additional location in Donkerstraat Landen, Vlaanderen, Belgium, Bio4ward is strategically positioned to assist companies in multiple regions. By combining professionalism commonly found in large corporations with the agility and pragmatism of a startup, Bio4ward offers a unique and valuable service to innovative life sciences companies. As a result, Bio4ward is rapidly becoming an integral partner for businesses seeking to move forward in the competitive landscape of the biotech industry.

From offering strategic consulting to managing logistical aspects such as transport and warehousing, B&C Group proves itself to be a reliable and versatile partner for businesses in need of comprehensive solutions. 

In conclusion, B&C Group is a small yet robust business entity with an impressive portfolio of services and a global reach that extends beyond its base in the United States.

title: BioAware
description:
BioAware, a small-scale business established in 1990, is headquartered in Bertrée, Belgium. The company has carved a niche for itself as a reliable provider of its flagship software solution, BioloMICS. This unique software is designed for the comprehensive organization, analysis, and publication of biological data. It has the capability to archive a wide range of data, encompassing areas such as morphology, physiology, biochemistry, chemistry, chromatography, electrophoresis, molecular structures, bibliography, taxonomy, geography, ecology, and administration. 

BioloMICS serves as the software of choice for various establishments, including research laboratories, industrial laboratories, museums, and culture collections, thanks to its extensive data storage and analysis capabilities. It is recognized as the "Swiss Army knife" solution for biological data, indicating its multifaceted functionality and versatility. 

BioAware's primary office is located at Rue du Henrifontaine 20, Bertrée, 4280, Belgium. It generates an annual revenue between 1 and 10 million, reflecting its steady presence in the market. BioAware continues to strive for excellence, delivering top-notch services to its clients, while maintaining its unique purpose and quality.

title: Bio-Plus Safety Pharmacology
description:
Bio-Plus Safety Pharmacology is a niche Contract Research Organization that is headquartered in Antwerpen, Vlaams Gewest, Belgium. Despite being a small business with a revenue between 1-10M TTM, it has made significant contributions to the field of drug safety. The company focuses its expertise and technological capabilities on evaluating the cardiac safety of new drugs during their early developmental stages. 

Bio-Plus Safety Pharmacology employs a validated and highly predictive platform that involves the use of anaesthetized guinea-pigs. This unique approach enables the organization to provide reliable, quick, and cost-effective solutions for cardiovascular safety screening. 

The company's driving ambition is to advance cardiovascular safety pharmacology. Innovation is a crucial part of their strategy, as exemplified by their flagship technologies: BeatEM® and ChallengEM®. These proprietary technologies demonstrate the company's commitment to staying on the cutting edge of their field, ensuring they provide the most accurate and up-to-date service to their clients.

title: Bottomley Consulting Group
description:
Bottomley Consulting Group, founded in 2023 and headquartered in Overjise, Belgium, is a boutique consultancy firm specializing in quality of life research and patient-reported outcomes (PROs). With a team of less than five, the firm offers a tailored concierge consultancy service designed to meet the unique needs of its clients. 

The group's expertise extends over three decades, during which they have designed clinical trials, created and reviewed SAPs, and provided international guidance in PRO analysis. They have also developed over 50 EORTC Quality of life (QOL) measures in the past 25 years. While their services extend beyond oncology, Bottomley Consulting Group excels in this field, making them a valuable asset for any study related to cancer research. 

What sets Bottomley Consulting Group apart is their unparalleled experience working with diverse measures and their impressive track record in designing and implementing European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC) measures. Their founder, previously responsible for creating the majority of EORTC tools, has a deep understanding of these measures, uniquely qualifying the group to assist in the design, interpretation, and publication of studies and clinical trials. 

Bottomley Consulting Group also offers training and education programs covering all aspects of QOL use in both clinical and real-world studies. Leveraging their experience working with regulators such as the FDA and EMA, they equip researchers with the necessary skills to effectively use QOL data. 

Operating internationally across various disease settings, including oncology, MS, T1D, neurology, and cardiovascular, Bottomley Consulting Group is ready to enhance research outcomes and drive scientific progress to new heights.

title: BCCM/GeneCorner
description:
Established in 1977, BCCM/GeneCorner has built a highly regarded reputation as an Academic Core Facility. With its headquarters nestled in Gent, Oost-Vlaanderen, Belgium, the company operates from its site at Technologiepark-Zwijnaarde 71. 

BCCM/GeneCorner has been instrumental in the field of molecular biology, offering a range of services including Bacterial Cell Culture, Bacterial and Mammalian Expression, Cell Transfection, and the creation of Fusion Proteins. The facility is also an expert in Genome Editing, Microbiology, Plasmid DNA Preparation and Extraction, Protein Expression, and the development of Recombinant Proteins and Technology. They also specialize in Yeast Expression and cDNA cloning & subcloning.

BCCM/GeneCorner's unique position in Europe has been made possible through funding from the Belgian Science Policy (Belspo). The facility stands as a prime plasmid repository, accepting and distributing plasmids to researchers across the globe. This is complemented by their public deposit and distribution of plasmids and host strains.

Moreover, BCCM/GeneCorner offers patent deposit services for plasmids, host strains, and cell lines. They also provide a private backup for these elements, with or without quality controls. Their commitment to the scientific community extends to custom scientific services related to plasmids. 

In conclusion, BCCM/GeneCorner is a pioneering Academic Core Facility at the forefront of molecular biological research and services.

title: BISC Global, CVBA
description:
BISC Global, CVBA, established in 2017, is a small business centered in Gent, OVL, BE that has made a significant impact in the fields of Bioinformatics and Statistics Consulting. This dynamic company has quickly grown to address the shifting challenges within biotechnological research, focusing less on data generation and more on data analysis. Their aim is to construct bridges between biology and informatics, mathematics and engineering, as well as between promising newcomers and seasoned experts in the field.

BISC Global offers numerous services that include Bayesian Statistics, Bioinformatics, Biostatistical Design, Cloud Computing, Data Curation, Data Infrastructure, Data and Text Mining, Discovery Computational Systems Biology, and more. They are particularly adept in areas such as Epigenomics Data Analysis, High-Performance Computing, Machine Learning/ AI, Metagenomics Data Analysis, Mutation Data Profiling, and Omics Informatics Consulting. Further, BISC Global showcases skill in Scientific Data Visualization, Scientific Pipeline Implementation, and Semantic Tech & Triplestores, making them a highly versatile player in the industry.

In a recent development, BISC Global was acquired by Excelra, leading to the creation of an international bioinformatics powerhouse with a leading platform and service offering. Excelra is known for being a reliable partner to top pharmaceutical and biotechnology companies worldwide, providing data, insight, and R&D technology services. Their interdisciplinary teams of biocurators, bioinformaticians, data scientists, and engineers deliver harmonized data, optimized analysis pipelines, and advanced applications to accelerate drug discovery and development.

title: Biogazelle
description:
Biogazelle, a small-scale business established in 2007, is a specialty Contract Research Organization (CRO) headquartered in Zwijnaarde, Belgium. The company's primary focus lies in the provision of high-value applications to aid pharmaceutical research, clinical trials, and the development of diagnostic tests. 

Biogazelle leverages a comprehensive suite of genomic and transcriptomic technologies to identify, validate, and develop RNA and DNA biomarkers. Their unique position in the market stems from their application of GCLP compliant quantitative PCR, digital PCR, and specialized RNA sequencing workflows. These are optimized for the quantification of coding and non-coding genes in sensitive pre-clinical and clinical samples, like liquid biopsies and FFPE tissues. 

The company also offers data analysis services, such as differential gene expression, pathway analysis, and custom analysis, supported by unique software tools. They assist in the development of innovative adoptive cell therapies, like CAR-T, CAR-NK, and TCR-T, by developing assays for vector copy number analysis, PK, and detection of replication-competent virus events. 

With extensive expertise in GCLP compliant testing of clinical samples, Biogazelle supports inter-laboratory validations of PCR-based in vitro diagnostic assays. They also have a proprietary, low-cost, high-throughput molecular cellular phenotyping service that can provide insights into regulated pathways, target toxicities, compound similarities, and target deconvolution.

Moreover, they offer COVID-19 related services, such as high-throughput Sars-CoV-2 PCR testing, with a capacity to handle several thousand samples per day. Their approach to every project is highly personalized and customizable, ensuring a bespoke solution that meets the objectives and specific requirements of each project.

title: BioNotus
description:
BioNotus is a dynamic Contract Research Organization (CRO) that was established in 2017. With its headquarters in Elversele, OVL, Belgium, and additional sites in Galileilaan 15 Niel and Dorpstraat 61A Elversele, BioNotus has made a name for itself as a promising startup, despite its recent establishment.

The company provides a broad spectrum of services that are aimed at revolutionizing the biomedical industry. These services range from biomarker analytical and clinical validation, Caco-2 cell permeability, chemistry manufacturing, and controls (CMC), to clinical protocol design and development, and clinical trial design. Moreover, BioNotus offers a variety of discovery computational systems biology services including in silico drug dynamics and PK-PD modeling. 

BioNotus also specializes in both GLP and non-GLP large and small molecule bioanalysis. The company's services extend to general and juvenile toxicology, lipid profiling, liquid chromatography, and intestinal and skin permeability. Its pharmacokinetic services include PK screening for other species, pharmacokinetic studies, and pharmacology consulting. 

BioNotus stands at the forefront of bioanalysis with its expertise in LCMS/MS, HRMS, LC-UV/Fluo, and LC-CAD. The company is also renowned for its capabilities in proteomics, metabolomics, and multi-omics. Additionally, BioNotus offers advanced pharmacometrics and quantitative systems pharmacology services, providing physiology-based pharmacokinetics, population pharmacokinetics, and PK/PD analysis. 

Lastly, BioNotus excels in the discovery ADMET domain, offering tier 1 assay, early PK predictions, and metabolite identification, solidifying its position as a pioneering new startup in the biomedical industry.

title: BioLizard
description:
BioLizard, established in 2018, is a mid-sized business with its headquarters in Gent, Belgium. It is a prominent player in the field of bioinformatics, data analytics, and data management services, leading the wave of digital transformation within the life sciences industry. 

BioLizard provides a variety of services in assay development consulting, autoantibody testing, Bayesian statistics, and more. It has become a trusted partner for data strategy and execution for companies operating in various sectors, from drug discovery to clinical research and diagnostics. 

The company's strength lies in its team of over 50 experts, known as 'The Lizards'. With their combined expertise in biology and computer science, they bring an exceptional understanding of each client's data environment. They apply this knowledge to offer insights and tools that align with the client's objectives, ultimately enhancing discovery and return on investment in research and development.

BioLizard holds the Good Clinical Laboratory Practice (GCLP) certification, reinforcing its commitment to quality and excellence in the services it provides to its clients. 

For additional information on BioLizard, you can visit their official website at https://lizard.bio/ or follow them on LinkedIn.

title: Cristal Therapeutics
description:
Cristal Therapeutics, a small business based in EV Maastricht, NL, is a leading innovator in the field of therapeutic development, aiming to improve the therapeutic profile of their partners' programs. Leveraging over a decade of practical experience, the company harnesses the power of three distinct yet interconnected technologies. These technologies include CliCr®, CriPec®, and CriVac®, each designed to enhance the efficacy and reduce the toxicity of a wide array of therapeutics.

CliCr® offers superior conjugation, CriPec® enhances target specificity, and CriVac® fosters highly selective immune responses. Each technology plays a critical role in boosting therapeutic effectiveness and diminishing adverse effects. This unique combination of technologies expands the potential of Antibody-Drug Conjugates (ADCs), immuno-oncology treatments, vaccines, and a broad spectrum of other therapeutics, all tailored to modality and indication.

Cristal Therapeutics is dedicated to overcoming challenges and unlocking the full potential of these therapeutics. Strategically located at Oxfordlaan 55 EV Maastricht, in the Netherlands, the company is primed for collaborations and partnerships in the healthcare sector. With a revenue range between 1-10M TTM, it demonstrates a robust financial standing, enhancing its appeal as a potential partner in the industry. By continually pushing the boundaries of what is possible in therapeutic development, Cristal Therapeutics is poised to transform healthcare delivery and contribute significantly to the global health landscape.

title: CODA-CERVA
description:
CODA-CERVA, a small business entity nestled in Uccle, Bruxelles, Belgium, has made a significant mark in the field of agro-chemical and veterinary analysis services. Despite the specific revenue bracket indicating a small business with a 1-10M TTM Revenue, CODA-CERVA's influence and reach are far from minimal. 

The company operates from two primary sites, one located at Leuvensesteenweg 17 Vlaams-Brabant in 3080 Belgium, and another at Rue Groeselenberg 99 Uccle in Bruxelles, 1180 Belgium. This strategic placement across two locations facilitates a wider reach of its specialized services, catering to a diverse clientele in need of expert agro-chemical and veterinary analysis. 

CODA-CERVA's core focus lies in providing top-notch analysis services in the agro-chemical and veterinary sectors. This specialized service helps support and advance both the agricultural and veterinary sciences, contributing to healthier livestock and improved crop yields. This commitment to excellence is a testament to its unique quality as a leading service provider in these niche sectors. 

Although the year of establishment is not specified, the company has evidently carved out a niche for itself as an industry leader in the specialized field. CODA-CERVA's dedicated service to the agro-chemical and veterinary sectors exemplifies its significant role in bolstering the scientific community in Belgium and beyond.

title: Conforma
description:
Established in 1957, Conforma is a boutique business based in Oost-Vlaanderen, Vlaams Gewest, Belgium, operating in a revenue bracket of 1-10M TTM. Despite its small size, Conforma has made a significant impact in its industry, offering a unique range of services.

With their headquarters conveniently located at Zenderstraat 10, Conforma operates from the heart of Belgium, in the vibrant province of Oost-Vlaanderen. This strategic location allows the company to readily serve its customers and partners while fostering strong business relationships within the region.

At its core, Conforma prides itself on a trio of specialized services. The company provides bulk manufacturing solutions, proving itself a reliable partner for businesses in need of extensive production capacities. Additionally, Conforma excels in formulation development, offering bespoke solutions tailored to the specific requirements of various dosage forms. This makes it an invaluable ally for businesses venturing into the development of new products or improving existing ones.

Furthermore, Conforma extends its expertise to packaging services, ensuring products are not only effectively manufactured and formulated but also attractively and securely packaged. This end-to-end service offering underscores Conforma's commitment to providing comprehensive solutions to its clients.

With over six decades of industry experience, Conforma continues to uphold its reputation as a trusted and capable partner, delivering quality and consistency in all aspects of its business.

title: Concawe
description:
Concawe is a small but impactful business based in Auderghem, Bruxelles, Belgium. The company was established in 1963 by a pioneering group of oil companies to conduct research on environmental issues related to the oil industry. Over the years, its membership has expanded to encompass most oil companies operating in Europe, and the range of its activities has evolved in response to societal concerns regarding environmental, health, and safety issues.

These concerns now include areas such as fuel quality and emissions, air and water quality, soil contamination, waste management, occupational health and safety, petroleum product stewardship, and cross-country pipeline performance. Concawe's mission is to carry out research programs to provide impartial scientific information that enhances the understanding of the environmental health, safety and economic performance aspects of both petroleum refining and the distribution and use of refined products.

The company assists in the development of cost-effective policies and legislation by EU institutions and Member States, and aids in informed decision making and legislative compliance by Association members. Concawe prides itself on conducting its activities with objectivity and scientific integrity, upholding the principles of sound science, transparency, and cost-effectiveness.

Recognising the need for collaborative efforts to tackle the environmental, health and safety challenges of the 21st century, Concawe is actively engaged in numerous partnerships and maintains contact with other industry sector associations and international organisations. It holds observer status at the United Nations Economic Council for Europe (UNECE), the OSPAR Commission, and the World Health Organization (WHO), and contributes to all EU Commission initiatives in its field of activity.

sites.name: Concawe
sites.address: 165 Boulevard du Souverain Auderghem, Bruxelles, 1160 Belgium

title: Centre d'Etude et de Recherches Veterinaires et Agrochimiques
description:
The Centre d'Etude et de Recherches Veterinaires et Agrochimiques (CODA-CERVA) is an innovative startup based in Uccle, Bruxelles, Belgium. The company, established in recent times, specializes in scientific research and provision of services aimed at promoting safe food production, animal health, and public health at both federal and international levels.

CODA-CERVA's primary operations revolve around supporting scientific research and providing expert advice in a proactive policy framework. The company is particularly involved in addressing issues related to epidemic, endemic, and emerging transmittable diseases in animals. It also focuses on zoonotic and emerging infectious diseases that pose a threat to public health.

Another significant area of CODA-CERVA's work is its involvement with contaminants and environmental quality issues related to safe food production. The company's activities extend to the field of epidemiology, including surveillance, risk analysis, and molecular epidemiology.

In light of the ever-increasing need for sustainable and socially acceptable agricultural practices, CODA-CERVA's commitment to scientific research and expert advice plays a crucial role. Their work contributes to informed policymaking and effective service provision, thus ensuring a safer and healthier environment for all. 

Operating from its headquarters at 99 Rue Groeselenberg in Uccle, Bruxelles, the company is committed to serving as a beacon of scientific excellence in the realm of veterinary and agrochemical research.

sites.name: Centre d'Etude et de Recherches Veterinaires et Agrochimiques

title: CONUSBAT - INTERNATIONALIZATION REGULATORY SERVICES
description:
CONUSBAT - Internationalization Regulatory Services is a new startup, located in the heart of Aachen, NRW, DE. Established recently, the company is a dynamic newcomer in the industry with the ambition to provide international regulatory services targeting specific sector industries.

The company offers services to a wide range of sectors including cosmetics and personal care, consumer health care, household cleaning agents, special medical devices, and specialty and fine chemicals. Its internationalization regulatory services are not limited to these industries, providing a breadth of expertise for companies looking to expand their horizons.

CONUSBAT is particularly skilled in the European Union (EU) market. The company provides strategic planning, compliance steps, PIF preparation, CPSR, CPNP notification under Regulation (EC) No 1223/2009 (Cosmetic Products). Additionally, it offers services for REACH (Regulation (EC) No 1907/2006) and CLP (Regulation (EC) No 1272/2008 - Classification, Labelling & Packaging).

The company also provides international representation as a Responsible Person (RP) for cosmetic products, REACH Only Representative (OR) for cosmetic ingredients & other chemicals as per Regulation (EC) 648/2004 (Household products and Detergents).

CONUSBAT has established worldwide strategic regulatory partnerships in USA/Canada, Brazil/S. America, Japan, ASEAN, China, India, S. Korea, Taiwan, Russia, Israel, Turkey, S. Africa, offering global knowledge for cosmetic ingredient compliance. 

Finally, the company provides training services that cover regulatory frameworks for cosmetics, borderline products, and chemicals, as well as GHS Training, available both online and onsite. The startup is set to become a cornerstone for companies seeking to navigate the complex world of international regulations.

Coris Bio is a small business enterprise that was established in 1997 and has since been making significant strides in its industry. The company is headquartered in Gembloux, located in the Walloon Region of Belgium, a strategic location that allows it to serve its diverse clientele effectively. Despite its classification as a small business, with a trailing twelve months (TTM) revenue between 1 and 10 million, Coris Bio has been demonstrating an impressive performance over the years, which is a testament to its commitment to excellence.

Coris Bio operates from two sites, both situated in Gembloux. The first site is located at 29 Rue Jean Sonet, Gembloux, Wallonie, 5032 Belgium, while the second site is at 4 Jean Sonet Street, in the same region. Although the original description of Coris Bio does not provide detailed information about the company's services or certifications, the business's longevity and financial performance indicate a high level of professionalism and competence. As Coris Bio continues to grow and expand, it remains dedicated to serving its customers in the best possible way, contributing to its reputation as a reliable and trusted business in its field. 

With its strong foundation and strategic location, Coris Bio is well-positioned for future growth and success.

description:
Cosucra is a small-scale business, generating a turnover between 1 and 10 million USD, nestled in the picturesque locale of Pecq, Région wallonne, Belgium. Despite its size, the company has distinguished itself in the food industry as a developer and producer of natural food ingredients.

Cosucra's distinctive business model revolves around locally sourcing chicory and peas as the primary raw materials for its products. This approach is remarkable in its commitment to supporting local agriculture, ensuring freshness and quality, while reducing the carbon footprint linked to transport.

The company is headquartered at 1 Rue de la Sucrerie in Pecq, Région wallonne, an address that beautifully hints at the sweet nature of its business. While the exact year of its establishment remains undisclosed, Cosucra's operations undeniably demonstrate its expertise in the industry, promising reliability and quality to its clientele.

title: Clinitude Clinical Consultancy
description:
Clinitude Clinical Consultancy, established in the vibrant city of Leuven, Flanders in Belgium, is a small-scale business that generates between 1 to 10 million in trailing twelve months (TTM) revenue. This innovative company is characterized by its youth and dynamism, reflecting a fresh and forward-thinking approach to the industry.

Boasting a specialized focus, Clinitude Clinical Consultancy excels in the setup and management of clinical trials on both a national and international scale. Their expertise is not confined to the borders of Belgium, as they extend their services globally, embracing the challenges and opportunities that such a broad scope offers.

Despite its size, Clinitude Clinical Consultancy demonstrates an impressive capacity to handle complex projects and deliver reliable solutions. Its strategic location in Leuven, Flanders, a hub of innovation and development, enables the company to stay at the forefront of industry trends and advancements.

In a field that demands precision, integrity, and a comprehensive understanding of clinical procedures, Clinitude Clinical Consultancy stands as a testament to excellence. As a company, it is committed to serving its clients with unwavering dedication, ensuring their needs are met and expectations surpassed. 

In summary, Clinitude Clinical Consultancy is a small yet dynamic business that is making significant strides in the field of clinical trials, both within Belgium and on the international stage.

title: Crossover
description:
Crossover is a small business entity, generating between 1-10 million in trailing twelve-month (TTM) revenue. Although the year of establishment remains unknown, the company has been successful in marking its presence in the global market. The headquarters of the company are located in Brussels, Belgium. 

In addition to its primary location, Crossover operates out of multiple sites situated globally, specifically in Industriestrasse 7 Zug, Zug, 6300 Switzerland, Stolichna, Sofia-city, 1164 Bulgaria, and Brussels, 1170 Belgium. This international presence allows the company to cater to a diverse clientele, making it a truly global entity.

Crossover's core offerings include a wide range of specialized services. They host clinical research units which drive innovation in the medical field. They also handle regulatory affairs, ensuring compliance with relevant laws and regulations. Their Good Clinical Practice (GCP) training program is a valuable resource for professionals in the industry, providing them with the necessary skills and knowledge to conduct clinical trials effectively. In conclusion, Crossover is a small yet impactful business, specializing in clinical research, regulatory affairs, GCP training and quality assurance. With its global presence and diverse offerings, it continues to make significant contributions to the industry.

title: Collet Lab, de Duve Institute, UCLouvain
description:
Established in 2005, Collet Lab is a notable academic core facility based within the de Duve Institute at UCLouvain. With its headquarters in Brussels, Belgium, the institution also operates from multiple sites including Place de l'université in Louvain-La-Neuve and Avenue Hippocrate in Brussels. 

Collet Lab offers an array of services representative of its commitment to the advancement of medical science. These services encompass bacterial cell culture, bacterial expression, microbiology, and pathogen assays. The goal of these services is to further the understanding of bacterial defense mechanisms against toxic molecules in their environment, which crucially includes antibiotics.

The lab's work is driven by a broader mission to contribute significantly to the global effort to prevent the resurgence of untreatable epidemics. By studying the intricacies of bacterial defense mechanisms, Collet Lab aims to generate insights that could potentially guide the development of more effective treatments and prevention strategies in the future. 

In essence, Collet Lab at the de Duve Institute, UCLouvain, is a leading academic core facility that is devoted to combating the threat of antibiotic-resistant bacteria and untreatable epidemics through their specialized services and rigorous scientific research.

title: Cheminfosolutions Ltd
description:
Established in 2022, Cheminfosolutions Ltd is a boutique consultancy firm, specializing in Molecular Modelling, Computational Chemistry, Cheminformatics, Data Science, and Artificial Intelligence. Based in Hitchin, Hertfordshire, GB, the company has a strong presence and additional sites in both the United Kingdom and Aachen, Germany. 

Despite being a small-scale consultant with fewer than five employees, Cheminfosolutions Ltd boasts several years of experience in the pharmaceutical industry. This includes experience with large-scale pharma and Contract Research Organizations (CROs), which has cultivated a team of experts in applying advanced computational chemistry methods for lead generation and optimization. 

The services offered by Cheminfosolutions Ltd are extensive and cutting-edge. These include Activity Prediction, Chemoinformatics Consulting, Compound Docking, Discovery Computational Chemistry, Library Design & Evaluation, Molecular Dynamics Software, Pharmacophore Modeling, QSAR Analysis, and Virtual Screening. 

Cheminfosolutions Ltd prides itself on staying ahead of current trends and developments in computational chemistry techniques. The company not only adopts these techniques but also fosters their growth and application for its client's benefit. This forward-thinking approach makes Cheminfosolutions Ltd a trusted and reliable partner in the rapidly evolving field of computational chemistry and related sectors.

title: CER Groupe
description:
CER Groupe, established in 1977, is a mid-sized business with its headquarters located in Marche-en-Famenne, BE. With a variety of sites located in Wallonia, Belgium, including 8 Rue du Point du Jour and Rue de la Science 8, this company prides itself as a Belgian Registered Research and Excellence Center. 

The company specializes in providing services, products, and research in various sectors including veterinarian, food safety, biotech, and biomedical areas. It has three core activities - preclinical, biomanufacturing, and diagnostic. 

In the preclinical sector, CER Groupe develops and validates preclinical models in cell therapy, oncology, infectiology, and immunology, among others, in SPF and up to BSL-3 facilities and large animals. It also provides custom-tailored solutions for studies in SPF and/or GLP facilities.

In the field of biomanufacturing, it offers antibodies development, upstream and downstream processing, as well as proteins studies, design, and processing. It also provides biobanking and bioproduction services, handling cell lines, viruses, and BL3 and BL2 pathogens.

Under diagnostics, the company focuses on the development and validation of LC and GC-MS/MS, ELISA, and PCR assays. It also produces diagnosis kits for detecting animal diseases, veterinary drug residues, and allergens in foodstuffs, feed, and biological samples. Moreover, it serves as the Belgian National Reference Laboratory.

With a wide array of services such as cell culture, gene synthesis, protein purification, and virus production, CER Groupe embodies a comprehensive solution for biotech and biomedical needs.

title: Cerba Healthcare Belgium
description:
Cerba Healthcare Belgium, established in 1979, is a mid-sized business that primarily operates from two ISO-15189 accredited laboratories in Klaartestraat 20 Zwijnaarde, 9052 Belgium: CRI in Gent and LBS in Brussels. As a valued affiliate of the international Cerba Healthcare Group, it provides an array of medical and bioanalytical lab testing services, supporting local physicians and biotech and pharmaceutical companies. 

Cerba Healthcare Belgium offers a wide range of services including Biomarker Clinical Utility, Biomarker Clinical Validation, Clinical Chemistry, Complete Blood Count, Complete Metabolic Panel Testing, ELISA, Endocrine Assays, Flow Cytometry, Immunoassays, Large Molecule Bioanalysis, Lipid Profiling, Lipoprotein Associated Phospholipase A2 Testing, Microalbumin/Creatinine Ratio (MACR), and Microbiome Services. Notably, it also has capabilities in Biochemistry, Serology, Hematology, Hemostasis, Microbiology, Flow Cytometry, Emerging Biomarkers, Advanced Sample Prep, and Toxicology.

Additionally, the company can be directly contacted for small R&D related lab testing services, and it works in collaboration with its sister company, Cerba Research, for clinical trials. Upholding the highest quality standards, Cerba Healthcare Belgium operates under ISO-15189 and GCLP certifications. With four decades of experience, Cerba Healthcare Belgium continues to deliver reliable and innovative healthcare solutions.

title: CliniSciences
description:
CliniSciences is a leading French company, established in 1981, and primarily stationed in Nanterre, France. It operates as a mid-sized business, with an annual turnover ranging from 10 to 100 million dollars. The company's extensive reach is highlighted by its presence in several locations across Europe, including Spain, Portugal, the Netherlands, Belgium, Morocco, the United Kingdom, Ireland, Italy, Switzerland, and its primary location in France.

CliniSciences distinguishes itself by offering a broad array of services and products, geared towards both research and diagnostic applications. Their services span from 3D Cell Culture, Adipogenesis Assay, Antibody Conjugation, and Antibody Sequencing, to Cytotoxicity, DNA Mutagenesis, Flow Cytometry, and Genome Editing, among others. The company's vast product offerings include reagents, cells, human samples, and more. 

The firm also boasts of owning ten other companies, such as Anawa, Biotrend, Generon, Hexabiogen, and Kyvobio, situated throughout Europe, including countries such as the United Kingdom, Germany, Spain, Italy, the Netherlands, and Switzerland. These subsidiaries reinforce CliniSciences' commitment to providing life science reagents, services, and instruments. 

In conclusion, CliniSciences remains committed to facilitating advancements in the life sciences field by distributing top-quality products and services from suppliers worldwide. Through its comprehensive range of offerings and its vast presence across Europe, CliniSciences continues to make a significant impact in the research and diagnostic sectors.

title: Cerba Research
description:
Established in 1983, Cerba Research is a leading global business headquartered in Ghent, Belgium, with additional sites in the United States, France, and the Netherlands. The company is recognized for its extensive range of services, from Anatomic Pathology and Antibody Detection to Clinical Trial Design and Management, serving clients across a variety of therapeutic areas. These areas include Cardiovascular diseases, Infectious diseases, Inflammatory disorders, Autoimmune diseases, Oncology, Metabolic diseases, and Rare/Orphan diseases, among others. 

Cerba Research's commitment to quality is demonstrated by its impressive lineup of certifications, including the Belgian Accreditation Body (BELAC), Clinical Laboratory Improvement Amendments (CLIA), College of American Pathologists (CAP), Good Laboratory Practice (GLP), and International Organization for Standards 15189 (ISO 15189).

For over three decades, Cerba Research has been a pioneer in the realm of clinical trial conduct. The company's central lab services incorporate routine testing, custom assay development, biobanking and storage, global project management and logistical support, operational support, and the use of artificial intelligence. From the initial phases of a protocol through to development and market launch, Cerba Research's dedicated team of experts deliver top-tier, personalized laboratory and diagnostic solutions, affirming their role as industry leaders in complex clinical research.

title: CellCarta Biosciences
description:
CellCarta Biosciences, a large business with significant revenue, was established in the year 2000 and currently has its headquarters in Dartmouth, Nova Scotia, CA. Recognized globally as a prominent provider of specialized precision medicine laboratory services, CellCarta caters to the biopharmaceutical industry. It operates worldwide from 11 facilities located in Canada, the United States, Belgium, Australia, and China.

The company's services span across a broad range, including but not limited to Adherent Cell Culture, Antibody Detection, Biomarker Discovery, Cell Sorting, and Digital Pathology. They have developed expertise in complex assay development for clinical studies, supported by their team of qualified professionals which includes a substantial number of individuals with Ph.D. degrees. 

CellCarta's integrated analytical platforms in immunology, histopathology, proteomics, and genomics, coupled with specimen collection and logistics services, bolster the entire drug development cycle, from discovery to late-stage clinical trials. 

In addition to laboratory services, CellCarta offers comprehensive integrated data solutions, including data management, bioinformatics, biostatistics, data interpretation, image analysis, and AI/ML data interpretation. Their commitment to quality is evident in their operations and they hold a Clinical Laboratory Improvement Amendments (CLIA) certification, further cementing their position in the industry. 

With two decades of experience, CellCarta Biosciences continues to make strides in the field of precision medicine, bridging the gap between laboratory services and data solutions.

title: C-Path B.V
description:
C-Path B.V, established in 2021, is an innovative startup based in Diepenbeek, Limburg, BE. With additional locations at Mechelsestraat 24 Lier and Agoralaan Abis Diepenbeek, this company is making its mark in the realm of pathology services. As a new business with a budding revenue stream, C-Path B.V offers a comprehensive range of preclinical and clinical pathology services.

Their services are extensive, ranging from Anatomic Pathology, Apoptosis Assays, to Cell and Tissue Histology. They also specialize in Chronic Kidney Disease Models, Clinical Pathology, and Diabetic Retinopathy Models. C-Path B.V has developed a niche in the field of pathology with services like Histopathology, Immunohistochemistry, and Neurotoxicity Study. They also offer unique models for Oncology and Liver Fibrosis, and various staining methods including Hematoxylin & Eosin (H&E) Staining.

In addition to traditional pathology services, the company places a significant emphasis on the integration of technology in their operations. They offer digital pathology and medical imaging services, and utilize artificial intelligence for pathology. Furthermore, they provide digital sample tracking and data management services, enhancing their efficiency and effectiveness.

C-Path B.V combines conventional and molecular pathology, laboratory animal pathology, and preclinical safety and efficacy services. They also offer clinical consulting, positioning themselves as a comprehensive provider in the field. The focus they place on digitalization is not just a companion to their expertise but a tool intended to save pathologists' valuable time, allowing them to focus on critical areas where their expertise is most needed.

title: Delphi Genetics
description:
Delphi Genetics, established in 2001, is a small business specializing in biotechnology. Headquartered in the Hainaut region of Wallonne, Belgium, it also operates in Charleroi in the Walloon region. Despite being a small scale business with a total transactional monetary value (TTM) revenue ranging from 1 to 10 million, Delphi Genetics leaves a significant footprint in the field of genetic engineering and research.

The company offers a broad spectrum of services that cater to diverse needs in the genetics arena. These include gene services, cloning services, and expression services. Their expertise is not limited to practical applications, as they also provide in silico solutions, allowing researchers and scientists to simulate biological processes on a computer. Furthermore, they supply a wide array of reagents, essential tools in any biological research.

Delphi Genetics' ability to offer such comprehensive services in the field of genetics, despite its small size, sets it apart. Their work has the potential to influence numerous sectors, from healthcare to agriculture, making them a crucial player in the biotechnology industry. With a strong foundation and a commitment to innovation, Delphi Genetics continues to contribute significantly to the advancement of genetic research.

title: Dezyme
description:
Dezyme is a small business based in Ixelles, Brussels, BE, with annual revenues between 1 and 10 million. Despite not having a specified establishment year, the company has made significant strides in its unique field. Dezyme's primary mission is to assist professionals in rapidly identifying and selecting the right protein for specific applications. This is achieved through the combination of highly intuitive web software and substantial expertise in bioinformatics.

Dezyme's innovative solution optimizes screening and experimental efforts in a reliable, time, and cost-effective manner. The process begins with experimentally resolved or 3D-modeled structures, enabling the in silico prediction of mutations for stability and thermal resistance changes.

The company proudly serves a user base of more than 500, reflecting their trust in Dezyme's expertise. This growing community of users is testament to the company's commitment to providing cutting-edge solutions in bioinformatics. With its headquarters at 50 av. Franklin Roosevelt CP 165/61, 1050 Belgium, Dezyme continues to invite professionals to experience the benefits of their unique and innovative services.

title: Digital Cell Imaging Labs
description:
Digital Cell Imaging Labs is a small business situated in the heart of Vlaams-Brabant, Vlaams Gewest, Belgium. Despite its size, with a reported turnover of 1-10 million TTM Revenue, this innovative company is a strong player in its field. 

The company's primary site is located in Mwami Mutaradreef, a hub of business activity in Vlaams-Brabant. This strategic location allows them to serve their clients effectively and efficiently. 

Digital Cell Imaging Labs specializes in offering a wide range of software and screening services. Among their offerings are the quantification of angiogenesis, a critical process involving the growth of new blood vessels. Additionally, they provide micronucleus testing, an essential service for assessing the cytogenic damage in cells. 

Another notable service offered by Digital Cell Imaging Labs is colony forming assays. These tests are vital in determining the effectiveness of different substances on the growth of various cells and bacteria.

With its specialized services and strategic location, Digital Cell Imaging Labs is dedicated to providing its clients with top-notch services in the field of digital cell imaging. This small business is making a significant impact in its industry by offering unique, high-quality services.

title: Datwyler
description:
Established in 1970, Datwyler is a small business with its headquarters in Alken, Flanders, Belgium. The company has carved a niche for itself in the market as a leading supplier of both primary and secondary packaging components. Specializing in the use of rubber and aluminium, Datwyler caters to the most advanced sectors of the parenteral pharmaceutical market. 

Over the years, the company has built its reputation by focusing on specific areas such as vaccines, diabetic care and biotechnology. Its commitment to these specialized sectors has enabled Datwyler to provide highly tailored solutions, meeting the unique needs of its clients in these fields. The firm operates a site in Alken, Flanders, Belgium, further solidifying its presence and dedication to the region. 

Even as a small business with a revenue range of 1-10 million, Datwyler has managed to make significant contributions to the pharmaceutical packaging industry. It’s this dedication to quality and innovation that has allowed them to consistently deliver premium packaging solutions to their clients. 

In conclusion, Datwyler is more than just a supplier; it is a reliable partner for companies operating in the intricate world of vaccines, diabetic care, and biotechnology. With nearly five decades of experience, it continues to provide unparalleled service and products in a highly specialized and demanding market.

title: Data Investigation Company Europe
description:
Data Investigation Company Europe, also known as DICE, is an established small business that was founded in 1989. With its headquarters strategically located in St-Agatha-Berchem, Bruxelles, BE, this renowned company operates with a financial bandwidth that falls within the 1-10 million TTM revenue bracket. 

Over the years, DICE has sustained its position in the industry by providing top-tier quality services that revolve around project initiation, data management, and statistical analysis. The specialization in these three core areas has allowed DICE to offer unique solutions that cater to the diverse needs of its clients.

title: DIAsource ImmunoAssays SA
description:
DIAsource ImmunoAssays® S.A., a member of the BioVendor Group, is an internationally recognized diagnostic company headquartered in Ottignies-Louvain-la-Neuve, Région wallonne, Belgium. With an impressive track record spanning over three decades, it specializes in the field of In-Vitro Diagnostics (IVD), including kits and instrumentation.

The company's proficiency lies in the development, manufacturing, and marketing of clinical diagnostic products. These products primarily cater to the areas of endocrinology, auto-immunity, and infectious diseases - making a significant contribution to the global healthcare sector. 

Over the years, DIAsource ImmunoAssays® S.A. has earned a reputation as a global leader in the Radioimmunoassay (RIA) business. It has gained the trust of hundreds of customers worldwide by consistently delivering cutting-edge diagnostic solutions. 

The company also boasts a vast portfolio of more than 200 ELISA products, which has only grown since its acquisition by the BioVendor Group. DIAsource ImmunoAssays® S.A. is now also promoting TestLine Diagnostics branded ELISA and Immunoblot products in the fields of Autoimmunity and Virology. 

In addition to its core diagnostic services, DIAsource ImmunoAssays® S.A. is actively engaged in the Life Science market, where it markets BioVendor ELISA Research Use Only (RUO) products. The company's commitment to quality and innovation continues to set industry standards and provide valuable support to its customers.

title: DNAVision
description:
Established in 2004, DNAVision is a small-scale enterprise situated in Hainaut, Région Wallonne, Belgium, with an annual turnover ranging between 1 to 10 million. The company is strategically located with sites in Boulevard de Colonster Liège and Avenue Georges Lemaitre Hainaut, both in Région Wallonne, Belgium. 

DNAVision specializes in providing a variety of services, including SNP genotyping, in vivo and in vitro gene expression analysis, and sequencing services. These services are central to the company's operations as they form the core of their business model. 

SNP genotyping is a process that identifies variations in the DNA sequence that occur when a single nucleotide in the genome sequence is altered. In vivo and in vitro gene expression analysis, on the other hand, provides comprehensive insights into how genes behave in a natural or artificial environment, respectively. 

Lastly, the company offers sequencing services, a technique used to determine the precise order of nucleotides within a DNA molecule. It includes any method or technology that is used to determine the order of the four bases: adenine, guanine, cytosine, and thymine. 

In conclusion, DNAVision is a small yet dynamic company, offering specialized and crucial services in the field of genomics and gene analysis. Despite its size, it holds a vital position in the market owing to its unique and advanced service offerings.

title: Denys Research Consultants BVBA (DRC)
description:
Established in 1997, Denys Research Consultants BVBA (DRC) is a vibrant, highly experienced full-service Clinical Research Organization (CRO) situated in Kanegem, Belgium. As a small business, with an annual turnover ranging between 1 to 10 million, DRC has carved a unique niche in the healthcare industry by providing high-quality clinical development services. 

DRC's extensive expertise spans over two decades, during which they have been an integral part of numerous national and international pharmaceutical and biotechnology trials, ranging from phase I to phase IV. Over the years, they have gained comprehensive experience in both non-interventional and interventional studies, further strengthening their position in the industry. 

DRC operates from two sites situated in Vlaanderen and Kanegem, Belgium, which serves as their headquarters. Their versatile range of services includes Project Management and Planning, Clinical Monitoring and Investigator Site Management, Regulatory Management, and Pharmacovigilance. They also offer Clinical Data Management, Biostatistics, and Medical Writing services. 

DRC's commitment to quality and excellence in the academic research, pharmaceutical, biotech, and medical device industry has made them a trusted partner for many. Their dedicated team continually strives to meet and exceed client expectations, positioning DRC as a leader in the clinical research field.

title: Diagenode
description:
Established in 2003 and headquartered in Denville, NJ, Diagenode is a distinguished global provider of epigenetics research and services. As a part of Hologic, a large business, Diagenode is renowned for delivering comprehensive solutions for epigenome-wide analyses, epigenetics-related discovery, advanced biomarker discovery, including cancer biomarkers, and functional epigenomics. 

Operating from multiple sites, including LIEGE SCIENCE PARK in Liège, Belgium, and their primary base in Denville, NJ, Diagenode offers a wide array of services. The services range from Antibody Products, Biomarker Discovery, CRISPR, to DNA Products and NGS: Next Generation Sequencing, among others. Their expertise lies in providing tailored epigenomics solutions, including sample preparation, sequencing, and bioinformatics support.

Diagenode notably sets itself apart in the realm of epigenetic research. The company's services are backed by extensive experimental validation, ensuring accuracy and reliability. It offers a comprehensive suite of services, allowing researchers to streamline their workflow. What's more, Diagenode provides customized solutions to cater to specific research needs, including personalized bioinformatic analyses. 

Moreover, Diagenode fosters a culture of collaboration and innovation, staying at the forefront of epigenetic research. In a nutshell, it's Diagenode's unique blend of expertise, comprehensive solutions, customization, and collaboration that elevates it in the competitive landscape.

title: EGAMI
description:
The Expert Group Antwerp Molecular Imaging, known by its acronym EGAMI, is a small yet remarkable business situated in the heart of Antwerp, in the Flemish Region of Belgium. Established at the Universiteitsplein Antwerp, EGAMI is a unique enterprise that has carved out a niche for itself in the specialized field of molecular imaging. 

Despite the modest size of its team, the company generates significant revenue, falling within the 1-10 million range over the trailing twelve months. Though the exact year of its establishment remains undisclosed, EGAMI's contribution to the scientific community is undeniably substantial and noteworthy.

EGAMI's primary service revolves around offering an extensive array of specific imaging applications. These applications span across a broad spectrum, from the subcellular level to in vivo imaging. The company's expertise lies in working with small animals, such as mice, rats, and birds. 

Essentially, EGAMI is a beacon of scientific innovation, providing crucial insights into the complex world of molecular imaging. Despite its small size, the company continues to make significant strides in its field, demonstrating the power of specialization and dedication to scientific advancement.

In conclusion, Exprimo stands as a testament to the power of data and quantitative analysis in driving pharmaceutical innovation. Its distinctive service offering, strategic location, and dedicated team all combine to make Exprimo a pioneering force in the consulting field.

title: European Centre for Chirality (EC2)
description:
The European Centre for Chirality (EC2) is a small-scale business primarily located in Antwerpen, Vlaams Gewest, Belgium. Although the company's establishment year remains unspecified, EC2 has managed to generate a revenue of between 1-10 million TTM. Besides its main headquarters in Antwerpen, the company boasts additional sites in Guildford, United Kingdom, and two other locations in Belgium: Oost-Vlaanderen and Groenenborgerlaan Antwerpen. 

The company's unique business model involves a strategic partnership with BioTools Inc, the University of Antwerp, and Ghent University. Through this collaboration, EC2 has carved out a niche for itself in the provision of analytical services related to chirality. Specifically, the company supports structure determination, a critical process in various scientific and technological fields, by offering its specialized chiral-related services. 

Essentially, EC2 serves as a pivotal player in the scientific community, leveraging its expertise in chirality and its strong network of partners to meet the unique needs of its clients. Despite its size, EC2's impact is substantial, highlighting the role of small businesses in advancing scientific understanding and innovation.

description:
EggCentris is a small-scale business situated in the heart of Vlaams-Brabant, Brussel, BE. The enterprise's main base of operations is strategically located at Luchthaven Brussel-Nationaal (BRU), Vlaams-Brabant, Brussel, 1820 Belgium, a vibrant and dynamic hub that fosters innovation and growth.

The services offered by EggCentris are multifaceted and vital in nature. The company has carved a niche for itself in the domain of life sciences. Its primary services encompass toxicity testing, bio-activity determination, and fertility and embryonic studies. These crucial services aid in deriving valuable insights about the potential hazardous effects of specific substances and materials on living organisms.

Furthermore, EggCentris plays a significant role in determining the bio-activity of compounds, which is crucial for pharmaceutical and biomedical research. The company's fertility and embryonic studies also contribute to advancements in reproductive health and embryology.

Despite its humble size, EggCentris has made an indelible mark in its field through its unique services, reflecting its commitment to scientific progress and innovation.

title: Elegent
description:
Elegent, established in 2022, is a promising startup headquartered in Ghent, Belgium. This innovative company is situated within the vibrant Technologiepark 82, a hub renowned for breakthrough discoveries and advancements. As a fresh addition to the business landscape, Elegent has a unique selling proposition of accelerating the delivery of pharmaceutical products to the market, thereby saving invaluable time. 

Elegent owes its roots to Ghent University, emerging as a spin-off company that has successfully transitioned from academia to industry. This unique heritage equips the company with a deep understanding of both the academic and commercial landscape, allowing it to bridge the gap between the two. 

Elegent's primary services encompass Discovery Statistical and Mathematical Modeling, Dissolution Profiling, Drug Formulation, Raman Spectroscopy, and Tablet Manufacturing. These services are aimed at providing comprehensive solutions to the pharmaceutical and food industries. 

One of Elegent’s key strategies is to harness academic innovations to address Process Analytical Technology (PAT) and process development challenges prevalent in the industry. This approach empowers the company to offer both modeling software and consultancy services that are backed by rigorous academic research, thereby ensuring reliable and effective solutions. 

As a new startup, Elegent is poised to make a significant impact in the pharmaceutical and food industries by leveraging its unique blend of academic insight and practical application. This combination positions Elegent at the forefront of industry innovation, aiming to revolutionize the way these sectors operate.

title: EMTEX
description:
Established in 2001, EMTEX is a compact and autonomous company specializing in providing professional medical writing services worldwide. With its headquarters located in the quaint town of Sint-Gillis-Waas, Vlaanderen, in Belgium, this small-scale enterprise, boasting a revenue of 1-10 million TTM, has made a significant impact in the biotechnology, pharmaceutical, food, and medical device industries.

EMTEX is well-regarded for its range of specialized services. These include Clinical Development Planning, Clinical Protocol Design & Development, IND Writing, Medical Writing and Editing, NDA Writing, and Publication Writing. With a commitment to quality and excellence, these services are meticulously executed to ensure they meet the diverse needs of their global client base.

Moreover, EMTEX operates an additional site at Hoogeindeken in Sint-Gillis-Waas, Vlaanderen, further solidifying its local presence and facilitating seamless service delivery. 

In terms of credibility, EMTEX proudly holds an International Organization for Standards 27001 (ISO 27001) certification. This accreditation not only underscores their commitment to maintaining high standards but also reinforces their reputation for operational excellence.

In conclusion, EMTEX stands as a small yet influential player in its field, offering a range of comprehensive services to cater to the dynamic needs of the biotechnology, pharmaceutical, food, and medical device industries worldwide. Its commitment to quality, coupled with a strategic presence in Belgium, ensures it continues to deliver value to all its stakeholders.

title: Eurofins Scientific
description:
Eurofins Scientific, a large-scale business with over 100 million in trailing twelve months (TTM) revenue, was established in the year 1987. This industry leader has its headquarters nestled in the heart of Ghent, nestled in Oost-Vlaanderen, Belgium. 

Eurofins Scientific's reach extends far beyond its main headquarters, with additional sites strategically located across Belgium. These include an additional site in Ghent at Industriepark 7B in Oost-Vlaanderen, 9052, another at Luchthaven Brussel-Nationaal (BRU) in Vlaams-Brabant, Brussel, 1820, and even reaching out to the United Kingdom at Val Fleuri 23 Luxemburg, 1526.

Eurofins Scientific boasts a broad array of services, dedicated to providing integrated solutions to its diverse clientele. Their expertise extends across multiple domains, including but not limited to medicinal chemistry, absorption, distribution, metabolism, and elimination (ADME) screening, drug metabolism and pharmacokinetics (DMPK), in vivo pharmacology, bioanalytical services, and safety toxicology services.

Throughout its years of operation, Eurofins Scientific has dedicated itself to meeting and exceeding industry standards. Through its commitment to quality, integrity, and innovation, the company continues to make significant strides in the scientific community, offering reliable and comprehensive solutions that cater to a wide range of needs and demands in the ever-evolving world of science.

title: Exothera
description:
Established in 2020, Exothera is a mid-sized business based in Jumet, Belgium, offering specialized services in the field of viral vector and nucleic acids production. As a Contract Research, Development, and Manufacturing Organization (CRDMO), the company capitalizes on an innovative range of manufacturing technologies and boasts extensive bioprocessing expertise. 

Exothera's comprehensive range of services includes, but is not limited to Adeno Associated Virus (AAV) Production, Bulk Manufacturing, Cell Transfection, Chemistry, Manufacturing and Controls (CMC), DNA/RNA Extraction & Purification, and Drug Substance and Drug Product Characterization and Manufacturing. They also provide large scale protein production and purification, lentivirus production, method development and validation, and various types of synthesis and sequencing services.

The company prides itself on delivering accelerated discovery services as well as process development and optimization to achieve Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP) clinical and commercial production of vaccines, viral vectors, and nucleic acids. 

Their dedicated and experienced team is committed to providing flexible and tailored solutions to support success in their client's bioproduction journey. They also offer the option to seamlessly deploy commercial facilities. The ultimate mission of Exothera is to make life-changing therapies accessible to all. More information about Exothera and its services can be found on their official website. 

By leveraging novel manufacturing technologies and top-tier bioprocessing expertise, Exothera stands as a leader in bespoke process optimization and GMP clinical and commercial production of viral vectors.

title: Feuerbach & Associates
description:
Feuerbach & Associates, a San Bruno, California-based small business, has earned a reputation for excellence in the field of data visualization and clinical information systems. Despite not having a precise year of establishment, this company has managed to carve out a niche for itself within the industry, generating annual revenue between 1 and 10 million dollars.

Feuerbach & Associates operates from two strategic locations. Their headquarters are nestled in San Bruno, CA, at 363 El Camino Real. They also maintain an international presence with a site located in the heart of Mitte Köln, Nordrhein-Westfalen, at Lütticher Straße 32, 52064 Germany. This transatlantic reach allows the company to cater to a diverse range of clients, while also tapping into the unique business environments of both the United States and Germany.

The company’s core expertise lies in creating robust data visualization systems that transform raw data into actionable insights. description:

Icometrix operates from a central site located at Kolonel Begaultlaan 1b / 12 Leuven, 3012 Belgium. The company's work is significantly impacting three primary areas: advanced image processing for clinical studies, typically for academic researchers; clinical trials for pharmaceutical and biotech companies; and clinical routine for neurologists and radiologists.

Demonstrating its commitment to maintaining the highest standards, Icometrix holds several prestigious certifications. These include Good Clinical Practice (GCP), International Organization for Standards 13485 (ISO 13485), and International Organization for Standards 27001 (ISO 27001). These accreditations serve as a testament to Icometrix's dedication to delivering top-notch, compliant services in the healthcare sector.

services.description: Economic evaluation in which costs and benefits (outcomes) are expressed in monetary units, to determine if the benefits of an intervention outweigh the costs.

services.name: Cost Effectiveness Analysis
services.description: Compare alternative treatments that lead to similar health outcomes.

services.name: Decision Analytic Modeling
services.description: Assess effects, costs and economic outcomes of treatment. These include cost-effectiveness models and budget impact models.

services.name: Formulary & Reimbursement Strategy
services.description: Develop strategy and narrative to gain formulary access on insurance plans.

services.name: HTA Evidence Preparation/Strategy Dossier Development
services.description: Perform evidence preparation and/or create strategies for the systematic evaluation of the properties, effects, and/or impacts of health care technology.

services.name: Health & Pharmacoeconomics
services.description: Identify, measure and compare the cost-benefit ratio of products and services.

services.name: Health Economics and Outcomes Research (HEOR)
services.description: Evaluate data collected during drug development to maximize the value of a therapeutic product.

services.name: Health Technology Assessment Submission (HTA Submission)
services.description: Analyze the medical, social, ethical, humanistic, and economic considerations of a drug, medical device, or clinical procedures. Submissions are sent to regulatory agencies with different requirements that govern submissions. See also AMCP and Value Dossier.

services.name: Life Cycle Management
services.description: Plan and strategy of the data collection and information throughout the different phases of product development (portfolio assessment, pre-clinical trials, clinical trials, pre-authorization, post-authorization, and RWE)

services.name: Market Access
services.description: Find general strategies and methods used to market a pharmaceutical product or device.

services.name: Market Research & Business Intelligence
services.description: Run market feasibility studies, establish customer needs, improve product performance and analyze competition.

services.name: Observational Research
services.description: Research method for documenting clinical, economic, and or humanistic outcomes of actual medical practice absent the constraints of a more formal experimental design. See also Pragmatic Clinical Trials.

services.name: Patient Reported Outcomes (PRO)
services.description: Assessment of health outcomes directly reported by the patient who experienced it, without interpretation of the patient's response by a clinician.

services.name: Patient Treatment Patterns
services.description: Assessment of treatment processes and patterns within clinical practice.

services.name: Patient-Reported Outcome Studies
services.description: Get self-reported information regarding the personal health status of an individual.

services.name: Pricing Strategy
services.description: Develop value story tailored to a payer audience that will determine the appropriate price for treatment.

services.name: RWE/HEOR Data Analysis
services.description: Analysis that helps you make sense of your RWE/HEOR data

services.name: RWE/HEOR/Market Access Data Analytics
services.description: Analyze clinical trial data.

services.name: Real World Evidence (RWE) Studies
services.description: Studies (prospective or retrospective) utilizing data obtained from "real world settings" , and is outside the tight controls of a clinical trial design.

services.name: Real-World Evidence
services.description: Acquire clinical data from patients' medical records to analyze trends and the frequency of occurrence of different medical conditions.

services.name: Resource Utilization
services.description: Descriptive and/or analytical review of a treatment that investigate the marketing, distribution, prescription, and use of drugs in populations. Endpoints to be assessed are the medical, social, and economic outcomes.

services.name: Systematic Literature Review
services.description: Summarizes the results of research (that meet pre-defined eligibility criteria for inclusion) and provides a high level of evidence on the outcomes assessed.

services.name: Therapy Switch
services.description: Insight into the reasoning of patients switching treatments and the outcomes of the switch.

services.name: Value Based Agreements or Outcomes-Based Contracts
services.description: Collaborate with payer or provider to develop a reimbursement plan outside of the traditional fixed cost-per-unit that ties reimbursement or price to actual health outcomes.

services.name: Value Dossiers Development
services.description: Summary document that presents clinical, economic, and humanistic value of an intervention and associated disease state with the supporting evidence, formulated from the perspective of a particular stakeholder (manufacturer, payer, provider, HTA agency, etc.). See also HTA Submission.

title: ImmunXperts
description:
ImmunXperts, established in 2014, is a small business headquartered in Gosselies, Belgium. As a small business with an annual revenue stream between 1 and 10 million dollars, ImmunXperts specializes in a variety of services that support immunology research, particularly in immuno-oncology and immunogenicity.

This company's extensive list of services includes Annexin V Apoptosis Assay, Cytokine Release Assay, Epitope Mapping, and Programmed Cell Death-1 (PD-1) Assays among others. They also provide consulting for Cell Based Assays and offer Cytometric Bead Array (CBA) FACS Analysis, a technique that is particularly valuable in immunology research. 

The team at ImmunXperts is comprised of seasoned immunology experts, who collaborate with scientific advisors and international partners. This company prides itself on its partnership model, which enables them to tap into a wide network of subcontractors and academic collaborators, hence offering a broad spectrum of technologies and services. 

Certified by the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), ImmunXperts ensures safety and health standards are strictly adhered to in their operations. They are recognized for their great flexibility in dealing with clients' specific demands and changing priorities. Their creative mindset, strong interactive relationship with customers, and extensive experience in the field contribute to the company's reputation as a reliable partner in the industry.

services.description: Acquire fresh/frozen human primary cells based on patient demographics, disease stage, history and treatment. Cell Lines typically refer to legacy immortalised cells, that can be cultured and passaged “indefinitely” Primary Cells are cells that have been isolated from fresh tissue (or cultures) that have not be immortalised and after a certain amount of passaging they will reach senescence. iPSCs, induced pluripotent stem cells, are cells that have (through GM or culturing conditions) have been revert back to the pluripotency state. The original cells can be a cell line or a primary cell.
