title: Innoser Laboratories
description:
Innoser Laboratories, established in 2012, is a small business enterprise based in Diepenbeek, Belgium. With an annual revenue ranging from 1 to 10 million dollars, it has become a key player in the sector. This organization has various sites, including locations in Zernikedreef 9 Leiden, Netherlands, and two in BioVille Agoralaan Abis Diepenbeek, Belgium.

Innoser Laboratories offers a broad spectrum of services. These include 3D Cell Culture, Animal Model Development, Bioimaging, Caspase Assay, Cell and Tissue Histology, Cognition Models, Custom PDX models, Digital Pathology, Flow Cytometry, Hematoxylin & Eosin Staining, Immuno-oncology Assays, Microscopy, Nervous System PDX, Pharmacokinetic Screening, Stem Cell Methodologies, Toxicity Test for Veterinary Drugs, and many more. 

This diversified range of services is backed by several certifications, including the Assessment and Accreditation of Laboratory Animal Care (AAALAC), International Organization for Standards 9001 (ISO 9001), and International Organization for Standards 9001:2015 (ISO 9001:2015). 

Innoser Laboratories specialises in providing custom preclinical services, primarily supporting the development of compounds. Their areas of expertise include nephrology, immuno-oncology, neurology, and cardiometabolic disease. With a number of validated models within these therapeutic fields, Innoser Laboratories continues to be a leader in its industry.

title: Kaneka Eurogentec S.A.
description:
Established in 1985, Kaneka Eurogentec S.A. is a mid-sized business generating between 10 to 100 million in TTM revenue. The company is headquartered in Seraing, Belgium, and has additional sites at Liège Science Park in Région Wallonne, Belgium, specifically on Rue du Bois Saint Jean 5, Seraing, 4102.

Kaneka Eurogentec S.A. offers a diverse array of services, including but not limited to Chemistry, Manufacturing and Controls (CMC), Electrophoresis, Immunoaffinity Chromatography, and Liquid Chromatography. Other areas of specialty include Oligo Synthesis, Peptide Synthesis, Quantitative RT PCR, RNA Interference, RNA oligo synthesis, mRNA synthesis, miRNA sequencing, and siRNA Synthesis.

The company is primarily recognized for their custom-made antibodies, qPCR kits, and oligonucleotides. However, their expertise extends beyond these areas to include Business Units that focus on Diagnostics and GMP Biomanufacturing.

Kaneka Eurogentec S.A. holds several distinguished certifications, such as the International Organization for Standards 13485 (ISO 13485), International Organization for Standards 9001 (ISO 9001), and International Organization for Standards 9001:2015 (ISO 9001:2015). These certifications underscore the company's commitment to maintaining high-quality standards and procedures in all aspects of its operations.

description:
Established in 1979, Laborimpex has developed an unparalleled wealth of knowledge and a loyal customer base through its personalized approach to customer service. The company, based in Bruxelles, Belgium, operates as a small business with a revenue range of 1-10 million TTM. 

Laborimpex prides itself on its precision, reliability, and high-technology offerings, which form the foundation of its operations. These elements are always tailored to meet customer needs, making the company a trusted partner for many. 

With a multidisciplinary approach, Laborimpex offers an extensive range of products for various sectors. These include laboratories, education, as well as medical and industrial laboratories. As a provider of high-quality equipment, Laborimpex's role extends beyond being a mere supplier. It also serves as a technical advisor and provides after-sales services to its customers.

Laborimpex's team of product specialists is always ready to assist with any specific questions or needs. They work diligently to ensure customers feel like part of the Laborimpex family, hence contributing to the company's continued success. The company operates from its site located at 242 Rue des Alliés Bruxelles, 1190 Belgium. 

Laborimpex's commitment to customer satisfaction and excellence in service delivery has seen it become a reputable name in the industry. It continues to excel and innovate while maintaining its unique business model.

sites.name: Laborimpex
sites.address: 242 Rue des Alliés Bruxelles, Bruxelles, 1190 Belgium

title: LAVETAN N.V.
description:
LAVETAN N.V., a small-sized enterprise with a revenue range of 1-10M TTM, operates as an industry-specific laboratory catering to the diverse and critical sectors of food, industrial animal production, and pharmaceuticals. With its strategic location at 56 Veedijk Turnhout, Vlaanderen, 2300 Belgium, the company is deeply rooted in its commitment to quality and customer-oriented service, reflecting in its operations and offerings.

Though the year of establishment remains unspecified, LAVETAN N.V. has managed to carve a distinct niche for itself in the industry. The company holds its headquarters in the vibrant city of Turnhout, Vlaanderen, BE, positioning it at the heart of innovation and growth.

LAVETAN N.V. is driven by its dedication to sector-specific solutions, focusing its resources on providing expert laboratory services tailored to the needs of the food industry, industrial animal production, and the pharmaceutical industry. The company's emphasis on quality and customer-focused service underpins every facet of its operations, serving as the backbone of its business strategy. This unique approach has set LAVETAN N.V. apart in its respective fields, reinforcing its reputation as a reliable and dedicated service provider. 

In essence, LAVETAN N.V. stands as a testament to the merger of high-quality laboratory services and customer-centric solutions, continually striving to push the boundaries in its target sectors. As the company moves forward, it remains steadfast in its mission to offer unparalleled services to its valuable clientele.

title: Laboratoria Wolfs
description:
Laboratoria Wolfs is a small-scale business specializing in the manufacture of compact and solid pharmaceutical products. The company, established in 1945, has its headquarters nestled in the heart of Zwijndrecht, Vlaanderen, in Belgium. With several decades of experience, Laboratoria Wolfs has mastered the art of producing quality pharmaceuticals, and their unique compact and solid product line sets them apart in the industry.

Despite its small size, with a total through the year (TTM) revenue ranging between 1 and 10 million, Laboratoria Wolfs has a significant impact on the global pharmaceutical market. The company not only focuses on manufacturing but also actively participates in the export of generic medicines. This has broadened their reach and influence, making their products accessible to a wider international audience.

Laboratoria Wolfs operates from a single yet efficient site located at 50 Westpoort, Zwijndrecht, Vlaanderen, 2070 Belgium. Their operations from this site have allowed them to maintain control over the quality of their products while managing to meet the growing demands of the pharmaceutical market. As a small business, they have been able to foster a strong relationship with their clients, ensuring personalized service and quality products.

In a nutshell, Laboratoria Wolfs, with its long-standing history and commitment to quality, has made a significant contribution to the pharmaceutical industry, and continues to set high standards in the manufacturing and export of compact, solid and generic medicines.

title: Laboratoria Smeets
description:
Laboratoria Smeets is a small business enterprise, established in 1973, specializing in the blending and packaging of pharmaceutical powders. With its headquarters situated in Antwerpen, Vlaanderen, BE, the company has consistently made a mark in the pharmaceutical industry with its revenue ranging between 1-10 million TTM. 

The firm operates at two distinct sites, both located in the heart of Belgium, at 24 Neerlandweg and 42 Fotografielaan, Antwerpen, Vlaanderen, 2610, respectively. These locations serve as pivotal hubs for the company's specialized operations.

Over the years, Laboratoria Smeets has carved out a niche for itself, focusing on the processing and packaging of pharmaceutical powders. Its uniqueness lies in its specialization, offering services that are not commonly found in the industry. This exclusivity has enabled the company to contribute significantly to the pharmaceutical sector, with a specific emphasis on powder blending and packaging.

The company's long-standing presence of almost five decades underscores its commitment to quality and innovation in the pharmaceutical industry. With its specialized services and strategic locations, Laboratoria Smeets continues to be a valuable player in the pharmaceutical industry, contributing to the health and well-being of countless individuals.

title: Lareco SA
description:
Lareco SA, a budding startup, is prominently located at 5 Rue André Feher, Marche-en-Famenne, Wallonie, 6900 Belgium. Although freshly established, it has already begun making its mark as part of a distinguished group of research laboratories offering multidisciplinary consultation. 

Lareco SA's core business revolves around providing consultation services and conducting industry analyses across multiple sectors. These sectors include the agri-food industry, water, soil, compost, waste, and air. 

What sets Lareco SA apart is its excellent reactivity and adaptability. The firm excels in accurate analysis and interpretation of results, which are meticulously compared with current standards. These qualities not only augment the firm's reputation but also provide a competitive edge in the industry. 

As a new entrant in the market with less than a million TTM Revenue, Lareco SA demonstrates immense potential for growth and innovation. It is steadily making strides in the realm of research and consultation, underlining its commitment to contribute to various industries' progress and sustainability. The company, while being relatively young, showcases the drive and ambition necessary to make a significant impact in its field of expertise.

title: Laboratorium ECCA NV
description:
Laboratorium ECCA NV, a nascent startup, launched its operations in the scenic locale of Merelbeke, Vlaams Gewest, BE, without a specified establishment year. This innovative venture was the brainchild of Dr. Frank Benijts and holds the distinction of being among the pioneer private and independent labs in Flanders. 

In the initial phase, Dr. Benijts utilized his academic exposure in the United States to create a unique business model. This model was premised on a blend of ecotoxicological and chemical analyses that was quite unheard of in the European market. However, as the company matured and adapted to the specific needs of the European market, it started widening its scope of services. 

Expanding its portfolio, Laboratorium ECCA NV ventured into food analyses, thereby catering to a broader segment of the market. This strategic move not only enriched its service offerings but also fortified its position in a competitive industry. 

Operating from its primary site located at 3 Ambachtsweg Merelbeke, Vlaams Gewest, 9820 Belgium, Laboratorium ECCA NV continues to push the boundaries of scientific research and analysis, carving a unique niche in the process. Despite its lack of certifications, the company remains committed to delivering top-notch services that are a testament to its innovative approach and dedication to excellence.

title: Lubrizol
description:
Lubrizol is a renowned large-scale enterprise known for its significant revenue generation exceeding 100 million on a trailing twelve-month basis. With its impressive financial performance, it stands as a powerhouse in its industry. Although the exact year of establishment and location of its headquarters are not stated, the company's undeniable success speaks volumes about its longevity and strategic operations. 

Lubrizol's operations span multiple sites, each contributing to the company's overall success and growth. These sites are strategically located to tap into various markets and opportunities, further solidifying Lubrizol's industry position. The company's service offerings are vast and diverse, catering to a wide array of customer needs and preferences, thereby creating a competitive edge in the market.

Lubrizol's commitment to quality and excellence is further evidenced by its extensive list of certifications. These accolades serve as a testament to the company's adherence to industry standards and best practices. Each certification is a badge of honor, showcasing Lubrizol's dedication to its craft and its unwavering commitment to delivering top-notch service and products to its customers.

In conclusion, Lubrizol is a well-established and financially robust enterprise with a vast network of sites and a diverse range of services. Its numerous certifications underscore its commitment to quality and excellence. Through strategic operations and a strong dedication to its craft, Lubrizol continues to excel in its industry.

title: LabOmics
description:
Established in 2008, LabOmics is a small business nestled in the heart of Nivelles, Wallonie, Belgium. Despite its size, with a turnover in the range of 1-10 million TTM revenue, this company has made a significant impact in the scientific community. 

LabOmics is situated at 4 Rue du Progrès, a location that serves as a testament to its commitment to progress in the field of genomics. This company is not just a business, but a pioneer, offering a range of innovative kits, reagents, and solutions tailored to meet the needs of modern scientific inquiry.

Specializing in unique niches of scientific research, LabOmics caters to the needs of functional genomics, cell signaling, transcription regulation, epigenetics, and gene expression. Each service offering is designed with precision, aiming to elevate the field of study and contribute to the advancement of scientific knowledge.

LabOmics embodies the spirit of scientific inquiry, coupling it with a drive for business excellence. Its vision and mission are reflected in its high-quality products and services, designed to foster innovation and promote progress in the scientific community. Every product and service is a testament to LabOmics' commitment to fueling scientific exploration, understanding, and discovery. From its headquarters in Belgium, LabOmics extends its reach globally, contributing to the advancement of science and technology across borders.

title: LenioBio GmbH
description:
Established in 2016, LenioBio GmbH is a small yet robust biotech company based in Düsseldorf, NRW, DE, dedicated to the life science sector. The company has a unique standing in the market due to its disruptive protein expression technology named ALiCE®. This technology is a game-changer, transforming the way proteins are produced across various industries.

LenioBio GmbH's ALiCE® technology is a eukaryotic cell-free protein expression platform that can be scaled to meet different needs, making it especially effective for the discovery, development, and production of difficult-to-express proteins. If you are a professional involved in protein expression and need to produce proteins that are challenging to express or want to enhance yields, efficiency, or scalability, ALiCE® technology is your ideal solution.

The company offers its sophisticated technology in kits and also as a comprehensive Protein Service. It also provides an in-depth feasibility expression study for cytosolic or microsomal/membrane proteins, ensuring clients receive quick and well-founded information about whether the expression of their proteins of interest is viable.

LenioBio GmbH operates from several global locations, including the Technology & Innovation Center at Forckenbeckstrasse 6 in Aachen, Germany, 1035 Cambridge Street in Cambridge, MA, United States, and 401 Erkrather Straße in Düsseldorf, Germany.

Equipped with a wide array of services such as Antibody-Drug Conjugation, Bi-specific Antibodies, Custom Antibodies, Fusion Proteins, Protein Expression in Plant Cells, and many more, LenioBio GmbH is committed to advancing the field of protein production and expression.

title: Lonza
description:
Lonza, a mid-sized business established in 1897, is a global entity with its headquarters situated in Basel-Stadt, CH. With an impressive international presence, it has numerous sites in countries such as Belgium, United Kingdom, Singapore, Brazil, United States, China, India, Japan, Switzerland, France, Germany, Netherlands, Czech Republic, Denmark, and others. 

Lonza is recognized for its advanced cell biology and engineering solutions that are crucial in supporting customers throughout their journey, from discovery to clinic. Their services encompass an extensive range, including 3D Cell Culture, Antibody Conjugation, Biobanking, Cell Line Construction, Cytotoxicity, DNA Mutagenesis, Endotoxin Testing, Genome Editing, High Throughput Screening, Immunotoxicity, Metabolic Stability in Hepatocytes, Peptide Synthesis, Quality Control, Stem Cell Analysis, and USP Testing among others.

The products and services offered by Lonza are further enhanced with their specialized media, advanced cell culture, and transfection tools. They are committed to aiding customers from the foundational stages of basic research through to the preclinical and process development stages of small molecules, biologics, and cell and gene therapy programs in drug discovery and immuno-oncology. This includes unique offerings such as immunogenicity prediction and assessment, manufacturability risk assessment, and protein re-engineering. 

Backed by their best-in-class quality, regulatory, and scientific support, Lonza stands as a strong pillar in the field of advanced cell biology and cell engineering solutions.

title: MedInvents
description:
MedInvents is a small-scale enterprise, generating revenues between $1-10 million, that specializes in the manufacturing of medical devices. Despite not having a specific year of establishment, the company has built a strong presence in the medical industry from its headquarters in Hasselt, Belgium. 

The company's primary focus lies in the creation of medical devices designed for optimal tissue acquisition. These tools play a significant role in several medical fields, including molecular biology, personalized and precision medicine, regeneration medicine, and fertility. By integrating innovative techniques and advanced technology, MedInvents contributes significantly to the evolution of these medical domains.

Apart from manufacturing, MedInvents also offers its expertise to other companies and distributors within the medical device industry. These services contribute to the broader industry's growth, fostering a collaborative environment to further medical advancements. 

Operating from its site at Hilststraat 5, Hasselt, 3500 Belgium, MedInvents continues to innovate and contribute to the medical field. It stands as a testament to the potential of small businesses in making substantial contributions to critical sectors such as healthcare.

title: MolMo Services
description:
Established in 2005, MolMo Services is a small-scale business based in Antwerpen, Vlaams Gewest, Belgium, with an estimated Time to Maturity (TTM) revenue between 1 and 10 million. With additional sites located at Pastorijstraat Antwerpen and Retie, Flanders, the company has a significant presence in the region.

MolMo Services provides a broad range of specialized services that cater to different aspects of the industry. The company excels in offering targeted library design, a service that involves the systematic organization, storage, and retrieval of chemical compounds for research purposes. High throughput screening is another key service provided by MolMo Services, which aids in the rapid identification of active compounds, antibodies, or genes that modulate a particular biomolecular pathway.

In addition, MolMo Services' expertise extends to in silico screening and docking. These services employ computer simulations to predict the behavior of molecules and their interactions, thereby reducing the need for physical testing and accelerating drug discovery processes.

The company also offers structure-based screening, an advanced technique that helps in the identification and design of new drugs by considering the molecular structure of the target. Moreover, MolMo Services provides Active Pharmaceutical Ingredient (API) services, ensuring the production and distribution of high-quality, effective ingredients for pharmaceutical manufacturers.

In conclusion, MolMo Services is a compact yet dynamic organization that specializes in providing a comprehensive suite of services, making it a reliable partner for businesses in the field of pharmaceuticals and drug discovery.

title: Micro Smedt
description:
Micro Smedt, a newly established startup based in Herentals, Flanders, Belgium, specializes in the field of microbiology. This company brings with it several decades of experience, making it a reliable entity despite its recent inception. Micro Smedt excels in a variety of areas, including method development, such as MSRV, and method validation, which is apparent from the numerous publications in international journals.

One of the unique features of Micro Smedt is its commitment to training in food safety. The company has made significant contributions in this area through lectures at international conferences and training sessions for trade unions. Micro Smedt's philosophy revolves around quick support on issues, providing qualified estimates and solutions, and ensuring targeted and timely completion of analysis.

The company's decision-making process stands out for its statistical responsibility, ensuring that every decision is backed by solid data and careful analysis. Furthermore, Micro Smedt prides itself on its ISO 17025 accreditation, a testament to its commitment to delivering quality services.

In addition to its services, the company maintains an extensive literature library, further showcasing its dedication to knowledge and expertise in the field of microbiology. Despite being a startup, Micro Smedt's commitment to quality, its vast experience, and its dedication to knowledge and training set it apart in the industry.

title: Merge Healthcare

Merge Healthcare, a small business with a revenue range of 1-10M TTM, is a specialized organization based in Chicago, Illinois. The company is distinguished by its focus on clinical systems and its provision of advanced cloud-based solutions for imaging and data analytics. 

Its expansive business reach extends across multiple geographical locations in the United States, including additional offices in Hartland, Wisconsin; Morrisville, North Carolina; Daytona Beach, Florida; Irvine, California; Mentor, Ohio; Seattle, Washington; and Austin, Texas. International presence of the company can be witnessed in Eindhoven, Netherlands; Mississauga, Ontario, Canada; Enghien, Wallonia, Belgium; Nancy, Alsace-Champagne-Ardenne-Lorraine, France; and Shanghai, China. 

Merge Healthcare's broad range of services and solutions are designed to meet the diverse needs of its clients. It leverages state-of-the-art technology to deliver high-quality, reliable, and efficient services, which are a testament to its commitment to excellence in the healthcare sector. Despite the absence of available information on its year of establishment, Merge Healthcare has proven to be a key player in its field, serving various clients with its innovative, cloud-based offerings and contributing significantly to the evolution of healthcare technology.

title: Maybridge
description:
Maybridge, established in 1962, is a small-scale business nestled in the heart of Antwerpen, Vlaams Gewest, Belgium. Despite its modest size, the company generates an impressive turnover between 1 and 10 million on a trailing twelve-month basis. 

As a crucial player in the biochemical industry, Maybridge specializes in the provision of building blocks, medicinal chemistry, and screening collections. Their expertise lies in their ability to deliver high-quality products and services that cater to the diversified needs of their clientele. 

The company has carved a niche for itself as a reliable provider, taking pride in the vast array of building blocks it offers to its customers. These building blocks are essential components in various chemical reactions and are highly sought after in the industry. 

In addition, Maybridge excels in the field of medicinal chemistry. Their seasoned team conducts extensive research and development to create breakthrough solutions that contribute to advancements in medical science. 

The screening collections offered by Maybridge serve as a valuable resource for researchers and scientists worldwide. These collections are methodically curated, ensuring a wide range of compounds for high-throughput screening and drug discovery projects.

Maybridge has a single site located in Antwerpen, Vlaams Gewest, Belgium, which functions as their headquarters and primary operational base. Despite its single location, the company's impact resonates across the biochemical industry, demonstrating the power of quality over quantity. 

In summary, Maybridge's commitment to providing exceptional services and products remains unmatched, making it a trusted name in the biochemical industry since its inception.

title: Masthercell
description:
Masthercell is a small-scale business specializing in contract manufacturing for cell therapy products. The company, though it doesn't specify its year of establishment, has made significant strides in the biotechnology industry. With its headquarters located in Hainaut, in the Walloon Region of Belgium, it has continually demonstrated its commitment to providing top-notch services in the biotech sector. 

Masthercell operates from its single site at Rue Adrienne Boland 8 Hainaut, Walloon Region, 6041 Belgium. Despite its small size, with a revenue range between 1 to 10 million TTM, the company has managed to carve a niche for itself in the production of cell therapy products. 

The company's unique focus on contract manufacturing for cell therapy products distinguishes it from other players in the industry. Masthercell prides itself on its capability to deliver quality and reliable services in this specialized sector of biotechnology. 

In conclusion, Masthercell is a dedicated and specialized small business located in Belgium, making significant contributions to the biotech industry through its contract manufacturing services for cell therapy products.

title: Medanex Clinic
description:
Medanex Clinic is a Contract Research Organization (CRO) centered around providing preclinical and clinical in vivo research solutions utilizing large animals such as rabbits, sheep, goats, mini pigs, llamas, and horses. The company operates out of its headquarters in Diest, Vlaanderen, Belgium, and falls under the small business category with a trailing twelve-month revenue between 1 to 10 million.

The company's main operations revolve around conducting preclinical surgical studies and offering surgery training for medical device manufacturers, pharmaceutical companies, and biotech firms. In addition to these services, Medanex Clinic also extends its technical expertise on a consultancy basis.

The company boasts state-of-the-art in-house facilities, including fully equipped operating theaters, intensive care units, anesthetic equipment, as well as fluoroscopy, ultrasonography, and X-ray machines. Medanex Clinic also collaborates with experienced partners for MRI, CT, and histopathology services.

The animal facilities at Medanex Clinic are meticulously designed to prioritize animal welfare, making them suitable for accommodating larger groups of animals during non-surgical studies or for long-term follow-up procedures.

The dedicated team at Medanex Clinic consists of veterinarians and animal caretakers with specializations in lab animal science and medical R&D. This team is further strengthened by a network of external experts across all relevant fields of preclinical animal testing.

title: Mar Cor Purification
description:
Mar Cor Purification, a small-scale yet thriving business, is renowned for its development and manufacturing of water purification and filtration systems. Although the year of its establishment is not defined, the company has made a significant impact in the industry. With its headquarters nestled in Drexel Hill, PA, the company's influence extends well beyond the boundaries of the US, with a global presence in various strategic locations. 

The company boasts a wide network of sites, spreading its reach and services across the globe. These sites include the bustling International Business Park in Sunderland, Singapore, the tranquil Sourethweg 11 in Heerlen, Limburg in the Netherlands, and the industrious Harvester Road in West Chicago, IL. Within the US, Mar Cor Purification also marks its presence in Glyndon, MN, and Skippack, PA, and maintains its stronghold at Township Line Rd in Drexel Hill, PA.

Mar Cor Purification, despite being a small business that generates between 1 to 10 million TTM revenue, has managed to carve out a unique niche in the purification and filtration systems market. The company's commitment to providing clean, purified water is reflected in the innovative systems it designs and manufactures. Through its various locations and consistent services, Mar Cor Purification continues to make a mark, improving water quality worldwide.

title: Maia Scientific
description:
Maia Scientific, a small business enterprise based in Antwerpen, Vlaams Gewest, Belgium, is known for its specialization in creating state-of-the-art instrumentation and software for high information content screening. With a revenue stream in the range of 1 to 10 million TTM, this company has made significant strides in its unique field. 

The company, though it has not disclosed its year of establishment, has managed to position itself prominently in the market, both in its headquarters in Belgium and its additional site at 84 October Hill Rd Holliston, MA, 01746 in the United States. 

Maia Scientific's key services revolve around delivering advanced tools for high information content screening, a critical element in data-intensive sectors. But what truly sets the company apart is its provision of expertise in high throughput assay development. This service allows businesses to streamline their processes and increase efficiency, making Maia Scientific a valuable partner for companies requiring high-level data screening and analysis.

The company's commitment to innovation, combined with its unique service offerings, makes it a robust contender in the realm of high information content screening and assay development. Maia Scientific continues to grow, leveraging its unique services and strategic locations to provide unrivaled solutions in its field.

title: MSOURCE
description:
Established in 1994, MSOURCE is a small-scale business headquartered in Kraainem, Flanders, Belgium, with an annual turnover ranging from 1 to 10 million TTM Revenue. The company has carved a niche in the domain of clinical research services, holding an esteemed position in the industry for over two decades.

MSOURCE is known for offering a wide array of services that encompass various aspects of clinical research. These services range from the execution of clinical trials, starting from phase I to the more advanced phase IV. Moreover, they extend their expertise in project management and clinical monitoring, ensuring the smooth running of all research projects. 

In addition to this, MSOURCE also specializes in data management, handling vast amounts of research data with precision and care. Their proficient team is well-versed in regulatory affairs, ensuring all projects align with the respective guidelines and norms of the industry. Quality Assurance is another area where MSOURCE shines, as they consistently deliver top-notch services while adhering to the highest standards of quality.

Despite being classified as a small business, MSOURCE's influence and impact in the clinical research industry are significant, demonstrating their commitment to excellence and dedication to their work. The company's single-site operation in Kraainem, Flanders, Belgium has proven to be a powerhouse of innovative clinical research services.

title: Multiplicom
description:
Multiplicom is a renowned molecular diagnostic organization that is situated in the heart of Antwerpen, Vlaams Gewest, Belgium. Although the year it was established is not known, it has, over time, garnered a reputation as a small-scale business generating a revenue of around 1 to 10 million dollars TTM. 

The company's primary location is at Galileilaan 18, Antwerpen, Vlaams Gewest, 2845 Belgium. It operates as an industry leader specializing in the intricate field of molecular genetics. Its proficiency lies in creating cutting-edge molecular genetic tests that are not only innovative but also crucial in today's healthcare landscape.

Multiplicom's primary services revolve around the design, development, production, and commercialization of these unique molecular genetic tests. These tests are primarily based on an advanced technology known as massively parallel sequencing. 

This technology enables Multiplicom to sequence DNA and RNA much more quickly and cheaply than the previously used Sanger sequencing, and as such, it is revolutionizing the field of genomics. By leveraging massively parallel sequencing, Multiplicom is at the forefront of genetic testing, bringing superior quality, precision, and reliability to its customers and the medical community at large. 

In summary, Multiplicom stands as a beacon of innovation and quality in the molecular diagnostic industry, continually pushing the boundaries of what's possible in genetic testing.

title: Mosselman s.a.
description:
Established in 1829, Mosselman s.a. is a family-owned small business headquartered in Ghlin, Belgium. It has carved a niche for itself as a respected producer and trader of oleochemical ingredients. With a diverse product portfolio, Mosselman s.a. offers an extensive range of vegetable or animal oils and fats, along with derived products such as fatty acids, fatty acid esters, fatty alcohols, ethoxylates, and waxes.

Mosselman s.a. leverages its wide range of functional categories, including lubricants, rheology modifiers, tensides, emulsifiers, solvents, carriers, emollients, and bodying agents to achieve versatile applications. As a result, it caters to a broad spectrum of manufacturing sectors. Its clientele spans across industries like lubricants, detergency, cosmetics, pharmaceuticals, inks and coatings, food and feed, candles, and water treatment.

In addition to its product offerings, Mosselman s.a. provides toll manufacturing facilities. These services include esterification, flaking, pastillation, blending, drumming, molecular distillation, and lab and pilot productions. The company prides itself on its flexibility in product range, packaging, and logistics, a feature highly valued by its customers.

With two sites located in Wallonie, Belgium, Mosselman s.a. has made a global footprint. It sells approximately 600 products in over 50 countries, amounting to a total volume of about 25,000 tonnes per year, and generates a 1-10M TTM Revenue. With a history stretching back nearly two centuries, Mosselman s.a. continues its tradition of excellence in the oleochemical industry.

title: MUbio Products
description:
MUbio Products, originally founded in 2000, is a small business located in Maastricht, Limburg, NL. Despite its size, with a turnover between 1-10 million TTM revenue, it has made a significant impact in the field of cell biology and biomedical research. 

The company focuses on the development and manufacturing of high-quality antibody reagents. These reagents play a crucial role in scientific research, aiding in the study and understanding of diseases at the cellular level. MUbio Products has a sterling reputation for the quality of its antibodies, which are designed to aid researchers in their quest to understand, diagnose, and treat a wide range of medical conditions.

MUbio Products operates out of its headquarters at Oxfordlaan 70 Maastricht, Limburg, HP17 8PL Netherlands. Despite being a small business in terms of revenue, its influence and reach within the scientific research community are both broad and significant. MUbio Products stands as a testament to the fact that size does not equate to impact, particularly in the field of biomedical research. 

In conclusion, MUbio Products may be a small business, but it is a significant player in the cell biology and biomedical research sectors, thanks to its high-quality antibody reagents. Its continued commitment to quality and innovation has ensured its status as a respected and valued contributor to the scientific community.

title: Medpace
description:
Established in 1992, Medpace is a prominent large-scale business headquartered in Cincinnati, Ohio. With an impressive annual revenue exceeding 100 million, the company has solidified its position as an industry leader in the business arena.

Medpace has a substantial global footprint with sites spanning across the United States and throughout the world. Notable locations include Circle Pines, Minnesota; Johannesburg, South Africa; Notting Hill, Australia; Maharashtra, India; Hong Kong; Basel, Switzerland; São Paulo, Brazil; Mexico City, Mexico; and London, United Kingdom among others.

The company is internationally certified by both the International Council for Harmonisation of Technical Requirements for Pharmaceuticals for Human Use (ICH) and the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD), demonstrating its commitment to quality and compliance.

Medpace provides a wide range of comprehensive services in the field of clinical development. These include, but are not limited to, medical writing, biometrics, regulatory affairs, and quality assurance. In addition to these services, Medpace also offers specialized services such as Central Lab Services, Bio-Analytical and Biomarker Testing, BioSample Storage and Management, Long-term BioRepository, Core Lab Services, Imaging, and Phase I Safety Clinic operations. 

In essence, Medpace is a Full Service Contract Research Organization (CRO) that prides itself on delivering high-quality and reliable services in the clinical development sector.

title: Moore Grants & Incentives
description:
Established in 1969, Moore Grants & Incentives is a prominent consulting firm based in Ghent, Belgium, with a team of over five employees. As part of Moore Belgium, the company forms an integral part of a larger financial and consulting network, boasting over 1,200 employees. 

Moore Belgium provides a wide array of complementary services, including Accountancy & Advisory, Audit, Corporate Finance, Tax & Legal Services, Law, Business Consultancy, Interim Management, and Business Analytics. Furthermore, it is part of the Moore Global Network, a collective of more than 260 independent companies committed to delivering exceptional results to ensure their clients' success.

The team at Moore Grants & Incentives is comprised of 25 highly skilled experts, including those with PhDs, who excel in maneuvering through the intricate funding landscape. The company offers a comprehensive range of support services related to grant funding. These services encompass the identification of suitable funding programmes, coordination of the application process, provision of technical expertise to enrich project applications, and the crafting of high-quality proposals for submission.

Additionally, Moore Grants & Incentives assists in the management activities of awarded projects and ensures grant compliance for reporting, controls, and audits. With its headquarters at Verenigde-Natieslaan 1 Ghent, 9000 Belgium, Moore Grants & Incentives continues to drive success for its clients with its unparalleled expertise and professional services.

title: Macrogen Europe B.V.
description:
Macrogen Europe B.V. is recognized as a premier sequencing provider in the industry. The company specializes in providing both DNA and RNA sequencing for a diverse range of samples. This is achieved through the innovative technology they've harnessed from strategic partnerships with top industry players like Illumina, PacBio, and Oxford Nanopore Technologies, among others.

What truly sets Macrogen Europe B.V. apart is not just the high-quality data they consistently deliver, but also their commitment to providing exceptional customer service. The company fosters an approach that is customer-centric, assisting clients right from the initial stages of sending samples, through the process of personally monitoring each project, and right up to the delivery of data.

This meticulous attention to detail and unwavering focus on customer satisfaction makes Macrogen Europe B.V. a reliable choice for any sequencing needs. Despite the absence of stated year of establishment, headquarters, company type, or specified sites and certifications, Macrogen Europe B.V.'s reputation precedes it, built on the foundation of high-quality services and dedicated customer care. Their unique quality lies in their ability to seamlessly blend technological prowess with a customer-first approach, making them an industry leader in sequencing provision.

title: Medicover Integrated Clinical Services
description:
Established in 1992, Medicover Integrated Clinical Services (MICS) is a mid-sized business based in Waterloo, Belgium, operating within the 10-100M TTM Revenue bracket. The company provides a diverse range of services including Amino Acid Analysis (AAA), Antibody Detection, Biomarker Discovery, Cell Culture, Clinical Pathology, and Lipid Profiling, among many others. MICS is certified with Good Clinical Laboratory Practice (GCLP), reflecting its commitment to quality and adherence to industry standards.

MICS's offices can be found in the Dreve Richelle 161 - Bldg. M 1410 complex in Waterloo, Belgium. The company is renowned for its specialized offerings, such as Autoantibody Testing, Complete Metabolic Panel Testing, and DNA Hydroxy Methylation Seq. Other services include Discovery Statistical and Mathematical Modeling, Immunostaining, and Lipoprotein Associated Phospholipase A2 Testing. 

In addition to these, MICS also conducts Metabolite Identification and Profiling, Paraffin-based Histology, Protein Purification, and Single Cell Transcriptome Sequencing, among a myriad of other specialized services. The company's service portfolio is extensive, showcasing its proficiency in various fields and its capacity to handle a broad spectrum of requirements.

MICS is a part of a larger, international network of healthcare and diagnostic services. It operates two main divisions: Healthcare Services and Diagnostic Services. The Healthcare Services division offers high-quality care through an Integrated Healthcare Model, providing specialty-care services focusing on health and well-being. The Diagnostic Services division offers a wide range of laboratory tests in all major clinical pathology areas, from routine to advanced tests and from prevention to monitoring treatments. 

MICS's services are categorized along discrete lines of activity, including Central Lab Services, Biospecimen Management, Recruitment, Management & Data, and Precision Medicine. The company employs a dedicated team of highly specialized staff, including clinical and diagnostics specialists, contract research veterans, account managers, project managers, logistics experts, analysts, and more.

title: Maastricht University
description:
Maastricht University is an Academic Core Facility, centrally located in Maastricht, Limburg, Netherlands. While the University doesn't have a specified year of establishment, it has a rich history of contributing to the academic and scientific community. Their primary location is at Minderbroedersberg 4, in the heart of Maastricht, Limburg, Netherlands.

The university offers a diverse range of services, positioning itself as a leading institution in research and development. These services include Antibody Detection and Purification, the production of Antibody Products, Bacterial and Mammalian Expression, and both Polyclonal and Monoclonal Antibody Production. They also specialize in Biomarker Discovery, which encompasses Diagnostic, Predictive, and Prognostic Biomarkers. 

Their research extends to Cell Based Assays, Cell Membrane Lipidomics, and Fusion Proteins. The university also excels in Immunohistochemistry, Lipid Detection, Protein Binding and Expression, and Protein Purification. They offer Protein Products and apply Size Exclusion Chromatography in their processes. The university's expertise also includes Western Blots and Yeast Expression.

Maastricht University's original research focus spans across a variety of fields. Among these are developmental biology, cardiovascular diseases, oncology, toxicology, metabolism, neuroscience, and nutrition. This broad spectrum of focus areas highlights the university's commitment to diverse and comprehensive research and underscores its position as a leading academic institution in the scientific field.

title: New Brunswick Scientific
description:
Established in 1946, New Brunswick Scientific is a small business with a global footprint, headquartered in Edison, NJ, US. Despite its modest size, generating a turnover of between 1-10 million USD, the company has managed to establish a vast network of sites across the globe. Its locations span from the heart of the United States in Edison, NJ, and Wood, OH, to the cultural hubs of Europe in Vlaams Gewest, Belgium and Mittelfranken, Bayern, Germany. The company's reach also extends to Asia, with a presence in Tamil Nadu, India, and even South America, with a site in Neiva, Huila, Colombia.

New Brunswick Scientific's key services revolve around the optimization of processes, providing cell expertise, devising computer-controlled strategies, and formulating media. These core competencies are delivered and maintained by an expert team, spread across their various international sites. 

With over seven decades of rich history, New Brunswick Scientific has not only evolved with the changing dynamics of the industry but also contributed significantly to its progression. The company's commitment to providing quality services and maintaining a global presence has established it as a notable player in the field. Despite its classification as a small business, New Brunswick Scientific has shown how far-reaching impacts can come from even the most modest of operations.

title: Novitan
description:
Novitan is a mid-sized specialty pharmaceutical and services company, with a significant role in clinical trials and unmet medical needs programs. In the realm of clinical trials, Novitan's expertise lies in sourcing comparators, and handling the storage, packaging, and distribution of Investigational Medical Products (IMPs). Additionally, it offers a variety of value-added services including, but not limited to, the provision of rescue medication, ancillary supplies, direct to site delivery, and products for analytical testing or the preclinical phase.

Furthermore, Novitan plays a crucial role in unmet medical needs programs. The company provides physicians with access to medicines that are not available in their respective countries. This could refer to early access to experimental medications or commercial medicines that have not been marketed in those specific regions. The foundation of this aspect of the business hinges on the principle of 'patient first'. This service is often referred to by terms such as 'name patient', 'expanded access', 'early access', or 'compassionate use'.

Despite the lack of specified year of establishment or headquarters, Novitan operates in the mid-sized business category, with a total trailing twelve months (TTM) revenue falling within the 10-100M range.

services.name: Comparator Drug Sourcing
services.description: Streamline new drug development and clinical trials by comparing the efficacy of an experimental drug to a comparator drug.

title: Nexus Oncology
description:
Established in 1999, Nexus Oncology is a small business enterprise specializing in the field of oncology. With its headquarters based in Great Britain, the company has a global presence, extending its services across multiple locations including the United States, Canada, Spain, Hungary, Sweden, Germany, Belgium, Poland, France, and the United Kingdom. 

Nexus Oncology generates annual revenue between $1M and $10M, highlighting its stable economic footprint in the competitive business landscape. The company's expertise lies in providing a range of essential services including meticulous data management, strategic site selection, effective project management, and insightful drug development consultancy. 

These services are specifically designed to support studies in oncology, reinforcing the company's commitment to the relentless pursuit of advancements in cancer treatment and care. Nexus Oncology leverages its global reach and industry knowledge to deliver tailored solutions for their clients, aiming to contribute significantly to cancer research and therapy. 

In essence, Nexus Oncology stands as a bridge, seamlessly connecting various elements of oncology studies, and playing a vital role in driving forward the global fight against cancer. With nearly two decades of experience, it continues to provide reliable and innovative solutions to its clients, thus cementing its position as a trusted name in the field of oncology.

title: NOF Corporation
description:
NOF Corporation, a small-scale enterprise generating between 1 to 10 million TTM revenue, is a specialist in the field of chemical compounds. The company has a global presence, with offices located in Antwerp, Belgium; Irvine, California; and White Plains, New York. 

Despite its small size, NOF Corporation has carved out a unique niche for itself in the business world. It provides a range of services, including the production of PEGylated compounds. PEGylation is a process that involves the modification of a therapeutic protein or drug to improve its efficacy. This technique is highly specialized and requires a high level of expertise, making NOF Corporation a go-to resource for this service.

In addition to PEGylation, NOF Corporation offers custom synthesis services. This involves creating unique compounds based on the specific requirements of a client. With its innovative approach and dedication to custom solutions, NOF Corporation sets itself apart from competitors in the field.

NOF Corporation combines its deep knowledge of chemical compounds with a strong commitment to customer service. This results in a company that is not only a leader in its field but also a preferred partner to businesses in need of specialized chemical services. The company's commitment to its clients and its innovative approach to chemical synthesis underscore its status as a unique player in the business world.

title: Novasep
description:
Novasep, a small business located in Nord, Nord-Pas-de-Calais, FR, has carved out a unique niche for itself. Despite its compact size, it has successfully made an impressive mark in the international market. The company, which annually generates a total through revenue (TTM) of 1-10M, emphasizes on providing top-notch services.

Their expertise is inclusive but not limited to chiral separations, custom synthesis, manufacturing, generics development, and purification scale-up. These services are meticulously crafted to cater to the specific demands of their clients, ensuring that exceptional quality is delivered consistently.

Contrary to its size, Novasep has a substantial global presence with offices spanning across the globe. It operates out of several locations including Boothwyn in the United States, Nord-Pas-de-Calais in France, Melipilla in Chile, Oakland and Worcester in the United States, Ain and Hainaut in France and Belgium respectively. Additionally, Novasep has established its footprint in Meurthe-et-Moselle in France, Cologne in Germany, Isère in France, Freeport in the Bahamas, Sarthe in France, Pyrénées-Atlantiques in France, Shanghai in China, Delaware in the United States, and Tokyo in Japan.

Novasep’s international presence, combined with its diverse service offerings, demonstrate a commitment to growth and customer satisfaction. As it continues to expand and adapt, it carries forward its unwavering commitment to quality and excellence.

title: Nelson Labs (Sotera Health Company)
description:
Nelson Labs, established in 1985, is a prominent subsidiary of Sotera Health Company. Situated in Salt Lake City, Utah, the company has grown into a large business entity with over 100 million TTM revenue. Nelson Labs has expanded its reach with additional sites in Itasca, Illinois; Bozeman, Montana; another location in Salt Lake City, Utah; and even across the Atlantic in Leuven, Belgium. 

Nelson Labs specializes in a plethora of services including API Physical Characteristics, Antimicrobial Effectiveness Testing, Cytotoxicity Testing, and Drug Product Stability, among many others. Their services span across multiple industries such as medical device, pharmaceutical, protective barriers, and tissue industries, performing over 800 meticulous microbiological and analytical laboratory tests. 

Quality is at the forefront of Nelson Labs' operations as they hold Good Laboratory Practice (GLP) certification, International Organization for Standards 17025 (ISO 17025), and International Safe Transit Association (ISTA) certification. Their commitment to quality is evident in their complex problem-solving approach aimed at improving patient outcomes and reducing client risk. 

As part of the Sotera Health Company, alongside Nordion® and Sterigenics®, Nelson Labs contributes to a global offering of mission-critical sterilization, lab-testing, and advisory services for the healthcare industry, impacting more than 190 million lives worldwide each year.

title: Ncardia
description:
Ncardia is a pioneering company that has, for over a decade, partnered with biotech and pharmaceutical firms to address a significant challenge in drug discovery: the high failure rate of drugs when first introduced to human subjects. The company offers an integrated, proven, iPSC-based drug discovery platform designed to enhance the success rate of drugs by simulating their interactions with the human body, extending from the initial stages of hit identification to the advanced phases of lead optimization.

Ncardia's unique services include custom iPSC generation, differentiation, and supply, readily available iPSC-models, and assay development. The company also offers established disease in vitro models and assays that are suitable for high-throughput screening, as well as custom projects rooted in iPSC technology. 

By utilizing Ncardia's innovative solutions, organizations can dramatically improve their chances of drug discovery success, regardless of their specific modality. The company's comprehensive approach to drug discovery allows for a more accurate prediction of a drug's effects on the human body, significantly reducing the likelihood of failure in early stages of development. As a result, Ncardia's clients are better equipped to deliver safe, effective, and reliable drugs to the market.

title: OpenAnalytics
description:
OpenAnalytics is a small-scale business entity based in Antwerpen, Vlaams Gewest, Belgium. Despite the absence of a disclosed establishment year, the company has managed to carve out a niche for itself in the sector of data analysis and statistical consultation. Operating on an impressive revenue scale of 1-10 million TTM, OpenAnalytics showcases its expertise through its primary site, located on Kortestraat Antwerpen, Belgium, 2220.

The core strength of OpenAnalytics lies within its diverse range of services. The company is proficient in offering data analysis services, a segment which involves the comprehensive inspection, cleansing, transforming, and modelling of data to discover useful information and support decision-making. Alongside this, OpenAnalytics also provides statistical consulting services, aiding businesses to interpret and utilize data effectively in their operations.

Furthermore, OpenAnalytics extends its services to statistical programming, thereby enabling the creation of statistical software which can perform complex data manipulations with ease. The firm also specializes in analytical process optimization services, aimed at improving a company's existing analytical processes for enhanced efficiency and productivity.

Despite the absence of any disclosed certifications, OpenAnalytics, with its array of services and strategic location, continues to cater to the needs of various businesses, thereby playing a pivotal role in the realm of data analysis and optimization.

title: OUTPUT Pharma Services
description:
OUTPUT Pharma Services, a small business based in Aachen, NRW, DE, is a dynamic player in the global pharmaceutical industry. Despite its modest size, with annual revenues ranging from 1-10M, the company has established a significant presence in its niche. 

Located at 19 Pauwelsstraße, Aachen, NRW, 52074 Germany, it stands as a beacon of pharmaceutical innovation. The core services offered by OUTPUT Pharma Services revolve around the supply of investigational medicinal products. These are crucial components in the research and development of new treatments, playing an instrumental role in the progression of clinical trials.

In addition to this, the company provides clinical trial materials, ensuring a steady supply chain for research institutions and pharmaceutical companies around the globe. This pivotal role places OUTPUT Pharma Services at the heart of the quest for new medical discoveries and advancements.

Despite the lack of specified certifications or year of establishment, OUTPUT Pharma Services is a key contributor to the pharmaceutical industry, seamlessly bridging the gap between clinical research and the commercial market. Its commitment to supporting the global supply of investigational medicinal products and clinical trial materials underscores its dedication to fostering progress in the field of medicine.

title: Ontoforce
description:
Ontoforce is an innovative technology company based in Gent, Vlaams Gewest, Belgium. Established as a startup, the company has quickly made a name for itself in the technology sector, despite having only recently entered the market. 

The primary locations of Ontoforce are 108 Kerkstraat Gent, Vlaams Gewest, 9050 Belgium and Ottergemsesteenweg-Zuid 808 Ghelamco Business Center, 3rd floor Ghent, 9000 Belgium. These strategic locations provide the company with a solid foundation for its operations and services.

Ontoforce's crowning achievement is the development and implementation of disQover, an advanced data search platform powered by semantic technology. This platform represents a significant step forward in the field of information flow and management, demonstrating Ontoforce's commitment to pushing the boundaries of technology.

The unique selling point of disQover is its ability to construct intelligent and meaningful connections, which sets it apart from other data search platforms. This innovative feature allows the platform to streamline and optimize the search process, making it user-friendly and efficient.

Despite its relative newness to the market, Ontoforce has already demonstrated its potential by producing pioneering technology that significantly enhances information flow and management. Its dedication to innovation and advancement is evident in its groundbreaking work, which continues to challenge and redefine the boundaries of technology.

title: OhmX.bio
description:
Established in 2019, OhmX.bio is a niche laboratory based in Gent, Belgium, with a strong focus on providing sequencing solutions. As a small business with significant revenue, they are dedicated to spurring scientific breakthroughs through exceptional quality and insightful solutions. 

OhmX.bio caters to companies in the discovery and pre-clinical phases, providing guaranteed results and a commitment to excellence. Their expertise spans across several fields including genomics, translatomics, transcriptomics, proteomics, and bioinformatics. They offer multi-omics solutions and have established efficient pipelines with extra quality control steps to ensure optimal processing of various sample types, including fluids, tissues, FFPE, and cell pellets.

The company's platforms are extensive and include both short-read and long-read sequencing technologies. They also have a dedicated ribo-seq pipeline and offer single-cell sequencing services. All their services can be tailored with custom bioinformatics analyses and output, ensuring each client receives a personalized approach that best fits their research needs.

OhmX.bio prides itself on delivering quality and comprehensive scientific support. They aim to provide the right solution for each client's research progression. The company holds the ISO 27001 and ISO 9001:2015 certifications, further validating their commitment to maintaining high standards and quality in their services.

title: OncoDNA
description:
OncoDNA, a small-scale business with a revenue range of 1-10M TTM, was established in 2012 and is based in Gosselies, Belgium. The company operates globally with a dedicated team of 60 employees working from its headquarters at 1 Rue Louis Breguet, Gosselies, 6041 Belgium. 

OncoDNA collaborates with the Institute of Pathology and Genetics, the largest pathology lab in Belgium, which boasts a staff of 300 individuals, including 25 full-time pathologists and 15 full-time geneticists. This partnership allows OncoDNA to utilize both dry and wet lab facilities, which significantly enhances its capabilities.

Since its inception, OncoDNA's primary focus has been on providing services to oncologists, hospitals, and patients. It expanded its operations to include biopharmaceutical companies in 2016 and has since been involved in over 15 clinical trials. The company has also undertaken more than 30 Next Generation Sequencing (NGS) projects for biopharma research and development.

In addition, OncoDNA has been instrumental in clinically testing thousands of patients for treatment selection and optioning. This service has become a vital part of the daily clinical practice of oncologists, providing them with valuable insights to inform their treatment decisions for cancer patients. OncoDNA's unique blend of expertise and service offerings makes it an important player in the field of oncology and genetic research.

title: OMAPiX Inc (Previously European Spatial Biology Center)
description:
Founded in 2022, OMAPiX Inc, originally known as the European Spatial Biology Center, is a pioneering startup based in Frederick, MD, US. This burgeoning company, with operational sites in the United States and Belgium, specializes in providing top-tier spatial omics and data analytics services to a diverse clientele that includes academic institutions, pharmaceutical businesses, and biotech companies.

OMAPiX Inc is driven by a mission to enhance patient outcomes through in-depth molecular analysis. As a technological partner and solutions developer, OMAPiX Inc employs state-of-the-art single-cell and spatial technologies, both in transcriptomics and proteomics. The company prides itself on being one of the few entities to have mastered the complete process of spatial omics data generation and analytics.

With a robust team of industry-leading spatial omics experts, OMAPiX Inc's value proposition lies in identifying problem-solution fit for pharmaceutical companies, providing support for high-end applications, and ensuring quality control of spatial data. The company's comprehensive solutions include project consultation, technology guidance, sample validation, custom panel design, sample processing, and data analysis.

OMAPiX Inc is at the forefront of supporting next-generation Antibody-Drug Conjugation (ADC) research, driving a deeper understanding of disease biology and offering solutions to expand treatment options for patients. 

The company's services span across various areas such as Antibody-Drug Conjugation, Biomarker Discovery, Clinical Biomarker Analysis, Human Organoids, Immuno-PDX, Immuno-oncology Targets, Neuroscience Models, Oncology Models, Proteomics, RNA Profiling, Single Cell Services, Stem Cell Analysis, and more. Clients can utilize OMAPiX Inc's services for academic research, pharmaceutical and biotech applications, biomarker discovery, and even cell and gene therapy. 

In a nutshell, OMAPiX Inc is a strong partner for those seeking comprehensive solutions in spatial omics and data analytics.

title: PharmedArtis
description:
PharmedArtis is a small-scale business with a niche focus on clinical research and development. Established in 2004, this company has been providing specialized services in the biomedical field for over a decade. Headquartered in Köln, Nordrhein-Westfalen, Germany, it has marked its presence as an integral part of the biotechnological landscape in the region.

PharmedArtis excels in offering cGMP (current Good Manufacturing Practices) production services, a critical component in the clinical trials sector. This ensures the consistent production of effective and high-quality medicinal products. The company is also deeply involved in the dynamic field of immunotherapeutics development. By leveraging advancements in biomedical research, PharmedArtis contributes to the design and creation of treatments that utilize the body's immune system to fight diseases.

In addition, PharmedArtis provides comprehensive 'gene to product' services. This involves the process of identifying, isolating, and using genes to manufacture products for biotechnological applications. Through this service, PharmedArtis supports the development of new drugs, therapies, and diagnostic tools.

The main operational site of PharmedArtis is located at Forckenbeckstraße 6 Köln, Nordrhein-Westfalen, 52074 Germany. Despite its small business status, PharmedArtis, with its estimated 1-10M TTM Revenue, continues to provide top-tier services in the field of biotechnology and clinical research. The company's commitment to quality and innovation makes it a reliable partner in the ever-evolving world of medical science.

title: Pepric
description:
Pepric is a small-scale business enterprise, generating between 1-10 million in TTM Revenue, located in the heart of Leuven, Vlaanderen, Belgium. Despite not having a provided establishment year, the company has carved a distinctive niche in the ever-evolving biotechnology industry.

As its core competency, Pepric specializes in the development of advanced instrumentation. This sophisticated technology is designed for the quantitative monitoring of biodistribution and kinetics of magnetically labelled cells or biomolecules. In addition, the company's innovative instruments can also monitor the magnetic agent itself.

Pepric's unique location in Leuven, Vlaanderen, serves as both its headquarters and primary site of operations, placing the company in the bustling heart of Belgium's biotechnology hub. The company's commitment to innovation and precision in biotechnology has made it a key player in its field.

In essence, Pepric provides the scientific community with tools that are not only essential for advancing research but also instrumental in pushing the boundaries of what's possible in the biotech industry. Through its specialized instruments, Pepric contributes to the understanding of the biodistribution and kinetics of magnetically labeled entities, bringing science one step closer to unlocking the mysteries of cellular and biomolecular behavior.

description:
Pronota, a small business with an annual TTM revenue between 1-10M, was established in 2004 and is headquartered in Oost-Vlaanderen, Vlaams Gewest, BE. This innovative company has carved a unique niche for itself in the field of biomarker discovery and assay development.

Located in the Bio-Incubator in Ghent, Flanders, Belgium, Pronota has a strategic advantage in an environment that fosters life science innovation. The company operates from this highly esteemed site, known for its scientific research and development, which is situated in Oost-Vlaanderen, Vlaams Gewest, 9052 Belgium.

Pronota's core services are centered around biomarker discovery and assay development. With a team of dedicated professionals, the company focuses on identifying, validating, and developing biomarkers. These biomarkers can be instrumental in diagnosing and monitoring various diseases, improving patient outcomes, and ultimately transforming healthcare.

In addition, Pronota also develops assays, which are procedures in medical or laboratory research to assess the presence, amount, or functional activity of a targeted entity. These assays play a crucial role in drug development and clinical trials.

In essence, Pronota is a trailblazer in the realm of biomarker discovery and assay development. The company's commitment to innovation, combined with its strategic location in the heart of one of Belgium's key life science hubs, underscores its unique position in the market.

title: Pralibel
description:
Pralibel, a small business based in Anzegem, Vlaanderen, Belgium, is a testament to the enduring value of artisanal craftsmanship. This company, which operates from its site located at 21 Jagershoek Anzegem, Vlaanderen, 8570 Belgium, is known for its dedication to quality and authenticity. What sets Pralibel's pralines apart is the unique taste that is a result of its artisanal roots. 

Each day, the company produces over 200 different pralines including Fair Trade pralines. The combined output amounts to a daily production of 10 tons, demonstrating the scale at which this small business operates. Despite the volume, the company remains committed to its artisanal origins. The finishing touches on each praline are still applied by hand, resulting in the distinctive look that is a hallmark of Pralibel's offerings.

Despite not having a recorded year of establishment, Pralibel has succeeded in carving out a niche for itself in the confectionery industry. Its commitment to preserving the authenticity of its products while delivering consistent quality has made it a recognizable name in the small business sector with a revenue range of 1-10M TTM.

title: PharmaCell
description: PharmaCell, a small business based in Maastricht, LI, NL, specializes in the highly technical and specialized field of human cell line development, banking, and manufacturing services. Although the year of establishment is not clearly stated, the company has managed to carve a significant niche for itself in the biotechnology market, generating between 1 to 10 million TTM revenue. With its headquarters located at 70 Oxfordlaan Maastricht, LI, 6229 EV Netherlands, PharmaCell is ideally positioned within a vibrant and innovative biotech hub. The company's core strength lies in its offering of unique services, which distinguish it from others in the industry. These services include the development of human cell lines, a fundamental process in biotechnology research and application, and cell banking, which involves the storage of cells for future use. Additionally, PharmaCell is also skilled at cell manufacturing, which involves the production of cells for therapeutic purposes, among other applications. Despite the absence of listed certifications, PharmaCell's achievements in its field of work are a testament to its expertise and dedication to biotechnology. Its unique services and strategic location make it stand out as a leader in the small business sector.

title: Premier Research
description:
Established in 1989, Premier Research is a large clinical research firm based in Morrisville, North Carolina. The firm prides itself on assisting biotech, specialty pharma, and device innovators in transforming innovative ideas and breakthrough science into new medical treatments.

As a global enterprise, Premier Research operates a vast network of sites including locations in the United States, France, Czech Republic, Germany, Hungary, Italy, Ukraine, Belgium, Slovakia, Spain, and South Africa. This extensive reach allows the firm to provide services more efficiently and effectively to their global clientele.

Premier Research's unique expertise lies in the utilization of innovative technologies for smart study design and trial management, delivering clean and conclusive data to sponsors. The firm offers a broad range of services, including the development of product lifecycle strategies, reducing clinical development cycle times, securing access to patients, and navigating global regulations. 

In addition to these services, Premier Research holds an exceptional reputation for maximizing the impact of limited rare disease data and providing expertise in specific therapeutic areas. The company’s main focus is to cater to the unmet needs of patients across a wide array of medical conditions. 

This large business, earning over 100 million in trailing twelve-month revenue, has consistently shown dedication and commitment to helping its customers throughout its decades-long history.

title: PUXANO BV
description:
Established in 2021, PUXANO BV is a burgeoning biotechnology firm based in Gent, Oost-Vlaanderen, Belgium. While it may be considered a small business, with a total transactional revenue between 1 and 10 million, its impact on the biotech industry is significant. 

The company's main focus is on structure-based protein research, utilizing a proprietary platform developed in-house. The platform is principally used for two distinct types of projects. Firstly, it aids in the development of on-demand projects, where technology is accelerated and optimized to facilitate the structural characterization of proteins, including membrane proteins. Secondly, it serves as the foundation for long-term research and development projects, in which PUXANO BV can collaborate with partners, working exclusively on specific protein targets. 

PUXANO BV offers a comprehensive range of services that are well-defined and executed promptly. This includes protein purification using portfolio scaffolds, membrane protein extraction screening, CryoEM grid screening of pre-purified protein samples, and negative stain and cryoEM grid screening of nanoparticles. 

The extensive list of services provided by PUXANO BV also encompasses Affinity Tag Purification, Antibody-Antigen Affinity Measurement, Bacterial Expression, Chemistry, Manufacturing and Controls (CMC), Cryo Electron Microscopy, Cytokines, Electron Microscopy, Electrophoresis, Fusion Proteins, Large Scale Protein Production, Mammalian Expression, Native Protein Purification, Particle Size Analysis, Peptide/Protein Based Vaccine Production, Protein Binding, Protein Crystallization, Protein Expression, Protein Identification, Protein Interaction, Protein Production, Protein Purification, Protein Separation and Detection, Protein Services Consulting, Protein Structure, Recombinant Proteins, Small Angle X-Ray Scattering, and Western Blots. 

For any service inquiries or additional information, PUXANO BV encourages direct contact through their information channels.

title: Pharmalex
description:
Pharmalex, established in 1994, is a prominent mid-sized business based in Burlington, Massachusetts. The company has an expansive global presence with sites in the United States, India, United Kingdom, Spain, Denmark, Norway, Belgium, Bulgaria, France, Puerto Rico, and Germany. 

Pharmalex specializes in providing a comprehensive suite of services for the pharmaceutical, biotech, and medical device sectors. Its services span across the entire product lifecycle, from early strategic planning and non-clinical requirements to clinical development, regulatory submission processes, and post-approval activities. The company is renowned for its exceptional results, offering tailor-made solutions that go beyond the standard expectations. 

In addition to its core services, Pharmalex offers specialized services including, but not limited to, Bayesian Statistics, Bioinformatics, Biomarker Discovery, Biostatistics Consulting, Clinical Trial Design, Data and Text Mining, Real World Evidence Studies, and Translational Data Science and Modeling. 

Pharmalex's commitment to quality and excellence is evident in its ISO 9001:2015 certification. The company is also at the forefront of technological innovation, with experts leveraging technology-enabled solutions to support clients through their product development journey. 

With its focus on delivering exceptional services and maintaining high standards of quality, Pharmalex has established itself as a trusted partner for businesses operating in the pharma, biotech, and medical device industries across the globe.

title: Purna Pharma
description:
Established in 1986, Purna Pharma is a family-owned Contract Development and Manufacturing Organization (CDMO) headquartered in Puurs, Vlaanderen, Belgium. As a small business with revenues between $1-10 million, the company specializes in the development and manufacture of semi-solid and liquid formulations, such as creams, gels, solutions, and suspensions, as well as powders for reconstitution. 

Purna Pharma provides comprehensive services, from the procurement and quality control of raw materials to the manufacturing and quality release of final product forms. This includes various services such as API Physical Characteristics, API Stress Testing Studies, Drug Formulation, Bulk Manufacturing, and many more. Notably, all activities, including quality control, manufacturing, and packaging, are carried out in an environment with Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP) certification.

In addition to its contract services, Purna Pharma also supports its clients with their Research and Development (R&D) pursuits. The company maintains a fully-equipped R&D laboratory capable of assisting clients in developing new or generic products that meet their precise expectations and requirements. The R&D lab undertakes a range of activities, including formulation development, stability and stress testing, analytical method development, and updating or improving formulations. 

With its comprehensive services, cutting-edge R&D lab, and commitment to quality, Purna Pharma has distinguished itself as a reliable partner in the pharmaceutical manufacturing industry.
