title: Pharmaceutical Product Development (PPD)
description:
Pharmaceutical Product Development (PPD) is a globally recognized company committed to providing a wide array of services within the pharmaceutical industry. With an unwavering dedication to quality and customer satisfaction, PPD offers an expansive portfolio of services that cater to various aspects of pharmaceutical development.

The company's offerings include central lab services, which are essential for overseeing and coordinating multiple testing sites. Utilizing state-of-the-art technology, PPD ensures accurate and reliable results across all its laboratories. 

In the quest for novel therapeutic agents, PPD's bioanalytical services play a crucial role. These services facilitate the identification and quantification of drugs and their metabolites, providing valuable insights into drug efficacy and safety.

Through their biomarker discovery services, PPD aids in the identification of biological markers that can help predict disease progression and response to treatment. Their assay development services, on the other hand, focus on developing and validating tests that can be used in clinical trials and diagnostics.

To ensure regulatory compliance and optimal product quality, PPD provides cGMP analytical services. These services encompass a range of activities, from method development and validation to stability testing and release testing. 

For clients seeking guidance on chemistry, manufacturing, and control (CMC) aspects of drug development, PPD offers CMC consulting. This service aims to help clients navigate the complex regulatory landscape, ensuring timely and successful market entry.

Lastly, PPD's pharmacology services offer a comprehensive understanding of the interactions between drugs and biological systems, aiding in the development of safer and more effective drugs.

In summary, Pharmaceutical Product Development (PPD) is a multi-faceted company that provides comprehensive and high-quality services to the pharmaceutical industry.

title: Partners 4 Access
description:
Established in 2015, Partners 4 Access is a small business based in Hilversum, Netherlands, that has made a significant impact in the biotechnology sector. With a focus on orphan drug, cell, and gene therapy access, the company partners with the biotech industry to facilitate product launches across the globe. 

Drawing from extensive experience in cell and gene therapies, Partners 4 Access is uniquely positioned to help clients achieve successful access. The company's proficiency extends to a wide range of services including Emerging Market Opportunities, Formulary & Reimbursement Strategy, Health Technology Assessment Submission, Life Cycle Management, Market Access, Market Research & Business Intelligence, Pricing Strategy, Value Based Agreements, and Value Dossiers Development.

Partners 4 Access is also recognized as a Woman-Owned Business in the United States, reflecting its commitment to diversity and inclusion. The team at Partners 4 Access is driven by a mission to establish balance in the rare disease world. This mission involves propelling access to the most suitable treatments for both patients and physicians, ensuring a reasonable return on investment for manufacturers, and providing an affordable proposition for payers.

Through various media initiatives, Partners 4 Access continues to inform and influence the dialogue surrounding orphan drugs, contributing to its reputation as a thought leader in this critical health sector. The company’s headquarters are located at Boslaan 18, Hilversum, Netherlands.

services.name: Emerging Market Opportunities
services.description: Analyze risks and opportunities in new markets and ensure patients have timely and continued access to new treatments.

services.name: Formulary & Reimbursement Strategy
services.description: Develop strategy and narrative to gain formulary access on insurance plans.

services.name: Health Technology Assessment Submission (HTA Submission)
services.description: Analyze the medical, social, ethical, humanistic, and economic considerations of a drug, medical device, or clinical procedures. Submissions are sent to regulatory agencies with different requirements that govern submissions. See also AMCP and Value Dossier.

services.name: Life Cycle Management
services.description: Plan and strategy of the data collection and information throughout the different phases of product development (portfolio assessment, pre-clinical trials, clinical trials, pre-authorization, post-authorization, and RWE)

services.name: Market Access
services.description: Find general strategies and methods used to market a pharmaceutical product or device.

services.name: Market Research & Business Intelligence
services.description: Run market feasibility studies, establish customer needs, improve product performance and analyze competition.

services.name: Pricing Strategy
services.description: Develop value story tailored to a payer audience that will determine the appropriate price for treatment.

services.name: Value Based Agreements or Outcomes-Based Contracts
services.description: Collaborate with payer or provider to develop a reimbursement plan outside of the traditional fixed cost-per-unit that ties reimbursement or price to actual health outcomes.

services.name: Value Dossiers Development
services.description: Summary document that presents clinical, economic, and humanistic value of an intervention and associated disease state with the supporting evidence, formulated from the perspective of a particular stakeholder (manufacturer, payer, provider, HTA agency, etc.). See also HTA Submission.

title: Qualiphar
description:
Founded in 1937, Qualiphar is a small-sized enterprise generating a revenue between 1-10 million TTM, nestled in the heart of Antwerpen, Vlaams Gewest in Belgium. With its primary location at Rijksweg 9 Antwerpen, the company puts itself on the map as a significant player in the healthcare industry.

Qualiphar's specialization lies in the comprehensive development, production, and marketing of a diverse range of products. These include over-the-counter drugs, a line of diverse vitamins, an assortment of cosmetics, and a variety of healthcare accessories. The company's unique offering reflects a blend of innovation, quality, and care, making it a trusted provider of healthcare products.

Over the decades, Qualiphar has maintained a consistent focus on producing high-quality products that meet the needs of its diverse customer base. The company's commitment to ensuring the health and well-being of its customers is reflected in its wide range of products. 

In summary, Qualiphar is a small but influential player in the healthcare industry, with a strong emphasis on the development and marketing of a wide array of products. From over-the-counter drugs to cosmetics and healthcare accessories, the company's product lineup is as diverse as it is high-quality.

title: Q-Biologicals
description:
Established in 2011, Q-Biologicals is a small-scale business based in the heart of Gent, Vlaanderen, BE. With an impressive footprint in the industry, the company operates from its strategic location at 4a Technologiepark-Zwijnaarde Gent, Vlaanderen, 9052 Belgium, Ghent, Flanders, 9052 Belgium. 

Despite its small size (generating 1-10M TTM revenue), Q-Biologicals has carved a unique niche for itself in the broader biotechnological landscape. It boasts of an exclusive focus on providing premium services in the sophisticated field of process development and manufacturing. 

What sets Q-Biologicals apart is its specialization in the production of recombinant proteins, viruses, and live cells. The company's deep expertise in these areas has allowed it to achieve high standards of quality and efficiency, thus positioning it as a reliable partner in the biotech industry.

Q-Biologicals' commitment to these specialized areas of biotechnology has enabled it to make meaningful contributions to the field and its clients, demonstrating a depth of knowledge and a level of service that is truly unique in the market. The company's ongoing dedication to innovation and excellence continues to drive its growth and success in the industry. 

In summary, Q-Biologicals, with its strong foothold in Gent, BE, is an influential player in the realm of process development and production of recombinant proteins, viruses, and live cells.

title: Quality Assistance
description:
Quality Assistance, established in 1982, is a mid-sized business known for its specialized services in the pharmaceutical sector. The company's headquarters are nestled in the tranquil town of Donstiennes, located in Thuin, Belgium. Additionally, it operates from its site at Techno Parc de Thudinie, which is also located in Donstiennes. 

With a solid background spanning nearly four decades, Quality Assistance has carved a niche for itself in the market by offering a diverse range of services that include ADME studies, drug efficacy assessments, toxicological evaluations, Chemistry, Manufacturing, and Controls (CMC), as well as clinical trials. The company's analytical services are also highly sought after, showcasing their comprehensive approach to pharmaceutical solutions.

The unique selling proposition of Quality Assistance lies in its versatile portfolio of services, which contribute to their substantial annual revenue of 10 to 100 million dollars. This mid-sized enterprise's success is a testament to their commitment to maintaining a high standard of quality in all their operations. By providing a broad spectrum of services under one roof, Quality Assistance continues to be a one-stop solution for many in the pharmaceutical industry.

title: QUALIblood
description:
Established in 2018, QUALIblood is a small business based in Namur, Belgium, with an annual turnover between 1-10M TTM. The company operates from its headquarters situated at Rue du Séminaire 20a, Namur, 5000 Belgium. QUALIblood is a laboratory that specializes in providing a range of analytical services for blood investigations testing to industries, hospitals, and universities. 

For each client and project, QUALIblood creates customized solutions, devises analytical protocols, and develops validated specific analytical methods for blood testing. Their assistance extends from candidate selection to non-clinical and clinical studies, all the way to marketing authorization. This comprehensive support is backed by their state-of-the-art, product-focused expertise in blood analysis.

Moreover, QUALIblood offers a unique convergence of expertise drawn from laboratory, clinical, and regulatory scientists who are actively involved in esteemed scientific communities. They operate in an environment that complies with Good Clinical Laboratory Practice (GCLP), Good Laboratory Practice (GLP), and ISO17025 standards. This ensures that their services uphold the highest levels of quality and reliability in the industry. By choosing QUALIblood, clients can benefit from their comprehensive suite of services and robust scientific expertise for all their blood testing needs.

title: RIC Belgium - RIC biologics
description:
RIC Belgium, also known as RIC Biologics, is a reputable small business headquartered in Kortrijk, Belgium. Founded in 1986, the company has a longstanding history of providing analytical services and turn-key solutions to various sectors of the industry, as well as private and governmental laboratories worldwide. 

The company specializes in a broad range of services including API Physical Characteristics, Affinity Tag Purification, Antibody Detection and Purification, Assay Development and Consulting, Carbohydrate Structure Characterization, Drug Formulation and Stability, Immunoaffinity Chromatography, Lipid Kinase Assays, Mass Spectrometry-Based Proteomics, and more. 

RIC Belgium prides itself on its unique collaborative approach. In working closely with its clients, the company develops, evaluates, and validates new methods. Often, the final step includes the transfer of instrumentation, knowledge, and know-how to the customer's laboratory. 

RIC Belgium's research activities and method development projects span across diverse application areas such as biochemistry, biotechnology, petro-chemistry, clinical chemistry, food, flavors and natural products, polymer sciences, pharmaceutical sciences, toxicology, environmental chemistry, and life sciences. 

In addition to these services, RIC Belgium offers total analytical solutions and plays a vital role in instrumental innovation, both independently and in collaboration with manufacturers. Recognizing the growing need for dedicated training in chromatography, electrophoresis, and mass spectrometry, the company also runs a comprehensive training program to guide users through the latest developments in modern separation sciences. 

With its extensive expertise and commitment to quality, RIC Belgium stands as a leader in the field of analytical services and solutions.

title: reMYND
description:
Established in 2002, reMYND is a small business that specializes in neuroscience, based in Vlaams-Brabant, Vlaams Gewest, Belgium. The company provides a variety of services, including antibody purification, behavioural testing models, cognition models, electroencephalogram (EEG) models, excitotoxicity models, and more. It also offers specific models for Huntington's and Parkinson's disease. 

reMYND is particularly recognized for its proprietary mouse models, which carry genetic mutations for Alzheimer's disease. These unique models are available in different aged cohorts, which allows for immediate commencement of studies that can precisely match the disease state to specific research requirements. In addition, the company offers inflammation assays, Morris Water Maze, and pathway mapping.

As a trusted partner in the field, reMYND applies its in vivo technologies to test the therapeutic effects of experimental treatments for neurodegenerative diseases such as Alzheimer's, tauopathies, Parkinson's, and Huntington's. This small business stands as a reliable ally in the fight against these debilitating conditions, leveraging its unique resources and expertise to contribute to advancements in treatment and understanding of these diseases. 

Overall, reMYND exemplifies a dedicated commitment to neuroscience research, offering specialized services and models that cater to the unique needs of each study. Their position in Vlaams-Brabant, Belgium, offers a strategic location for collaborations across Europe and the world.

title: Silicos
description:
Silicos, a small business enterprise, was established in the year 2005. The company has its headquarters located in Limburg, Vlaams Gewest, BE. Despite its size, with a total through-the-year revenue amounting to between 1 to 10 million, Silicos has managed to make a significant impact in its field. It operates from its site situated in Wetenschapspark Limburg, in the Vlaams Gewest region, specifically at 3590 Belgium, Diepenbeek, Flanders, Belgium.

Silicos is primarily engaged in providing a range of specialized services. These include de novo drug design, a process that involves the design of small molecular drugs starting from the basic chemical structures. The company also offers virtual screening services, a method used in molecular biology to search libraries of small molecules in order to identify the structures that are most likely to bind to a drug target.

In addition, Silicos is involved in the characterization of molecular databases, which includes the process of defining, gathering, cataloging, and presenting the molecular data in an organized way. The company also specializes in QSAPR building, a method that explores the structural properties of various pharmaceutical agents. Lastly, Silicos carries out VCD calculations, a crucial component in the process of determining the structure of molecules.

In summary, Silicos is a dynamic and innovative company offering a wide range of services in the field of molecular biology and drug design. Despite its small business status, it has established a strong presence in the industry through its specialized offerings and commitment to quality.

title: Saint-Luc Tumour Bank
description:
Saint-Luc Tumour Bank is a small-scale business based in Zaventem, Vlaanderen, Belgium. Although the establishment year is not specified, the company has made a significant impact in the medical research field, specifically targeting cancer. The business operates primarily from its main site located at 10 Avenue Hippocrate, Zaventem, Vlaanderen, 1200 Belgium.

The primary service of Saint-Luc Tumour Bank involves the collection and preservation of unused biological material from patients who are diagnosed or suspected to have cancer. Samples gathered for diagnosis and treatment purposes often result in surplus biological materials. This surplus is crucial for cancer research and is thus preserved and catalogued at the Tumour Bank at the Cliniques Universitaires Saint-Luc King Albert II Institute.

These residual samples provide an invaluable resource for researchers globally, allowing them to comprehend the development mechanisms of cancer and to devise new treatments. By centralizing and storing these samples, Saint-Luc Tumour Bank enables the medical and scientific community to access this essential data easily, fostering innovation and advancement in cancer treatment and potentially improving patient outcomes worldwide.

title: Sanico
description:

The company's headquarters and primary site are situated at Veedijk 59, Antwerpen, in the region of Vlaams Gewest, a location from which it has been making significant contributions to the pharmaceutical industry for nearly nine decades.

Sanico specializes in providing a wide array of services, including the manufacturing, packaging, and facilitation of clinical trials for non-sterile products. Its unique expertise lies in its ability to integrate these critical functions, thereby offering a comprehensive solution for clients seeking to develop, test, and package non-sterile products. 

With its enduring commitment to quality and innovation, Sanico has carved a unique niche for itself within the sector. Over the years, it has successfully navigated the complexities of pharmaceutical manufacturing and has emerged as a reliable partner for numerous companies seeking safe and effective non-sterile products. The company's enduring success can be attributed to its unwavering commitment to quality, its ability to adapt to changing industry trends, and its dedicated team of professionals who continually strive to exceed client expectations.

title: SCAP Test
description:
Established in 2015 and based in Ramillies, Wallonie, Belgium, SCAP Test is a small business that specializes in providing in silico computational modeling and simulation of cardiac action potential. The company, registered under VAT number BE0600.913.218, operates from its headquarters situated at 10 Rue D'Albroux Ramillies, Wallonie, 1367 Belgium. 

SCAP Test offers a range of specialized services in line with the CiPA initiative, aimed at identifying potential drug cardiac liabilities. These include early after depolarisation (EAD), transmural dispersion of repolarisation (TDR), triangulation, reverse use dependence, action potential duration (APD) prolongation or shortening, and Vmax increase or decrease. 

With its annual revenue ranging from 1 to 10 million dollars, SCAP Test's expertise lies in offering robust computational modeling solutions that can aid pharmaceutical and medical research industries in understanding the potential cardiac impacts of various drugs and treatments. The company's unique services assist in the early detection of cardiac liabilities, thereby helping to improve the safety and effectiveness of medical interventions. 

In summary, SCAP Test is a dynamic and innovative small business, committed to providing high-quality computational modeling services to support drug development and enhance patient safety.

title: SMARTBioLabs

As for the services they offer, SMARTBioLabs has uniquely positioned itself in the market through the provision of bioanalysis services. These services are specifically tailored to tackle areas such as Cardiovascular Disease, Vascular Calcification, Mineral & Bone/Cartilage Disorders, Kidney Disease, and Diabetes & Metabolic Syndrome. The company has developed unique manual and automated assays to diagnose and manage these conditions effectively. 

Overall, SMARTBioLabs stands as a beacon of innovation in the scientific community, offering specialized, cutting-edge services that cater to various health complications. Their dedication to providing unique, high-quality bioanalysis services has solidified their esteemed reputation in the industry.

title: StratiCELL
description:

One of StratiCELL’s unique services is phototoxicity testing. This specialized testing service measures the potential harmful effects of substances when exposed to light, significantly contributing to the field of photosensitivity research.

In conclusion, StratiCELL is a small yet potent player in the industry, offering specialized services that are integral to skincare research and development. Its commitment to safety, quality, and innovation truly sets it apart.

title: Spectralys Biotech
description:
Spectralys Biotech is a small business enterprise based in Bruxelles, Belgium, established in 2018. Despite its relatively young age, it has made substantial strides in the field of biotechnology, specializing in analytical services for biomolecules, particularly proteins, with a focus on Fourier Transform Infrared (FTIR) spectroscopy. 

The company operates from its headquarters situated at Campus Plaine, Boulevard du Triomphe Accès 2, CP206/2 Building BC, Level 4, Room 1C4102 in Bruxelles, 1050 Belgium. With its revenue falling in the range of 1-10 million TTM, Spectralys Biotech has managed to carve a niche in the industry by providing a range of specialized services. These services include accelerated stability, atomic force microscopy, chemistry, manufacturing and controls (CMC), circular dichroism, epitope mapping, protein structure, structural spectroscopy, as well as UV and IR profiling.

Spectralys Biotech has a unique ability to evaluate four critical quality attributes: structure, glycosylation, total protein concentration, and the quantification of excipients such as Tween. This contributes to their primary applications, which encompass multiparametric batch-to-batch consistency, stability and stress studies, comparability studies for biosimilar candidates, structural characterization, and in-process analytical tools. With a blend of sharp expertise and advanced technology, Spectralys Biotech is a leader in the field of biotech analytical services.

title: simAbs NV
description:
Established in 2019, simAbs NV is a new and promising startup based in the heart of Diepenbeek, Limburg, Belgium. As a newer player in the industry with a revenue range of 0-1M TTM, this dynamic company has quickly begun to make its mark.

Operating from its sites located at Agoralaan Abis Diepenbeek, Limburg, 3590 Belgium, simAbs NV offers an extensive range of services. These include Antibody Conjugation, Antibody Purification, and Antibody Sequencing. They also specialize in Antibody-Drug Conjugation, Bi-specific Antibodies, and Cytotoxicity. Their expertise further expands to ELISA, GMP Synthesis, Host Cell Protein Analysis, and Hybridoma Sequencing/Antibody Sequencing. They also offer In Vitro Monoclonal Antibody Production, Monoclonal/Polyclonal Antibody Development, Polyclonal/Monoclonal Antibody Production, and Protein Conjugation. simAbs NV's provision of Protein Targets, Recombinant Proteins, Recombinant Technology, Single Chain Variable Fragment (scFv), and Western Blots rounds out their offerings.

SimAbs NV has also carved a specialized niche in providing contract research services focused on biologics development and manufacturing. Their services encompass Stable Cell Line Development, Upstream and Downstream Process Development, along with Analytical Method Development and PAT Technologies. They also offer GLP and GMP Manufacturing services. 

Thus, with its vast array of services and specialization, simAbs NV is undoubtedly a rising star in its industry, offering comprehensive solutions for biologics development and manufacturing.

title: Secoya Technologies
description:
Secoya Technologies is a small-sized enterprise with a revenue range of 1 to 10 million TTM, specializing in a variety of advanced manufacturing and consulting services. Founded in 2019, the company is headquartered in Ottignies-Louvain-la-Neuve, Belgium.

Secoya Technologies excels in the development of API manufacturing processes and offers notable expertise in technology transfer and validation. The company's proficiency extends to Chemistry, Manufacturing, and Controls (CMC), a critical component in the pharmaceutical manufacturing industry. Their services also include conducting intricate crystallization studies, which are pivotal in understanding the properties of various substances and materials.

Furthermore, Secoya Technologies is skilled in the study and application of liposomes, which are nanoscale lipid vesicles used in the targeted delivery of drugs and genetic material in the body. The company also offers polymorph screening, a process that aids in controlling the physical properties of drug substances to ensure optimal performance.

In addition to these specialized services, Secoya Technologies provides production process consulting, leveraging their expertise to help other businesses improve their manufacturing processes. Their office is located at Fond des Més 4 Ottignies-Louvain-la-Neuve, 1348 Belgium. 

Overall, the company stands as a promising player in the field, offering specialized and comprehensive services that cater to the needs of the sophisticated pharmaceutical and manufacturing industries.

title: Trinean
description:
Established in 2006, Trinean is a small business situated in Oost-Vlaanderen, Vlaams Gewest, BE, and it specializes in the development and commercialization of sophisticated scientific equipment. With an annual revenue of $1-10 million, the company has successfully carved a niche for itself in the competitive market. 

Trinean's primary focus lies in the advancement of the DropSense96, a unique multichannel spectrophotometer. This piece of equipment works in conjunction with disposable microfluidic microplates, specifically DropPlate16 and DropPlate96. The innovative design and functionality of these products make them suitable for swift and accurate spectral analysis of microliter droplets. 

The droplets analyzed using this equipment can range from DNA, RNA, and protein to small compounds, showcasing the wide-ranging applicability of Trinean's offerings. The headquarters of Trinean, where all this innovative work takes place, is located at Dulle-Grietlaan Oost-Vlaanderen, Vlaams Gewest, Belgium.

Overall, Trinean represents the epitome of innovation in scientific equipment advancement, consistently working towards providing quick, precise, and reliable solutions for spectral analysis.

title: Taminco
description:
Established in Gent, Vlaams Gewest, BE, Taminco is a global specialty chemical company recognized for its distinct focus on niche markets. Despite being a recent startup, it has already established a significant presence in the industry. As the world's foremost producer of alkylamines and derivatives, Taminco also holds a substantial position in the production of formic acid and derivatives. 

The company's broad product range caters to a diversified clientele and is used in the creation of a variety of goods for multiple industries, including agriculture, animal nutrition, water treatment, personal care, home care, and the oil and gas sector. Taminco's contribution to these industries is not limited to the core products; it also provides ancillary characteristics necessary for optimal performance. 

Taminco's operations are global, with eight production facilities operating in 23 countries, a testament to its significant reach and influence in the specialty chemical market. Their business approach is service-oriented, driven by passion, care, and integrity. This unique approach, which they term as the 'Taminco Touch,' emphasizes operational excellence and the timely delivery of premium quality products to meet their partners' needs. 

The company maintains a continuous focus on innovation, aiming to address key industry trends and future market needs. By strengthening their open innovation model, Taminco seeks to create new opportunities for customers and make a significant impact on the future world.

title: Telstar Life Science Solutions
description:
Telstar Life Science Solutions is a small yet robust business specializing in the creation, production, and support of high-tech equipment solutions. Their primary market comprises the pharmaceutical, biotech, and associated industries. Despite not having a specified year of establishment, Telstar Life Science Solutions has managed to make a significant impact in its field, demonstrating a range of expertise and commitment to their clients.

The company is headquartered in Terrassa, CT, Spain, but its influence is not limited to its home country. Telstar Life Science Solutions has a formidable global presence, with sites spanning from Madrid, Spain, to Friesland, Netherlands, and from Vlaams Gewest, Belgium, to Valparaíso, Mexico. Additional locations include Saratov, Russia, Shandong Province, China, and Ashford, United Kingdom. The company's reach even extends to Paris, France, and Darmstadt, Hamburg, in the United Kingdom.

Despite its small business status, with a total transfer to management revenue between 1 to 10 million, Telstar Life Science Solutions has positioned itself as a reliable and innovative player in the life sciences sector. Its dedication to designing and manufacturing high-quality equipment solutions makes it a valuable partner in the pharmaceutical and biotech industries.

title: Tosoh Bioscience
description:
Established in 1935, Tosoh Bioscience is a small business with a revenue range of 1 to 10 million. Headquartered in Minato City, Tokyo, Japan, the company has an impressive global presence with multiple sites across the world. These locations include various cities in Japan, the United States, Belgium, Germany, Switzerland, the United Kingdom, Italy, Greece, China, Singapore, South Korea, and Taiwan.

Tosoh Bioscience specializes in the production and distribution of a wide range of products and services. Their offerings include ceramic materials, fine chemicals, fluoro compounds, organic intermediates, and polymer products. These products play a significant role in various industries and applications, demonstrating the company's versatility and wide reach.

This dynamic company has successfully maintained its relevance and competitiveness in the market for over 80 years. With its commitment to quality and innovation, Tosoh Bioscience continues to make significant contributions to its industry. The company's unique offerings and global footprint make it a noteworthy player in the world of biosciences.

title: Theorem Clinical Research
description:
Established in 1985, Theorem Clinical Research is a small business specializing in comprehensive clinical research solutions. With its headquarters situated in King of Prussia, PA, the company is renowned for its wide range of services including data management, biostatistics, programming - inclusive of CDISC, project management, clinical operations, and regulatory affairs.

Despite being classified as a small business with an annual revenue between 1 to 10 million, Theorem Clinical Research has a robust global presence. It operates a network of sites across the globe spanning North America, South America, Europe, Asia, and Australia. Notable locations include Buenos Aires in Argentina, North Ryde in Australia, Montreal and Mississauga in Canada, Santiago in Chile, Paris in France, Cologne in Germany, Tokyo in Japan, Moscow in Russia, and Chippenham in the United Kingdom, among others. 

Through its international reach and dedication to quality service, Theorem Clinical Research has positioned itself as a leader in the clinical research industry. The company stands as a testament to the capabilities of small businesses in making significant global impacts. Its commitment to providing high-quality clinical research solutions continues to drive its success, making it an essential player in the industry.

title: tebu-bio
description:
Established in 1953, tebu-bio is a renowned mid-sized business specializing in life science research reagents and lab services. The company is headquartered in Le Perray-en-Yvelines, France and operates across multiple locations in the UK, Spain, Germany, Denmark, Belgium, the Netherlands, Italy, and Portugal. 

Tebu-bio's service offerings are broad and comprehensive, ranging from 3D cell culture and apoptosis assays to human cell products and siRNA synthesis. The company's lab services are divided into four main platforms: Biomarkers, Protein Production, Molecular Biology, and Cell Culture. These platforms enable tebu-bio to provide specialized services such as protein quantification and profiling, gene and miRNA profiling, and a host of biomarker-related services.

Human biological samples and prospective collections form a significant part of tebu-bio's work. The company strictly adheres to regulatory and ethics guidelines related to human biospecimens collection, offering a wide variety of samples including blood derivatives, biofluids, tissues, and primary cells. 

Tebu-bio is also the exclusive European distributor of the Japanese Collection of Research Bioresources Cell Bank, which provides a vast array of high-quality cell lines from various species.

In addition to lab services, tebu-bio's product offerings include research antibodies, ELISAs, proteins and peptides, cell-based and functional assays, primary cells and media, and stem cells and iPS cells, among others. 

Tebu-bio is certified under the Clinical Laboratory Improvement Amendments (CLIA), International Organization for Standards 14001 (ISO 14001), and International Organization for Standards 9001:2015 (ISO 9001:2015), demonstrating their commitment to quality, excellence, and continuous improvement.

title: University of Liege
description:
Established in 1817, the University of Liege, located in the historical city of Liège, Walloon Region, Belgium, is a renowned academic core facility. With a significant portion of its budget dedicated to research, the university has earned a reputation for high-level research acknowledged globally. 

The University of Liege is home to more than 2000 personnel, including academics, researchers, and technicians, all engaged in a wide range of research areas, from fundamental research to applied research. The university's size fosters interdisciplinary research and promotes dynamic relationships between various disciplines. 

In addition, the university maintains numerous partnerships with the industrial sector, further enhancing its research capabilities. It is also distinguished by its services in large molecule drug development consulting and small molecule drug development consulting.

The University of Liege has pioneered a unique research observatory, also known as prospective mapping. This initiative, launched in 2008, is designed to monitor the university's experience and accomplishments, as well as to evaluate its strengths and weaknesses in research. This strategic approach to self-assessment and improvement underscores the University of Liege's commitment to academic excellence and innovation in research. 

With its rich history and forward-thinking approach, the University of Liege continues to be a leading player in regional, national, and international research arenas.

services.name: Large Molecule Drug Development Consulting
services.description: Develop large molecule drugs and complex biologics that have a therapeutic effect.

services.description: Request consulting services related to small molecule development.

title: University of Antwerp - Bio-Imaging Lab Core
description:
The Bio-Imaging Lab Core, a focal point of research and development within the University of Antwerp, specializes in utilizing high-resolution in vivo Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) technology. Its primary focus is on small laboratory animals, centering on investigations into brain function under conditions of health and disease. The lab's location is situated within the academic heartland of Antwerpen, Vlaanderen, Belgium at 1 Universiteitsplein Antwerpen, 2610.

Although the year of establishment is not specified, the Bio-Imaging Lab Core has positioned itself as an integral part of the academic community at the University of Antwerp. It functions as an Academic Core Facility, a hub for scientific exploration that aids in the acceleration of academic research and discovery.

Despite its academic roots, the Bio-Imaging Lab Core's research and development activities hold the potential for broad-reaching implications in the fields of health, medicine, and neuroscience. By understanding brain function in both healthy and pathological states through the lens of high-resolution MRI technology, the lab contributes to the global discourse on brain health and disease management. With its unique approach and rigorous research methodology, the Bio-Imaging Lab Core at the University of Antwerp is a beacon of innovation in the world of academic research.

sites.name: University of Antwerp - Bio-Imaging Lab Core

title: University of Antwerp
description:
The University of Antwerp, located in Antwerpen, Vlaams Gewest, Belgium, is an Academic Core Facility renowned for its research capacities. Despite its establishment date remaining undisclosed, the institution has forged a robust reputation in the realm of scientific research, particularly in significant areas of study like drug discovery and development, ecology, infectious disease, and neurosciences.

The university's primary site is situated in Gratiekapelstraat, Antwerpen, which is nestled in the heart of Vlaams Gewest, a region known for its rich academic and cultural history. As an academic institution, the University of Antwerp contributes to the global knowledge base, driving innovations and advancements in various scientific fields.

The University of Antwerp is a leading research institution, providing valuable contributions to the scientific community. Its focus areas include drug discovery and development, where it contributes to the discovery of new medications and treatments for various diseases. Its work in ecology aids in understanding our environment and the impact of human activities on it. In the field of infectious disease, the institution's research aids in the understanding and combating of various infections, thus contributing to global health and wellbeing. Finally, its work in neurosciences helps to unravel the complexities of the brain and nervous system, contributing to the development of treatments for neurological disorders.

In summary, the University of Antwerp, with its strategic location in Vlaams Gewest, is a beacon of scientific research and academic excellence, continuously pushing the boundaries of knowledge and innovation in various scientific disciplines.

title: University of Maastricht Maastricht University
description:
The University of Maastricht, also known as Maastricht University, is a distinguished academic core facility nestled in the heart of Maastricht, Limburg, in the Netherlands. Though the year of its establishment is not specified, it has been a beacon of learning and enlightenment, contributing significantly to both local and global academic spheres. 

Their primary location is situated at Markt 78, Maastricht, Limburg, a historic and vibrant hub in the Netherlands. This makes it a center for learning that beautifully blends the rich historical context of its surroundings with modern academic pursuits. 

The University of Maastricht is primarily dedicated to providing high-quality academic research and teaching. It is in this intellectual arena that the university excels, nurturing scholars in various disciplines and promoting innovative research that pushes the boundaries of human knowledge. 

Despite not having specific certifications listed, Maastricht University's reputation as a leading academic institution is well-regarded within the academic community. The University's contributions and services extend far beyond the confines of its historic walls, impacting the wider world with its commitment to fostering knowledge and enlightenment. Through its services, the University of Maastricht continues to uphold its dedication to academic excellence, contributing to the growth and development of intellectual thought both in the Netherlands and globally.

title: Université Catholique de Louvain Laboratory of Oncology
description:
Université Catholique de Louvain Laboratory of Oncology, based in Louvain-la-Neuve, Wallonie, Belgium, is an esteemed Academic Core Facility. At its singular location in Place de l'Université, the laboratory is a bustling hub of scientific innovation and discovery.

Boasting over 150 dedicated research staff, the facility is a nexus for molecular and cellular biology research. The Laboratory of Oncology's primary goal is fostering an environment conducive to high-level research activities. This commitment to excellence is demonstrated through their promotion of high-quality basic research in the life sciences.

This facility is not only dedicated to the advancement of academic research, but also to the practical application of these discoveries. This dual focus allows for the development of applied projects born from basic research, creating a cycle of ongoing innovation.

The Université Catholique de Louvain Laboratory of Oncology is also committed to the nurturing of budding talent in the scientific community. They provide support to young, talented researchers, encouraging the growth of successful teams and promoting the transfer of knowledge.

In addition to their research and development efforts, the facility also prioritizes interdisciplinary projects, technological platform establishment, and the enhancement of young researchers' scientific training. This comprehensive approach to scientific research and education makes the Université Catholique de Louvain Laboratory of Oncology a beacon of excellence in the world of life sciences.

sites.name: Université Catholique de Louvain Laboratory of Oncology
sites.address: 1 Place de l'Université Louvain-la-Neuve, Wallonie, 1348 Belgium

title: VIB Nanobody Core
description:
Established in 2005, VIB Nanobody Core is an Academic Core Facility with its site located at Pleinlaan 2 Building E in Brussel, 1050 Belgium. The facility is primarily involved in the design and implementation of a diverse range of projects. These projects encompass a multitude of subjects including the development of research tools, identification and optimization of leads for diagnostic and therapeutic applications in various medical fields. These fields range from cancer to inflammatory and infectious diseases, and extend to neurodegenerative disorders.

VIB Nanobody Core is not just involved in the continuous enhancement of existing technology, but it also constantly aims to further streamline the processes related to the generation, identification, and engineering of Nanobodies. The facility has made significant contributions to developing innovative Nanobody-based technology platforms.

Some of the novel technologies developed by VIB Nanobody Core include Nanobody-based serum half-life extension of therapeutics, viral load quantification using Nanobodies, Nanobody-based ChIP-chip, and a Nanobody-based target discovery platform. These advancements are aimed at discovering new diagnostic and therapeutic targets, demonstrating the facility's commitment to pushing the boundaries of medical research and technology.

title: VIB - Metabolomics Core Leuven
description:
VIB - Metabolomics Core Leuven is an esteemed Academic Core Facility established in 2014. Though it does not have a formal headquarters, it is situated at 120 Rijvisschestraat Gent, Vlaanderen, 9051 Belgium. This facility is recognized for its comprehensive suite of services that contribute to the field of metabolomics, an emerging and significant branch of science.

Their diverse range of services includes Isotopic Labeling, Metabolite Identification and Profiling, and Metabolite Quantification. Additionally, their expertise extends to Metabolomics Biomarker Discovery, Metabonomics Data Analysis, and Multi-Omics Study, making them a highly versatile and critical player in the scientific community. 

Moreover, VIB - Metabolomics Core Leuven also offers a variety of No Label Methods, Non GLP Small Molecule Bioanalysis, and Non Isotopic Labeling services. Their commitment to a broad list of services ensures they cater to a wide range of scientific research needs, providing comprehensive solutions for all clients.

Despite the absence of formal certifications, the facility's commitment to high-quality services has cemented its reputation in the field. With robust offerings and a strong dedication to the progression of science, VIB - Metabolomics Core Leuven continues to be a crucial contributor to the ever-evolving field of metabolomics.

title: VIB Bioimaging core Gent
description:
VIB Bioimaging Core Gent, located in Zwijnaarde, Belgium, is a leading facility for bioimaging and microscopy. Established in 2012, the organization focuses on providing high-quality, high-resolution bioimaging, which is a crucial element in contemporary life science research. The facility is equipped with over €10 million worth of advanced equipment and a team of 17 dedicated experts.

The core competency of VIB Bioimaging Core Gent includes specialized instrumentation for both light and electron microscopy. They are pioneers in enhancing Correlative Light and Electron Microscopy (CLEM) techniques, aiming to solve complex biological questions. With a versatile instrument base, they ensure the most suitable instrumentation for any imaging requirement.

Moreover, it operates as a dual-site facility with platforms in Ghent and Leuven. It caters to the academic and industrial life sciences community, providing high-resolution light and electron microscopy to closely examine cells and tissues in three dimensions. The Gent platform is a significant part of the VIB-UGent Center for Inflammation Research.

Conversely, the Leuven platform delves into studying rapid dynamic processes in single cells and is a vital part of the VIB-KU Leuven Center for Brain & Disease Research. The Electron Microscopy Platform in Leuven is associated with the VIB Bioimaging Core, while the TEM activities of the Ghent platform are incorporated in the UGent TEM Expertise Center. In essence, VIB Bioimaging Core Gent is a champion in the field of bioimaging and microscopy, continually pushing boundaries in life science research.

services.name: Bioimaging
services.description: Visualize biological process non-invasively in real time.

services.name: Confocal/Optical Microscopy
services.description: Use optical imaging technique to increase optical resolution and contrast of a micrograph.

title: Vesale Pharma
description:
Vesale Pharma, a Belgian pharmaceutical firm, is based in Noville-sur-Mehaigne, 5310, Belgium. The small business, with a revenue ranging between 1-10M TTM, was established in 1997 by Jehan Liénart. The company's influence extends to over 40 countries across the globe, asserting its presence in the international pharmaceutical market. 

Vesale Pharma exclusively caters to pharmacies, marketing a diverse range of products across several therapeutic areas. These include dermatology, gastroenterology, women's health, immunity, and pregnancy care. One of their standout products is the acclaimed antiperspirant from the Axitrans range. 

The company has carved a niche for itself as a trailblazer in the field of probiotics. Vesale Pharma's reputation is anchored on its commitment to research and innovation within this area. It offers an array of probiotic products, all of which are based on the most extensively documented strains worldwide. The company holds the exclusive licence rights for these strains, further solidifying its position as a leader in the pharmaceutical industry. 

Vesale Pharma operates from two sites located at 9 Rue Louis Allaert Éghezée, Wallonie, 5310 Belgium, and Rue Louis Allaert, 9 Noville-sur-Mehaigne, 5310, Belgique Belgium, respectively.

title: Vanta Bioscience
description:
Vanta Bioscience, established in 2011, is a preeminent full-service preclinical contract research organization. As a small business generating 1-10M TTM revenue, the company has been making significant strides in the industry. The organization maintains research laboratories in Chennai, India, and sustains a global presence with offices strategically located in Brussels, Belgium, West Des Moines, Iowa, USA, Vlaams-Brabant, Vlaams Gewest, Belgium, Marion, USA, and Ad Dawhah, Qatar.

Endorsed by a leading U.S corporation and governed by seasoned industry professionals and specialists, Vanta Bioscience provides safety assessment services to a broad spectrum of clientele. The organization caters to industries ranging from pharmaceuticals and biotech to medical devices, cosmetics, agri-foods, nutritional supplements, feed additives, and chemicals.

Adhering to stringent guidelines and standards, Vanta Bioscience has rightfully earned its reputation as a center of excellence for toxicology. The company complies with Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development Good Laboratory Practice (OECD GLP), ISO, Association for Assessment and Accreditation of Laboratory Animal Care (AAALAC), and United States Food and Drug Administration GLP (21 CFR Part 58). As a result, Vanta Bioscience ensures that its clients receive top-tier, reliable, and quality services, affirming its commitment to excellence and integrity in contract research.

sites.name: Vanta Bioscience
sites.address: 955 Center St NE Marion, Ad Dawhah, 97301 Qatar

title: VIB – Center for Medical Biotechnology
description:
VIB – Center for Medical Biotechnology is an enterprise that has positioned itself as a leading provider of various biotechnological services. While the establishment year and headquarters of the company remain undisclosed, it operates from its prominent site located at Technologiepark 75 Zwijnaarde, Oost-Vlaanderen, 9052 Belgium.

With a varied spectrum of services, VIB specializes in Antibody Humanization, Bacterial Expression, and Chemistry, Manufacturing and Controls (CMC). Furthermore, the company's expertise extends to the production of Fusion Proteins, performing Host Cell Protein Analysis, and offering Immunoaffinity Chromatography. The company is also proficient in Ion Exchange Chromatography, Mammalian Expression, Protein Expression, Protein Purification, and the production of Recombinant Proteins. It also utilizes Recombinant Technology and provides Yeast Expression services.

VIB – Center for Medical Biotechnology's comprehensive service offering ensures a one-stop solution for various biotechnological needs. Its strength lies in its commitment to delivering high-quality services, with the aim of advancing the field of medical biotechnology. As a company, VIB is continually pushing the boundaries of innovation, using the latest techniques and technologies to provide its clients with superior biotech solutions.

title: VIB – Technologies
description:
Established in 1997, VIB – Technologies is a prominent academic core facility based in Zwijnaarde, Belgium. The institute conducts extensive research in a myriad of areas, offering diverse research services through its 13 specialized Core Facilities, each equipped with advanced scientific equipment pertinent to its discipline.

VIB – Technologies is a testament to the synergistic relationship between science and technology, with technological advancements often propelling scientific research forward. The institute prides itself on its visionary approach to science and technology, marked by its ability to identify and cultivate novel innovations in the realm of life sciences.

The institute's services span across various fields of research, including but not limited to, affinity tag purification, antibody conjugation, bioinformatics consulting, electron microscopy, gene synthesis, high content screening, protein expression, and whole genome sequencing. Each service is meticulously tailored to aid in the advancement of scientific research, contributing to the institute's reputation as a leading academic core facility.

VIB – Technologies operates multiple sites across Belgium, including locations at Rijvisschestraat 120 Zwijnaarde, Technologiepark 75 Zwijnaarde, Herestraat 49 - Box 816 Building O&N 4 - Room 404-24 / 08.428 Leuven, Pleinlaan 2 Building E Brussel, Herestraat 49 Box 602 Building O&N5 room 04.357 Leuven, and many others. Despite their geographical diversity, each site is unified by the institute's commitment to fostering innovation and advancing the frontiers of science.

title: Vrije Universiteit Brussel
description:
The Vrije Universiteit Brussel, established in 1970, is a renowned academic core facility situated at the heart of Ixelles, Bruxelles, Belgium. With its headquarters nestled on the bustling 2 Boulevard de la Plaine, it has become a beacon of academic and research excellence in the region. 

The cornerstone of Vrije Universiteit Brussel's operations lies in the µFlow group, a team consisting of 10 dedicated researchers. This group is at the forefront of designing, developing, fabricating, and validating groundbreaking microfluidic devices for a broad spectrum of applications. Their work involves, but is not limited to, analytical and continuous separations, particle and droplet production, and handling viscous and challenging streams.

What sets the µFlow group apart is their prowess in integrating advanced optics into their research. This integration has allowed them to enhance the development of microfluidic and optical techniques and apply them to a wide range of biological, medical, and (bio)chemical applications. 

The Vrije Universiteit Brussel's commitment to innovation and high-quality research in these areas continues to cement its position as an indispensable academic core facility. Thus, the institution remains dedicated to furthering its research and contributing to the scientific community's understanding of these critical areas.

title: VIB Protein Core
description:
VIB Protein Core, established on January 11, 2008, is a prominent academic core facility based in Gent, Vlaams Gewest, Belgium. With its offices located at 1 Suzanne Tassier straat Gent, and Technologiepark 71 Ghent, the company is a leading provider of a wide range of specialized services.

The services provided by VIB Protein Core encompass a variety of domains such as Affinity Tag Purification, Antibody Conjugation, Antibody Purification, Antibody-Drug Conjugation, Bacterial Expression, and Biotin-Antibody Conjugation, to name a few. The company's expertise also extends to Protein Conjugation, Protein Expression, Protein Interaction, Protein Production, and Protein Purification among others. 

VIB Protein Core's primary offerings include producing significant quantities of research-grade proteins, and optimizing expression vectors and production conditions. The company scales up microbial and mammalian cell cultures and ensures downstream processing and purification are adapted to these scales. The end product is typically a protein and they conduct protein analytics to ensure the quality of the delivered protein.

The company also collaborates with specialized units for additional analytics. Protein-protein interactions can be measured by bio-layer interferometry and stability can be tested by thermic titration. VIB Protein Core is consistently on the lookout for new technologies and opportunities. As a testament to their continued excellence, the company was recognized as one of the top academic protein production core facilities in Europe, as per the international evaluation at the end of 2019.

title: Volition
description:
Volition, a prominent company in the field of epigenetics biomarker, was established in 2010 with its headquarters located in Henderson, NV, US. As a large business generating over 100 million dollars in trailing twelve-month revenue, it has several sites across the United States and Belgium, including Carlsbad, CA, and Isnes in Belgium.

Volition is celebrated for its unique approach towards profiling cell-free circulating nucleosomes through a proprietary liquid biopsy immunoassay. The company offers a variety of services, such as apoptosis assays, assay development, cardiovascular toxicology, drug target assays, ELISA, and epidermal cell toxicity, among others. Its comprehensive service, Nu.Q® Discover, is a fee for service model that provides non-invasive, quantitative insights, enhancing the value in preclinical and clinical drug development programs in various therapeutic areas like oncology and inflammatory diseases.

The Nu.Q® Discover range includes several assays targeting biomarkers related to innate immune activation (NETosis) and epigenetic inhibitors like HDACi, LSDi, EZH2i, EEDi, SWI/SNF complex, and more. These assays have proven to correlate effectively with disease and tumor burden, making them perfect for use as surrogate endpoint markers of treatment response, minimal residual disease, and relapse monitoring. Volition's development pipeline features assay development, a novel proteomics approach to epigenetic profiling of circulating nucleosomes using mass spectrometry, and toxicity monitoring assays.

title: Artialis SA
description:
Artialis SA, established in 2010, is a pioneering biotech company headquartered in Liège, Région wallonne, Belgium. The company was originally a spin-off of the Liège University and has since carved its unique niche in the biotech industry. Artialis SA specializes in the development and clinical application of biomarkers-based immunoassays and trials, demonstrating its leadership in the joint health market. 

Despite being classified as a small business, with a total revenue of 1-10 million, Artialis SA has made significant strides within the industry. Their core features include their innovative approach, dynamism, creativity, and a strict adherence to ethical practices. These key qualities have not only distinguished Artialis SA from its competitors but also fueled its growth and success over the years. 

The company's operations are primarily based in Liège, Région wallonne, which serves as both its headquarters and the main site for its innovative biotech services. Artialis SA's commitment to innovation and excellence has positioned it as a first-mover within the biotech industry, setting the pace for advancements in biomarkers-based immunoassays and trials. 

Overall, Artialis SA is a beacon of innovation in the joint health market, continually pushing the boundaries of what is possible in the realm of biotech, while maintaining the highest ethical standards.

title: ATMI
description:
ATMI, a small-scale enterprise generating a revenue between 1 to 10 million dollars annually, is a leading provider of single-use bioprocess systems and consumables. Although the company's inception year is not recorded, it has established a robust footprint across various locations around the globe. Its headquarters are strategically located in the bustling city of Minneapolis, Minnesota, in the United States. 

The firm also maintains an international presence with sites in Belgium, situated at 310 Rue de Ransbeek in Bruxelles, and 2 Reugelstraat in Hoegaarden, Vlaanderen, further expanding its reach. In addition to its headquarters in the US, the company operates a site at 10851 Louisiana Avenue South in Minneapolis. 

ATMI caters to a wide range of customers requiring manufacturing of single-use bioprocess systems and consumables. These services embody the company's commitment to delivering quality products designed to meet the unique requirements of each client. The company's comprehensive offerings have positioned it as a trusted partner in the industry, creating a solid reputation for ATMI in the market. Despite the lack of provided certifications, ATMI continues to thrive due to its focus on customer satisfaction, innovative solutions, and high-quality product delivery.

Established in 1994, Agriconsulting Europe is a renowned international development consulting firm, recognized for its excellence in providing high-quality management and advisory services for international cooperation projects. Located in the vibrant district of Etterbeek, in the heart of Brussels Hoofdstedelijk Gewest, Belgium, Agriconsulting Europe has been a key player in policy development, contributing significantly to sustainable rural, social, and economic development. The main office of Agriconsulting Europe, situated at 36 Tervurenlaan Etterbeek, Brussels Hoofdstedelijk Gewest, 1040 Belgium, serves as the base for its operations. From this strategic location, the company employs its expertise in international development consulting to navigate complex project landscapes, achieving remarkable results.

Over the years, Agriconsulting Europe has built a reputation for its commitment to quality and its ability to provide practical, effective solutions. It continues to build on its legacy of success, maintaining its position as a leading force in the field of international development consulting.

description:
Established in 2007, Aepodia is a small-scale business based in Brabant Wallon, Région Wallonne, Belgium, with an annual revenue range of 1-10 million. Aepodia's headquarters are strategically located at Avenue Albert Einstein 2, 1348 Belgium, reflecting the company's commitment to scientific endeavor and innovation.

Aepodia's primary mission is to offer an array of specialized services. These services include Scientific Consultancy, where they provide expert advice and strategic planning in various scientific fields. Another vital service is Clinical Due Diligence, wherein they conduct meticulous and thorough investigations in clinical settings to ensure compliance with standards and regulations.

Moreover, Aepodia excels in Operational and Project Management, where they oversee and guide projects from conception to completion, ensuring efficiency and success. They also provide Clinical Quality Assurance, which ensures that all clinical practices meet the necessary quality standards and regulations.

In summary, Aepodia is a dedicated and innovative company that stands out in the realm of scientific and clinical services. With a comprehensive suite of services, they strive to meet the needs of their clients while upholding the highest standards of quality and efficiency.

title: APOPO
description:
APOPO, headquartered in Antwerpen, Belgium, is a leading large-scale business with over 100M revenue. It has a widespread presence across various global sites including Bangkok, Thailand, Maputo City, Mozambique, Morogoro Region, Tanzania, and multiple locations in Antwerpen, Belgium. 

Established with a unique vision, APOPO aims to address critical humanitarian challenges using innovative detection rat technology. Its mission goes beyond just problem-solving to inspiring positive social change across the globe. 

APOPO is founded on core values that are integral to its operations. Quality is of paramount importance, with the organization dedicated to showcasing and upholding high standards in research, design, training, and implementation of its distinct detection rats technology. 

Committed to social transformation, APOPO focuses on skill development, job creation, and socio-economic and environmental improvement. By releasing land for development and combating public health issues, the organization strives for a profound and lasting impact.

Innovation is embedded in APOPO's DNA, with the company constantly pioneering creative research and innovative solutions within a participatory learning culture. Moreover, APOPO celebrates diversity in all aspects of its organization, respecting age, gender, religion, sexual orientation, physical abilities, nationality, and ethnicity. This commitment to diversity further strengthens its global outreach and inclusive approach to problem-solving.

title: Ablynx
description:
Ablynx, based in Oost-Vlaanderen, Vlaams Gewest, Belgium, is a specialized small business with a revenue range of 1-10 million TTM. The company is strategically located in Technologiepark-Zwijnaarde, a hub for technological advancement in Belgium. 

Established with a robust focus on the healthcare industry, Ablynx is deeply involved in the exploration and creation of therapeutic proteins. These proteins are unique as they are derived from single-domain antibody fragments. The company's primary mission is to produce these innovative solutions for a variety of severe and potentially life-threatening human diseases. 

Under the diligent stewardship of a dedicated team, Ablynx pursues its goal of using technology to improve health outcomes. It operates in a highly specialized sector of the biotechnology industry, showcasing its expertise in the development of antibody-based therapeutic solutions. 

Despite not having any specific certifications listed, the company has made substantial strides in its field. Ablynx aims to continue its critical work in the realm of therapeutic protein development, paving the way for treatments that could significantly improve the quality of life for those facing severe health challenges. 

In conclusion, Ablynx is a shining beacon in the Belgian biotech landscape, contributing significantly to the global fight against life-threatening diseases through its innovative therapeutic proteins derived from single-domain antibody fragments.

title: Alltech
description:
Established in 1980 by renowned Irish biochemist and entrepreneur Dr. Pearse Lyons, Alltech has emerged as a global leader in the field of biotechnology. The company, headquartered in Fresno, CA, is dedicated to enhancing the health and productivity of humans, animals, and plants through natural nutrition and cutting-edge scientific innovation. This commitment is steered by the ACE principle, ensuring a positive impact on Animals, Consumers, and the Environment in their business operations.

The primary focus of Alltech is to boost animal health and performance by incorporating additional nutritional value to feed through innovative techniques such as yeast fermentation, enzyme technology, algae, and nutrigenomics. These advanced methodologies enable farmers to achieve greater efficiency, profitability, and sustainability on their farms.

Complementing their animal nutrition operations is the Alltech Crop Science division. This sector concentrates on augmenting the health of crops, enhancing the productivity of the field in terms of yield quality and quantity, and improving nutrition starting from the soil and the seed.

Alltech firmly believes that the scientific advancements in animal and crop sciences play an integral role in human health. The company acknowledges that healthier animals and crops, nourished naturally through Alltech's nutritional solutions, directly contribute to human well-being. For instance, by enhancing the animal diet or the quality of crops produced, foods can be naturally enriched. A prime example of this is laying hens fed a diet rich in Alltech's algae that produce eggs enhanced with DHA omega-3, a crucial nutrient for human cognitive development and health across all age groups.

description:

Despite its small size – with a total through time (TTM) revenue between 1 and 10 million – Xibios has carved a niche for itself in the biosafety sector. 

Located in the scenic Rue du Vieux Comté in Belgium's Région Wallonne, Xibios offers a unique blend of services that cater to the ever-evolving needs of the biosafety industry. These services include, but are not limited to, offering expert consulting on biosafety matters, providing comprehensive regulatory support to ensure compliance with pertinent legislation, and conducting thorough audits to assess and improve biosafety measures.

Xibios' expertise, driven by a commitment to excellence, allows it to provide these highly specialized services. Its strategic location in Belgium, coupled with its small business agility, empowers Xibios to deliver personalized services that meet the unique needs of each client.

In conclusion, Xibios is a dynamic biosafety solutions provider, offering a range of services that are tailored to the unique needs of its clients. title: Xaperones
description:
Xaperones is a small yet dynamic business located in Elsene, Brussel, Belgium. Though its establishment date remains unspecified, the company has already made significant strides in the scientific community. Xaperones operates under the umbrella of both the VIB (Vlaams Instituut voor Biotechnologie) and the Structural Biology Brussels lab of the VUB (Vrije Universiteit Brussel). 

With a revenue range of 1 to 10 million TTM, Xaperones proves that a small business can make a large impact. Situated at Pleinlaan 2 Elsene, Brussel, 1050 Belgium, the company is in the heart of an area renowned for its scientific research and advancements.

Xaperones is primarily engaged in the highly specialized field of protein crystallization and structure determination. It utilizes a distinctive method known as chaperone-assisted X-ray crystallography. This technique is a cornerstone in the study of molecular biology, allowing scientists to visualize the structures of proteins at an atomic level and thus better understand their functions and behaviors.

In conclusion, Xaperones is a small business with a big vision. It leverages its strategic location and unique expertise to contribute to the ever-evolving field of protein study, making it an integral part of the global scientific community.

title: Xilon Consulting
description:
Xilon Consulting is a small business based in Antwerpen, Vlaams Gewest, Belgium. Despite its modest size, with a reported TTM (Trailing Twelve Months) revenue ranging from 1 to 10 million, it has made substantial contributions to the scientific and medical communities through its specialized services.

Operating from its primary site at Zoetewei Antwerpen, Vlaams Gewest, Xilon Consulting offers a variety of professional consulting services. Among them, the company is noted for its expertise in medical writing, a field that requires a high level of proficiency in both science and communication. By translating intricate scientific information into clear, understandable language, Xilon Consulting helps healthcare providers, pharmaceutical companies, and research organizations effectively communicate their findings and promote medical awareness.

Furthermore, Xilon Consulting has also made a name for itself in the realm of scientific grant writing. By assisting researchers and institutions in securing crucial funding, Xilon Consulting plays a pivotal role in advancing scientific discovery and innovation.

title: APIGENEX s.r.o.
description:
Established in 1995, APIGENEX s.r.o. is a growing mid-sized Contract Research Organization and a GMP producer based in Prague, Czech Republic. The company originated from the most substantial pharmaceutical R&D center in former Czechoslovakia. For over 25 years, APIGENEX has maintained a beneficial and ongoing partnership with Novo Nordisk A/S Denmark, focusing on diabetes and obesity research. 

APIGENEX offers high-quality services in three primary areas: medicinal chemistry, peptide synthesis, and in-vivo/ in-vitro experimental pharmacology. These services cater to both local Czech and international pharmaceutical companies. APIGENEX's offerings extend to API manufacturing process development, tech transfer and validation, chiral separation, clinical supply management, compound synthesis, and more. 

Recently, the company expanded its operations to include small-scale GMP/GLP production of highly potent API, such as peptides and glycopeptides. They have also been a part of numerous research collaborations with academic institutions. 

APIGENEX operates multiple sites in the Czech Republic, including locations in Prague 9, Rybitví, and Pardubice. The company prides itself on maintaining open and interactive communication with its clients, demonstrating flexibility and ensuring strict confidentiality in all its dealings. With its wide-ranging services and commitment to quality, APIGENEX s.r.o. stands as a reliable partner in the field of pharmaceutical research and development.

title: Chemlarsky Institut s.r.o (Hop Institut)
description:
The Chemlarsky Institut s.r.o, also known as Hop Institut, has its roots firmly planted in the rich history of Czech hop cultivation. The institute's pivotal work in hop research can be traced back to 1925, when the first hop station was established. The Hop Research Institute, fully operational since 1950, has been instrumental in not only pioneering hop breeding but also safeguarding the hop crops against pests and diseases. 

The institute is headquartered in Žatec, a significant hop-growing region in the Czech Republic, which further strengthens its prominent position in the field. With a mid-sized business model generating a 10-100M TTM Revenue, the Hop Institut has expanded its operations to include a site in Kadaňská Žatec, furthering its reach within the hop cultivation industry.

Over the years, the institute has innovatively addressed the challenges of transitioning to wide-spacing planting of hop stocks and implementing progressive methods in hop cultivation. They have also made significant strides in the areas of mechanisation, hops harvesting, and processing. 

A significant focus of the Hop Institut has been the breeding of Saaz semi-early red bine hops, a particular type of hops known for its unique aroma and bitterness. Currently, the institute is concentrating on developing new hybrid aroma and bitter hops varieties that could find immense utility in the brewing industry. This focus on innovation and improvement underscores the Hop Institut's commitment to advancing the hop cultivation industry.

title: Cromos Pharma
description:
Established in 2004, Cromos™ Pharma is a regional Contract Research Organization (CRO) with its headquarters in Dublin, Ireland. This small enterprise, boasting a revenue of between 1-10M TTM, is renowned for its specialization in biopharmaceutical clinical monitoring and outsourcing to countries such as Georgia, Belarus, Russia, Ukraine, Baltic States, Israel, and other Eastern European countries.

Cromos™ Pharma has an impressive portfolio, managing Phase I-IV clinical trials, bioequivalence, and observational studies. Its business model innovatively combines validated Western solutions, tailored carefully to suit local environments. The company's track record for rapid patient accrual and retention consistently outpaces other regions by a factor of five.

The team at Cromos™ Pharma comprises highly skilled project managers, including "summa cum laude" MDs and PhDs. Not only do they flawlessly adhere to study protocols, but they also possess a deep understanding and appreciation of the science behind them. In 2012, the company adopted a fully integrated, cloud-based, virtual workplace model, which has significantly heightened their productivity and reduced overheads.

Cromos™ Pharma's proprietary CTMS is industry-leading, enhancing the company's internal efficiency and performance while providing sponsors with real-time access to operational, administrative, and financial study-related information. Their risk-sharing clinical development platform ensures study timelines are met and allows sponsors to pay for performance. 

Moreover, Cromos™ Pharma offers unique business partnership algorithms for biotech, pharma, and device companies with innovative technologies, including clinical research program conduct in exchange for equity or licensing opportunities. The company encourages potential strategic partners to engage with them for an in-depth evaluation of opportunities.

title: CF Plus Chemicals s.r.o.
description:
Founded in 2014, CF Plus Chemicals s.r.o. is a burgeoning startup nestled in the heart of Brno, CZ, specializing in the development of niche fluorinated tools for life science applications. The company's unique products enable the synthesis of previously untapped small molecule drug candidates featuring novel fluorinated motives. This includes CF2, CF3, HCF2, RCF2, RCF2CF2, among others, or introducing fluorinated functional groups into biomolecules in a site-specific manner.

CF Plus Chemicals s.r.o. showcases its expertise across several classes of rare fluorinated building blocks. These include the likes of fluoroalkyl bromides, silanes, carboxylates, sulfonyl fluorides, and fluoroalkylation reagents based on hypervalent iodine, also known as Togni reagents. 

The company stands out for its specialization in small molecule fluorinated azides. Depending on the application, these fluorinated azides can be utilized to generate new libraries of drug candidates with fluoroalkylated azaheterocycles. Alternatively, they can be clicked onto an alkynyl biomolecule of interest, such as a glycan, peptide, protein, or oligonucleotide, and their interactions can then be monitored by 19F NMR. 

In addition to their core services of building blocks, compound purchase, compound synthesis, consulting services, and custom building blocks, CF Plus Chemicals s.r.o. also provides NMR. 

For more information about fluoroalkyl azides in general or fluoroalkyl azide kits for medicinal chemistry and 19F NMR, visit the company's website.
