title: EKOVIN
description:
EKOVIN, a small-scale business headquartered in the Czech Republic, was officially recognized as EKOVÍN during the General Assembly of the Association of Integrated Production of Grapes and Wine (SIPHV) at the Brno Vinex trade fair on March 4, 2009. This change marked the association's expanded focus, encompassing not only integrated production but also organic grape and wine production. EKOVIN's mission is to unite, coordinate, and protect the interests of individuals and entities devoted to these environmentally friendly production methods.

EKOVIN is keen on promoting innovative, eco-friendly technologies, viewing mastery of integrated production systems as a stepping stone to a fully ecological approach. The association's influence is evident in the increasing number of registered biovinic vineyards. Currently, approximately 63% of all vineyards in the Czech Republic, spanning around 12,000 hectares, operate in the integrated production system. With the rising interest in sustainable agriculture, this figure is expected to grow by about 400 hectares in 2009.

EKOVIN has collaborated with the Ministry of Agriculture (MoA), successfully advocating for measures that support integrated and organic production in vineyards and orchards under the Rural Development initiative. This collaboration has significantly boosted greening efforts, landscape development, and competitiveness in these sectors.

Despite the change from SIPHV to EKOVIN, the association continues its 15-year tradition of professional seminars, tours, training, and conferences. It also anticipates increased project activities, both regional and cross-border (in Slovakia and Austria), aimed at enhancing competitiveness and knowledge among its members.

title: Eyen SE
description:
Eyen SE, a privately-owned Contract Research Organization, was founded in 2013 and is headquartered in Brno, Czech Republic. This small business generates between $1-10M in TTM revenue and is known for its specialization in industrial Cryo-EM structure determination services. Eyen SE primarily serves pharmaceutical and biotechnological companies.

Operating from the Martin Polak Studentska 2 Brno site, Eyen SE offers an array of services that include Atomic Force Microscopy, Chemistry, Manufacturing and Controls (CMC), Computed Tomography, Cryo Electron Microscopy, Data and Text Mining, Electron Microscopy, Positron Emission Tomography (PET) Imaging, Protein Structure, Protein Tomography, Scanning and Transmission Electron Microscopy, Software Tools, and X-ray Microscopy and Nanotomography (Nano-CT).

A key aspect of Eyen SE's value proposition is its ability to accelerate structure-based drug design efforts. The company achieves this by providing quick and risk-free ways to access experimental atomic ligand-binding data. In addition to its main services, Eyen SE also actively engages in research and development activities. Through these efforts, and in collaboration with its partners, Eyen SE continuously expands its industry-leading library of ready-made targets for structural studies. This commitment to innovation and its suite of comprehensive services make Eyen SE a significant player in the industry.

Kokiche is a small-scale business specializing in conducting clinical drug trials ranging from phases I to IV. Originating from the heart of Europe, the company has its headquarters in Praha, Hlavní město Praha, CZ. While the exact year of its establishment remains undisclosed, Kokiche has carved a niche for itself in the biomedical industry, demonstrating a strong revenue stream in the $1-10M TTM range. 

Boasting an impressive geographic reach, Kokiche operates multiple sites in the Eastern European region. Notably, it has a significant presence in Rakovského Praha, Hlavní město Praha, 143 00 Czech Republic, and Sofia, Sofia City Province, Bulgaria. This extensive footprint allows the company to efficiently manage and execute clinical trials across different demographic and patient populations. 

Kokiche's primary services revolve around the vital process of clinical drug trials. The company's expertise spans across all phases of these trials, from early stage testing (phase I) to post-marketing surveillance (phase IV). This comprehensive service offering positions Kokiche as a key player in the biomedical field, contributing to the development and approval of new drugs and treatments in the Eastern European region.

The company specializes in an innovative field known as Lentikats Biotechnology. This distinctive method has positioned LentiKat's as a unique player in the biotechnology industry.

Despite its small size, LentiKat's has made a significant impact in its sector, leveraging this original technology to create a niche for itself in the market. With its focus on Lentikats Biotechnology, LentiKat's continues to be a pioneer in its field, pushing boundaries and exploring new possibilities in biotechnology.

title: Liquilabs
description:
Liquilabs, established in 2023, is a small business nestled in the picturesque town of Mníšek pod Brdy, Czech Republic. Despite its modest size, boasting a turnover between 1 to 10 million dollars, Liquilabs has made a significant impact in the scientific community with its state-of-the-art facilities both in Mníšek pod Brdy and the bustling city of Prague. 

Liquilabs is distinguished for its comprehensive range of laboratory services, specializing in a variety of testing and analysis methods. These services include Amino Acid Analysis (AAA), Animal Feed Analysis, Carbohydrate Testing, Headspace Gas Chromatography, Ion Exchange Chromatography, Lipolysis, Liquid Chromatography, Protein Separation and Detection, Size Exclusion Chromatography, and Vitamins Analysis.

The company is also renowned for its expertise in liquid and gas chromatography, as well as its prowess in UV/VIS and FTIR spectroscopy, which further elevates its status in the scientific industry. Liquilabs' commitment to delivering meticulous and accurate results has cemented its reputation as a reliable and trusted source in the field of laboratory services. With its robust service portfolio and dedicated team, Liquilabs continues to be a key player in advancing scientific research and innovation.

title: MolCode
description:
Established in the scenic locale of Tuř, Královéhradecký, CZ, MolCode is a small business with a significant role in the scientific community. Despite its size, the company generates a commendable annual revenue ranging between 1-10 million dollars. At its two sites located in Tuř, Královéhradecký, 506 01 Czech Republic, MolCode is dedicated to providing a diverse range of services that contribute to advancements in the scientific and pharmaceutical sectors.

Their extensive offerings include predictive Quantitative Structure-Activity Relationship (QSAR) services, an essential tool in the drug design process. By utilizing QSAR, MolCode aids in predicting the biological activity of compounds, thus streamlining the drug discovery process. The company's expertise extends to molecular design, a field that combines computational chemistry and graphics to facilitate the visualization and analysis of molecular structures. 

In addition, MolCode is involved in hit identification, a critical process in drug discovery where potential compounds that may have the desired biological activity are identified. Following this, they undertake hit to lead development, refining these compounds to improve efficiency and reduce toxicity. Lastly, MolCode offers lead optimization services, fine-tuning these leads to maximize their potential as viable drug candidates.

In summary, MolCode is a small yet influential business, employing cutting-edge technology and scientific approaches to contribute significantly to the drug discovery process.

title: NEOX Clinical Research
description:
Established in 2004, NEOX Clinical Research is a privately owned full-service clinical CRO (Contract Research Organization) that caters to pharmaceutical, biotechnology, and medical device companies, as well as other CROs across Europe and the US. Despite being a small business with 1-10M TTM Revenue, NEOX offers a wide array of services that can be availed either as a comprehensive package or as individual tailored solutions, depending on the specific needs of the client. 

The company's core services include drug development, medical device development, pharmacovigilance & regulatory, real-world evidence/data & HEOR, and data management & biostatistics. Aspects of drug development encompass medical writing, site contracting, clinical monitoring, project management, pharmacovigilance, regulatory, medical monitoring, and outsourcing.

Headquartered in Praha, Hlavní město Praha, CZ, NEOX Clinical Research has offices in California, Germany, Poland, Hungary, Bulgaria, Slovakia, and Romania. The company also has operational sites in Austria, Belgium, Estonia, France, Finland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Netherlands, Spain, the United Kingdom, and more. 

With years of clinical research experience, a deep understanding of local requirements, and established relationships with investigators, NEOX Clinical Research can ensure optimal settings for high patient enrollment and efficient trial execution. This blend of experience and adaptability sets the company apart in the field of clinical research.

OSEVA PRO S.R.O. primarily serves clients within the Czech Republic but also maintains robust trade relationships with international partners. The company's seed multiplication and trading activities encompass both foreign varieties represented in the Czech Republic and promising varieties from Czech breeding companies. 

In addition to these services, OSEVA PRO S.R.O. operates two workplaces, both of which are actively involved in scientific grants. These grants are particularly focused on the development and breeding of fodder and oil-bearing crops. They also support the breeding of new materials and the maintenance of already listed varieties. By consistently evolving and improving their product range, OSEVA PRO S.R.O. continues to make significant contributions to the agricultural sector.

title: PsychoGenics
description:
PsychoGenics, established in 1999, is a mid-sized business situated in Paramus, NJ, US, with an additional site in the Czech Republic. As a leader in preclinical Contract Research Organization (CRO) operations, the company specializes in Central Nervous System (CNS) and orphan disorders. 

PsychoGenics is renowned for their innovative, translational approach to research, offering tailored solutions designed to help clients validate the efficacy of their treatments before clinical application. It possesses an extensive portfolio of highly predictive disease models, enabling biopharmaceutical companies of all sizes to offer superior clinical candidates to patients.

The company's broad range of capabilities includes behavioral testing, electrophysiology, translational EEG, quantitative histology, molecular biology, and microdialysis. It also offers a range of validated mouse models, supporting research in fields such as Alzheimer's disease, Huntington's disease, Parkinson's disease, autism spectrum disorders, psychosis and schizophrenia, spinal muscular atrophy, muscular dystrophy, and a broad array of pain models.

PsychoGenics also provides a comprehensive array of services, from absorption studies and assay development to biomarker discovery and digital pathology. Its expertise also covers inflammation models, machine learning/AI, neuroscience models, pain model consulting, and protein bioanalysis, among others.

The company holds several certifications, including the Assessment and Accreditation of Laboratory Animal Care (AAALAC), Biosafety Levels 1 and 2 (BSL 1 & 2), the Self-Certification for Enhancing Quality in Preclinical Data (EQIPD), and the Office of Laboratory Animal Welfare (OLAW). This mid-sized business continues to pave the way in preclinical research, delivering solutions that are both effective and innovative.

sites.name: PsychoGenics, Inc.
sites.address: 215 College Rd Paramus, NJ, 07652 United States

title: Quinta-Analytica
description:
Quinta-Analytica, a small-scale enterprise nestled in the heart of Praha, Hlavní město Praha, CZ, is a stalwart provider in the realm of pharmaceutical and biopharmaceutical analysis. Despite its modest size, with an annual turnover of 1 to 10 million TTM revenue, the company has carved a niche for itself in the competitive pharmaceutical sector.

Established in the scenic locale of Pražská 1486/18c Praha, Hlavní město Praha, 102 00 Czech Republic, Quinta-Analytica has not disclosed its establishment year, yet its impactful presence in the market speaks volumes about its experience and proficiency.

At the heart of Quinta-Analytica's operations is the provision of an array of services, chief among which are pharmaceutical analysis, biopharmaceutical analysis, and bioanalysis. These services reflect the company's commitment to excellence and its relentless pursuit of fostering innovation in the field of pharmaceuticals.

Although Quinta-Analytica refrains from sharing its certifications, the quality of its work and its unwavering dedication to delivering top-notch services have positioned it as a trusted name in the industry. Overall, Quinta-Analytica remains a robust and versatile player in the pharmaceutical sector, continuing to shape the future of pharmaceutical and biopharmaceutical analysis.

title: RihaChem
description:
RihaChem is a niche producer of fine chemicals, primarily dealing in the manufacture of building-block compounds. With an emphasis on pyrazines and pyridines, the company has carved a unique space for itself in the ever-evolving chemical industry. Despite no official year of establishment, the small business has managed to generate a total trailing twelve-month (TTM) revenue between 1 and 10 million dollars, demonstrating its steady growth and promising potential. 

The headquarters of RihaChem is nestled in the heart of Prague, Czech Republic. Specifically, it operates from its site located at 107 Lipová alej, 154 00 Prague. This strategic location serves as a testament to the company's commitment to maintaining its European roots while reaching out to a global customer base. 

As a small business, RihaChem's primary strength lies in its ability to focus on a specialized product range. The company's expertise in the production of pyrazines and pyridines makes it a valuable player in the fine chemicals industry. 

In conclusion, RihaChem is a dynamic and focused company that has successfully established itself as a reliable provider of fine chemicals. Its significant revenue and strategic location in Prague demonstrate the company's potential for continued growth and success in the industry. The company remains committed to its specializations in pyrazines and pyridines, making it stand out amongst its competitors.

title: Rosenpharma
description:
Rosenpharma is a thriving small-scale enterprise renowned for its exceptional work in the development and production of natural healing products. The company has uniquely positioned itself as a champion in the fight against lifestyle diseases, dedicating significant resources to the prevention and cure of such ailments. Incorporated at an unspecified time, the firm has grown significantly, with its annual TTM revenue currently estimated to be between 1-10 million dollars.

This dynamic business operates from its headquarters situated in the beautiful city of Prague, CZ, providing services from 11 Levá Prague, 147 00 Czech Republic. Despite its modest size, Rosenpharma has gained a reputation as an industry trailblazer, leveraging its small team's innovative spirit to make a significant impact in the health sector.

While Rosenpharma lacks specific certifications, its commitment to quality and effectiveness is unquestionable, as evidenced by its robust product portfolio. The company's unique focus on natural healing products and lifestyle disease prevention sets it apart in the pharmaceutical industry, underscoring its commitment to improve public health. 

Indeed, Rosenpharma's impressive track record is a testament to its unwavering dedication to fostering health and well-being through its natural healing products. By focusing on the prevention and cure of lifestyle diseases, Rosenpharma not only addresses an important niche in the healthcare sector but also contributes significantly to enhancing the quality of life for its clientele worldwide.

title: Rigaku
description:
Rigaku, a prominent business entity established in 1951, is based in Neu-Isenburg, Germany, with additional sites in Tokyo, Japan, and The Woodlands, Texas, United States. As a large-scale business with over 100 million TTM Revenue, Rigaku holds a commanding position in the global market.

Rigaku's services are geared towards electron diffraction crystallography, a niche market where the company has carved out a substantial presence. Besides its exclusive focus on electron diffraction crystallography, Rigaku also boasts an impressive array of services that include Chemistry, Manufacturing and Controls (CMC), Electron Diffraction Measurement (microED), Micro Electron Diffraction (MicroED), Structural Elucidation, Structure Determination, and X-Ray Crystallography.

Furthermore, Rigaku is a preeminent manufacturer of high-quality, state-of-the-art instruments utilized in various fields such as electron diffraction crystallography, x-ray crystallography, x-ray diffraction, x-ray spectrometry, semiconductor metrology, automation, and cryogenics. This diversified portfolio underscores Rigaku's commitment to innovation and excellence, making it a trusted name in the industry.

Rigaku's reputation for quality, reliability, and innovation stems from its decades of experience and expertise, further solidified by its commitment to customer satisfaction. The company's broad range of services and manufacturing capabilities ensure that it continues to lead the industry while meeting the ever-evolving needs of its global clientele.

title: Research Centre for Toxic Compounds in the Environment
description:
The Research Centre for Toxic Compounds in the Environment is a fresh startup, located in the heart of Czech Republic. Although a new arrival in the business sphere, it showcases a dynamic role as an autonomous department within the prestigious Faculty of Science at Masaryk University. 

The Centre specializes in a broad range of research and development, educational programmes, and expert activities, all of which are dedicated to the field of environmental contamination. It primarily focuses on the study of persistent organic pollutants (POPs), polar organic compounds, toxic metals and their species, along with natural toxins such as cyanotoxins.

The Centre's scientific endeavours are facilitated by twelve dedicated working groups, which collaborate under the umbrella of four unique research programmes. These include Environmental Chemistry and Modelling, Organic Photochemistry and Supramolecular Chemistry, Protein Engineering, and Ecotoxicology.

Supporting these research initiatives are advanced research infrastructures. Some of these essential facilities include a specialized Trace Laboratory, a GENASIS information system, and an ELSPAC database. These core assets enhance the Centre's ability to carry out its research programmes effectively and efficiently.

This startup, located at 5 Kamenice 625 00 Czech Republic, is not only tackling vital environmental issues but is also contributing to advancements in scientific research and education. Its unique blend of research, academia and development offers a promising future in the realm of environmental science.

sites.name: Research Centre for Toxic Compounds in the Environment
Research Centre for Toxic Compounds in the Environment

title: SynteractHCR
description:
Founded in 1995, SynteractHCR is a small-scale enterprise with a significant presence in the clinical research services sector. From its headquarters in San Diego, California, the company oversees operations across multiple international locations including Munich, Germany, Prague, Czech Republic, and Morrisville, North Carolina, along with additional sites in Carlsbad, California, and San Diego. 

As a leading provider in its field, SynteractHCR specializes in a wide range of services. These encompass project management, clinical operations, and data management, ensuring accurate and efficient processes in all stages of clinical research. The company also offers expert medical writing services, which supports clear and effective communication of research findings.

Additionally, SynteractHCR excels in site management, ensuring that all clinical trial sites are appropriately managed and adhere to necessary protocols. Their proficiency in biostatistics allows for precise data analysis, which is integral to the success of any clinical trial. The company also provides training services, allowing for the continuous professional development of individuals involved in clinical research.

Furthermore, SynteractHCR offers IVRS/IWRS services, enhancing the efficiency of patient randomization and supply management in clinical trials. Lastly, the company is well-equipped to handle medical and regulatory affairs, ensuring that all research is compliant with industry standards and regulations. 

In conclusion, SynteractHCR stands as a comprehensive solution for clinical research services, bringing together a wide array of specialized services under one roof.

title: Symeres
description:
Established in 1988, Symeres, previously known as MercachemSyncom, is a prominent mid-sized European contract research organization headquartered in Nijmegen, Netherlands. The company is renowned for its exceptional products, services, and unrivaled problem-solving abilities. Symeres provides a variety of services including Accelerated Stability, Antibody-Drug Conjugation, Blood Brain Barrier, Building Blocks, CYP Induction, and In Vivo Pharmacokinetics, among others, all aimed at streamlining the drug discovery and development process in an efficient and cost-effective manner.

The company's operations are spread across multiple sites, including Groningen and Weert in the Netherlands, Prague in the Czech Republic, Oulu in Finland, and Woburn, MA in the United States. They boast a team of approximately 500 experts, contributing to the company's reputation for high-quality services.

Symeres is the amalgamation of four leading European contract research organizations, offering integrated drug-discovery services from initial hit to clinical trials through various platform strategic alliances under a single Master Service Agreement (MSA). As a result, Symeres has become a trusted partner for numerous pharmaceutical and biotech companies worldwide.

Symeres prides itself on its Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP) certification, ensuring its commitment to producing safe and high-quality products. With its innovative chemistry, medicinal chemistry, ADME/tox, PK, early process research services, and GMP production, Symeres is at the forefront of accelerating the drug discovery and development process.

title: TATAA
description:
Established in 2001, TATAA Biocenter is a small-sized business headquartered in Göteborg, Sweden, with additional sites in the Czech Republic. As a Molecular Analysis Service Provider and a Bioanalytical Contract Research Organization (CRO), TATAA Biocenter specializes in a wide array of services, including but not limited to Amplicon 16s rRNA Sequencing, Assay Development and Consulting, Biomarker Discovery and Services, DNA/RNA Extraction & Purification, and Next Generation Sequencing (NGS). 

Their comprehensive workflow encompasses everything from study and assay design to assay validation and sample analysis. This includes procedures such as nucleic acid extraction, quality control, digital PCR, RNA-Seq/DNA-Seq, and data analysis. The company also offers a range of pharmacokinetic screening services for various species, including dogs, minipigs, monkeys, mice, rats, and others. 

TATAA Biocenter holds several prestigious certifications, including Biosafety Level 1 (BSL 1) and 2 (BSL 2), EcoVadis - Silver Scorecard, Good Clinical Laboratory Practice (GCLP), Good Laboratory Practice (GLP), and International Organization for Standards 17025 (ISO 17025). Their commitment to maintaining high standards of quality, safety, and excellence has earned them a reputable position in the biotechnology industry. Their diverse service offerings and commitment to quality service make TATAA Biocenter a trusted partner for bioanalytical projects requiring advanced molecular analysis techniques.

title: VUOS
description:
VUOS, established in 1941, is a pioneering enterprise based in Rybitví, Pardubice Region, Czech Republic. title: ZKUSEBNI STANICE TRUTNOV S.R.O.
description:
ZKUSEBNI STANICE TRUTNOV S.R.O. is a small business based in Trutnov, CZ, with a notable history dating back to its establishment in 1963. It began its journey as a varietal station of ÚKZÚZ Prague. The company underwent a significant transformation in 1984 when it was classified as a test station for identified land plant protection products, a service that has continued to expand over the years. 

In 1998, ZKUSEBNI STANICE TRUTNOV S.R.O. underwent privatization, resulting in a shift in its primary focus to pesticidal testing, leading to a gradual reduction in varietal testing. The company's current operations encompass not only experimental testing but also diagnostic and consulting services, highlighting its versatility and comprehensive approach to plant protection.

In 2004, ZKUSEBNI STANICE TRUTNOV S.R.O. earned the Certificate of GEP Eligibility, further establishing its credibility. This certification signifies its adherence to the principles of good experimental practice as stipulated under Law no. 326/2004 Coll. regarding plant health, as well as related amendments associated with Directive 91/414/EEC.

The company's site is located in Volanovská Trutnov, 541 01 Czech Republic, which serves as the base for its innovative operations in the field of plant protection. As a small business generating between 1-10M TTM revenue, ZKUSEBNI STANICE TRUTNOV S.R.O. continues to make a significant impact in its sector, combining decades of experience with a commitment to progressive practices.

title: ZEMEDELSKY VYZKUMNY USTAV KROMERIZ, S.R.O.
description:
Zemědělský Výzkumný Ústav Kroměříž, s.r.o., or the Agricultural Research Institute Kromeriz Ltd., is a specialized small business located in the Zlin Region of Kroměříž, Czech Republic. With no specific year of establishment, this unique institution focuses its efforts on the applied research within the agricultural sector. 

Their significant contribution to agricultural research lies in the systematic monitoring of the quality of food grains, including wheat, barley, and rye, a practice they have upheld since 2002. The quality of these grains is meticulously evaluated based on the standards applicable to each cereal. 

Annually, the Institute analyzes 500 wheat samples, 300 barley samples, and 50 rye samples. The number of analyzed samples varies across different regions and districts, based on the proportionality to the areas of cultivation. These samples, along with relevant cultivation information such as location, variety, previous crop, and manure, are sourced directly from growers immediately after harvest. 

As part of their collaborative approach, the Institute invites cereal growers to participate in their monitoring process. The growers who agree to participate send their samples for analysis and, in return, receive a complimentary report detailing the results of the analyses performed by an accredited laboratory. The Agricultural Research Institute Kromeriz, Ltd. is indeed an integral player in the agricultural sector, fostering quality control, collaborative research, and continuous improvement in the farming industry.

title: ATEM SD GmbH
description:
Established in 2021, ATEM SD GmbH is a compact yet dynamic business based in Remscheid, Germany, generating between 1-10 million in TTM revenue. Operating as a leading Contract Research Organization, this small enterprise specializes in Chemistry, Manufacturing and Controls (CMC), Cryo Electron Microscopy, Electron Microscopy, and Structure Determination.

ATEM SD GmbH prides itself on its state-of-the-art cryo-electron microscopy (cryo-EM) laboratory which is fully equipped with an integrated wet lab, a Talos L120 room temperature microscope, and a Glacios cryo-EM system featuring an advanced direct electron detector camera. The company also boasts an on-premises high-performance computational cluster. 

What sets ATEM SD GmbH apart is its expertise in handling every step of the process in-house, from sample preparation to result analysis, making it a highly integrated business model. The company is also leading the charge in developing proprietary Artificial Intelligence (AI) software for industrial applications in this specific field.

As a Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP) certified laboratory, ATEM SD GmbH ensures the utmost quality standards. The company offers diverse services such as cell line characterization and bulk harvest analysis, lipid-nano-particle characterization, and adeno-associated viral vector characterization. They also provide 3D structure epitope and paratope mapping, and 3D structure mode of action study.

ATEM SD GmbH visualization capabilities span across multiple modalities, including cells, nanoparticles, viruses and virus-like particles, and proteins. By leveraging its expertise and cutting-edge technology, ATEM SD GmbH is dedicated to furthering scientific understanding and contributing to the advancement of novel solutions in the field of structural biology.

title: ABX-CRO
description:
ABX-CRO is a small-scale business, generating between 1 to 10 million TTM revenue, that was established in the year 2002. It has its headquarters in Dresden, Sachsen, DE with a prominent site located at Blasewitzer Straße 78 Dresden, Sachsen, 01307 Germany. As a specialized provider in the medical field, ABX-CRO offers a comprehensive range of services that contribute significantly to the industry.

Among the services ABX-CRO renders are Positron Emission Tomography (PET) and Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) imaging services. These services are crucial in medical diagnostics, aiding in the detection and monitoring of various diseases and conditions. Moreover, the company provides kinetic modeling, a technique that allows the quantitative interpretation of data obtained from PET and MRI studies.

In addition to these services, ABX-CRO extends its expertise into receptor occupancy, a process that helps in determining the efficacy of drugs. Custom radiolabeling services are also offered by the company, a method employed to track the passage and interaction of drugs within biological systems.

Lastly, the company provides Pharmacokinetic/Pharmacodynamic (PK/PD) services, crucial in understanding the action of drugs in the body over a period of time. Through these services, ABX-CRO continues to significantly contribute to the medical field, offering specialized solutions that aid in disease detection, drug development, and overall patient care.

title: Ascenian
description:
Founded in 2018, Ascenian is a small yet dynamic business headquartered in Berlin, Germany. As a company generating a TTM Revenue of 1-10M, Ascenian stands out as a leading provider of strategic solutions in the healthcare sector. 

The company operates from two key sites; a vibrant office located at 38 Schlossstrasse in Berlin, Germany, and a strategic location at 1798 Trellis Circle in Webster, New York, United States. This global presence allows Ascenian to extend its services across Europe, the US, Asia, as well as covering Canada and Australia. 

Ascenian offers a suite of specialized services that include Health Economics and Outcomes Research (HEOR), Health Technology Assessment Submission (HTA Submission), Market Access, Market Research & Business Intelligence, Pricing Strategy, and Value Dossiers Development. 

Boasting a team of 18 experts, Ascenian is committed to delivering decision-planning solutions that focus on evidence generation and optimal positioning of new treatments in budget, funding, and care pathways. They also excel in price negotiations and continuous value demonstration planning. 

The underlying mission of Ascenian is to ensure access to affordable innovations for patients, carers, and health systems, thus making a significant difference in the healthcare sector.

title: Alithea Bio UG
description:
Established in 2019, Alithea Bio UG is a burgeoning startup operating from its headquarters in Freiburg, Germany. This innovative firm has also established a significant presence in Illkirch Graffenstaden, Alsace, France. 

As a forerunner in the field of precision immunotherapy, Alithea Bio UG has carved a niche for itself with its highly sensitive and reproducible HLA peptidome characterization services. These services are instrumental in accelerating the development of an array of therapeutic options, especially in the immunotherapy sector. The company's prowess in this area significantly reduces the time to Investigational New Drug (IND) approval for therapies like T cell engagers, TCR T cell therapy, cancer vaccines, and TCR mimic antibodies. This is achieved by providing crucial peptide HLA mass spectrometry data for target validation, on-target toxicity profiling, and off-target toxicity profiling.

The company has also developed an extensive HLA peptide database with over 1 million peptides sourced from more than 3000 mass spectrometric measurements. This database is cloud-accessible, allowing for instantaneous target validation. The company's services also extend to Amplicon - HLA Typing, Immuno-oncology Assays, Immuno-oncology Targets, Pepscan Analysis, Peptide Array, Peptide Bioanalysis, Target Characterization, Target Identification, and Target Validation.

In summary, Alithea Bio UG, with its cutting-edge services and robust database, is poised to make significant contributions to the precision immunotherapy industry.

title: Advanced BioScience Laboratories
description:
Established in 1961, Advanced BioScience Laboratories (ABL) is a mid-sized business based in Rockville, MD, US, with a significant international footprint. It has additional sites at 9800 Medical Center Drive, Rockville, MD, United States, 317 Avenue Jean Jaurès Lyon, Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes, 69007 France, and 4 Rue Laurent Fries Illkirch-Graffenstaden, Grand Est, 67400 France. 

ABL is a contract development and manufacturing organization (CDMO) with a specialization in developing and manufacturing viruses for vaccine candidates, gene, and cancer therapies. The company's mission is to provide Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP) viral vectors from early-stage clinical studies to commercialization, thereby contributing to the success of its clients' immunotherapeutic innovations. 

The company offers a wide range of services including, but not limited to, Adherent Cell Culture, Analytical Development and Validation, Antibody Detection, Assay Development Consulting, Biomarker Discovery, and Biosafety Testing In Vitro. They also offer bulk manufacturing, drug product stability testing, fill and finish processing, and a host of other essential services. 

Moreover, ABL is a leading global provider of immunology and biomarker analyses and also offers expert laboratory and sample management services to advance promising candidates from discovery to the clinic. 

The company is certified to Biosafety Level 2 (BSL 2) standards, ensuring high quality and safety in all its operations. ABL is a subsidiary of the Institut Mérieux and is committed to contributing to the success of its clients' immunotherapeutic innovations.

title: AbovChem LLC
description:
AbovChem LLC, established in 2015, is a mid-sized business based in San Diego, California, specializing in various facets of the pharmaceutical industry. Founded by veterans in MedChem and CMC, this company is a key player in the BirdoTech Pharma Group, offering a comprehensive range of chemistry services, from discovery to CMC research and manufacturing. 

With a rich catalog of approximately 160,000 building blocks, AbovChem LLC is at the forefront of the drug discovery community. Their services encompass API manufacturing process development, tech transfer and validation, advanced intermediates, building blocks, bulk raw materials, and a vast array of specialized services related to compound synthesis, metabolic stability, peptide derivatives, and more. 

In addition to their headquarters in San Diego, AbovChem has several other locations worldwide, including sites in Cranbury, New Jersey, Berlin, Germany, Xi'an City and Shanghai in China. Their San Diego warehouse alone houses over 45,000 different research chemicals, ready for next-day delivery. 

AbovChem LLC's vision centers on maximizing client value by leveraging their world-class, innovation-driven drug discovery and manufacturing service platform. Their mission is to expedite the identification of potential clinical candidates for their clients, solidifying their position as a trusted chemistry partner.

title: Accelero Bioanalytics
description:
Established in 2011, Accelero Bioanalytics is a small yet dynamic business located in Berlin, Germany. As a biotech Contract Research Organization (CRO), the company boasts an impressive track record in the bioanalytics of nucleic acid therapeutics. 

Accelero Bioanalytics specializes in Good Laboratory Practice (GLP) services. These services encompass a range of techniques, including sandwich ligand binding assays, Real-Time RT-qPCR, hybridisation, and immunology assays. These techniques are primarily utilized for PK/PD research on various elements such as microRNA, miRNA, siRNA, aptamers, antisense, and more. These services play a crucial role in the pre-clinical and clinical drug development process.

Accelero Bioanalytics operates from its headquarters situated at Schulzestraße 20, Pankow Berlin, Berlin, 13187 Germany. The company is proud to be one of the pioneers in offering GLP Real-Time RT-qPCR for microRNA bioanalytics in Europe. 

With an annual revenue ranging from 1 to 10 million, Accelero Bioanalytics is a small business. However, it does not compromise on quality and innovation, thereby carving its niche in the competitive world of biotech CROs. Despite its size, Accelero Bioanalytics continues to make significant strides in bioanalytics, contributing to advancements in the field of nucleic acid therapeutics.

title: AI Superior GmbH
description:
AI Superior GmbH, established in 2019, is a cutting-edge startup based in Darmstadt, Hessen, DE. As pioneers in the realm of data science, machine learning, and artificial intelligence, they are dedicated to harnessing the power of analytics to unlock the full potential of your data. With a robust revenue profile for a new startup, AI Superior seeks to revolutionize businesses by providing actionable insights into products and services, which are obtained through the development and deployment of advanced machine learning models. 

Operating from their principal sites at Kemperplatz 1 Berlin and Robert-Bosch-str, 7 Darmstadt, AI Superior GmbH offers a vast range of services. These include but are not limited to Bayesian Statistics, Biostatistical Design, Data Curation, and Infrastructure. They also specialize in Data Lineage & Quality, Data Quality Framework, Data and Text Mining, and Discovery Computational Chemistry. Their expertise extends to Discovery Statistical and Mathematical Modeling, Machine Learning, Marker Analyses, Scientific Data Visualization, Scientific Pipeline Implementation, Software Tools, and System Development. 

AI Superior GmbH distinguishes itself by delivering rapid prototypes along with end-to-end products, all aimed at addressing complex business challenges. Their commitment to innovation and excellence makes them a sought-after partner in the realm of data science and AI-based solutions.

title: Abcalis GmbH
description:
Established in 2019, Abcalis GmbH is a burgeoning biotechnology startup headquartered in Braunschweig, Niedersachsen, DE. As a young company, Abcalis operates an institute for Biochemistry & Biotechnology on Spielmannstrasse in Braunschweig, providing myriad services in the field of antibody biotechnology.

Abcalis specializes in the development, production, and distribution of recombinant antibodies, offering a unique, animal-free alternative to the current products available in the research and diagnostics antibody market. These include animal-derived monoclonals, recombinant antibodies derived from immunizations, and serum products. The company's innovative approach involves creating antibodies entirely in vitro, without immunization, using advanced antibody phage display technology. 

Additionally, Abcalis is committed to eliminating all animal-derived materials from its processes, including cultivation media or blocking substances. Consequently, the company prides itself on producing truly 'vegan' antibodies, setting a new standard in the biotech industry.

Beyond their core product, Abcalis offers a range of services such as Antibody Conjugation, Antibody Isotype Switching, Epitope Mapping, Direct Antibody Labeling, and many more. The company also provides customization of antibodies, enabling customers to choose any Fc part from any species in any format. Furthermore, they have developed several special formats for enhanced flexibility and usability, including TWIN-Strep tag, free Cysteine, HIS-Tag, CBM3a, HRP, Biotin, and more. 

Abcalis GmbH is thus at the forefront of antibody biotechnology, pushing the boundaries of what is possible in this crucial field of scientific research and application.

title: Actome GmbH
description:
Established in 2017, Actome GmbH is a pioneering startup headquartered in Freiburg im Breisgau, Germany. Despite being a relatively new entrant in the industry, the company has carved a niche for itself by offering a wide range of services including Antibody Conjugation, Assay Development, Digital Polymerase Chain Reaction, Direct Antibody Labeling, Phosphorylation Analysis, Protein Bioanalysis, Protein Interaction, and Protein Post-translational Modification Analysis. 

The uniqueness of Actome GmbH lies in its proprietary Protein Interaction Coupling (PICO) technology. This advanced technology seamlessly blends the benefits of immunoassays with digital PCR technology by using DNA oligonucleotide labeled antibodies. This innovative approach allows for the quantification of proteins, protein interactions, and post-translational modifications in biological samples with an unprecedented level of sensitivity and specificity. 

Actome GmbH's commitment to supporting life science research and medical innovations is reinforced by their state-of-the-art facilities located at Georges-Köhler-Allee 302, Freiburg im Breisgau, Germany. Even though Actome GmbH is a new startup, its groundbreaking services and technologies are rapidly making it a trusted partner in life sciences and medical research sectors. 

In conclusion, Actome GmbH is not just a company; it is a catalyst for change, pushing the boundaries of life science research and medical innovation with its cutting-edge PICO technology and a wide range of services.

title: amofor GmbH
description:
Established in 2019, Dortmund-based startup amofor GmbH specializes in the niche field of in-silico formulation development for amorphous solid dispersions and other enabling formulations. Primarily catering to the pharmaceutical industry, the company employs cutting-edge thermodynamic tools to facilitate everything from early-stage polymer screenings to late-stage process development.

Located at Otto-Hahn-Str. 15 in Dortmund, the company offers an impressive array of services. These include API Physical Characteristics and Stress Testing Studies, API and Drug Product Stability Testing, and API manufacturing process development, tech transfer, and validation. Additionally, they excel in areas such as API/ Excipients Compatibility Studies, Adsorption/Desorption Studies, Crystallization studies, and Drug Formulation.

amofor GmbH also provides Drug Product Stability and Elevated Temperature Stability services, along with Excipient Compatibility, Forced Degradation, and Formulation Services. They conduct ICH-compliant stability testing, Melting Point, and Package Compatibility Tests. The company's expertise extends to determining Partition Coefficients, Polymorph Screening, Production Process Consulting, Protein Interaction, and Protein Separation and Detection.

Rounding out their service offerings are Solubility Studies, Thermal Analysis, and Water Activity services. The company's in-depth approach to polymer screenings, dissolution predictions, shelf-life predictions, and process development for novel formulation techniques makes it a standout in its field. As a new startup, amofor GmbH is on an exciting trajectory with a dedication to providing top-tier services in the pharmaceutical industry.

title: Aristotelis Misios consultant
description:
Aristotelis Misios Consultant, established in 2022 and headquartered in Berlin, Germany, is a boutique consultancy specializing in an array of data-driven biological disciplines. With a lean team of fewer than five employees, this firm operates out of its office located at Juelicher Str. 28 in Berlin.

The consultancy offers a comprehensive range of services, including Bayesian Statistics, Bioinformatics, Biostatistics Consulting, and Discovery Computational Systems Biology. They also provide Discovery Statistical and Mathematical Modeling, Epigenomics Data Analysis, and Machine Learning/AI services. Their expertise extends to Metagenomics Data Analysis, Multi-Omics Study, and NGS: Next Generation Sequencing. Customers seeking assistance with Omics Informatics Consulting, RNA Profiling, and RNA Sequencing can also benefit from their proficiency. The firm's specialization includes RNA Sequencing/Resequencing, Single Cell RNA Sequencing, and Single Cell Transcriptome Sequencing as well.

As a scientific consultancy, Aristotelis Misios Consultant boasts a broad experience in bioinformatics, computational biology, biostatistics, and machine learning. Their primary area of expertise lies in the data analysis of sequencing and single-cell omics data, encompassing transcriptomics, genetics, epigenetics, and epitopes. Furthermore, they demonstrate adeptness in the application of machine learning to biological data, distinguishing them in their field.

title: Arivis
description:
Arivis is a small-scale enterprise nestled in the heart of München, BY, DE. The company, whose genesis date remains undisclosed, operates within the range of 1-10M TTM Revenue, asserting its prominence in the business sector. Its official address is 23 Erika-Mann-Straße München, BY, 80636 Germany, where the heart of its operations lies.

Arivis' core services are a testament to its multidisciplinary expertise. It offers a plethora of imaging services, including 3D Cell Microscopy Assay, Bioimaging, Computed Tomography, and Confocal/Optical Microscopy. Further, it exhibits proficiency in Electron Microscopy, Fluorescence Mediated Tomography, In Vivo Imaging, and In Vivo Positron Emission Tomography (PET) Imaging. 

The company also extends its services to In Vivo Whole Tissue and Animal Imaging, Light Sheet Fluorescence Microscopy, Luminescence Imaging, Magnetic Resonance Imaging, and Medical Imaging. The range of services continues with Microscopy, Optical Tomographic Imaging, Photoactivated Localization Microscopy (PALM), Positron Emission Tomography (PET) Imaging, and even SPECT-CT and PET-CT Imaging.

Arivis is also adept at Scanning Electron Microscopy, Scanning and Transmission Electron Microscopy, Single Molecule Localization Microscopy, Stem Cell Analysis, Thermal and Acoustic Imaging, Total Internal Reflection Fluorescence Microscopy, Ultrasound Tomography, and X-ray Microscopy and Nanotomography (Nano-CT). 

Although the company does not mention any specific certifications, it's clear that Arivis demonstrates a profound understanding of its field, which makes it a reliable choice for businesses seeking professional imaging services.

title: Analytisches Zentrum (AZ) Biopharm GmbH Berlin
description:
Analytisches Zentrum (AZ) Biopharm GmbH Berlin is a small business established in 2002, situated in Berlin, Germany. As a certified Good Laboratory Practice (GLP) and Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP) testing facility, AZ Biopharm specializes in bioanalytical and pharmaceutical testing of human and veterinary drugs. 

With over two decades of experience, the company is recognized for its expertise in analyzing the content of active substances and their metabolites in biological matrix, stability testing, and physicochemical analysis of intermediates. AZ Biopharm's extensive range of services includes API Physical Characteristics, Accelerated Stability, Antibody-Drug Conjugation, Bioequivalence Studies, Biomarker Clinical Validation, and many more.

AZ Biopharm is committed to providing tailored solutions and individual offers, competent and speedy advice, and comprehensive reporting in both German and English. The company ensures a high standard of quality, maintained by its independent quality assurance and constantly evolving validated test equipment, which meets the requirements of 21 CFR Part 11. 

The company distinguishes itself with fast response times, special experience in conducting over 400 bioequivalence studies with positive authority votes, and the capacity to test over 75,000 study samples per year in bioanalysis. AZ Biopharm's facility also includes climate chambers for ICH conditions, walk-in freezer for storage of bioanalytical samples, and additional climate cabinets for other climates and freezers at -80 ° C. 

With its dedication to ensuring quality control of pharmaceutical raw materials, excipients, and finished products, AZ Biopharm GmbH Berlin stands as a leading small business in the pharmaceutical industry in Germany.

title: Assay.Works
description:
Founded in 2016, Assay.Works is a specialized contract research organization (CRO) stationed in Regensburg, Bavaria, classified as a small business with a revenue range of 1-10 million TTM. Its primary focus is to offer research services to pharmaceutical and biotech companies as well as academic organizations, operating on a fee-for-service basis. 

Assay.Works' mission is to expedite the research programs of its partners through the development and execution of predictive and scalable assays. These assays aim to quantify the bioactivity of innovative chemical and biological entities. The company employs scientific rigor, industry best practices, and its expertise in laboratory automation and informatics to transform complex assays into reliable, reproducible results.

Its service portfolio is comprehensive, covering a wide range of assays, from ATP Competitive Study and Assay Development to Fibroblast Growth Factor Receptor (FGFR) Assays and High Throughput Screening. The company also offers services in Cell Line Engineering, Bioactivity Assessments, Quantitative Biology Applications, and more.

Assay.Works operates from a site located at Am BioPark 11, Building 2, Regensburg, Bavaria, 93053 Germany. The company's rich heritage is built on a 16-year legacy of a leading biopharma's high-throughput screening center, where it offered assay, screening, and quantitative biology services for drug discovery programs across various crucial medical needs.

title: A&M Labor fur Analytik und Metabolismusforschung Service GmbH
description:
A&M Labor fur Analytik und Metabolismusforschung Service GmbH, established in 1990, is a small-scale business headquartered in Bergheim, NRW, DE. With an annual revenue between 1-10 million, the company specializes in a broad range of bioanalytical and in vivo/in vitro ADME services.

Operating from its main office at Kopernikusstr. 25 Bergheim, NRW, 50126 Germany, A&M offers an impressive catalogue of services. These include API Physical Characteristics, API Stress Testing Studies, API/ Excipients Compatibility Studies, Accelerated Stability, Amino Acid Analysis (AAA), and a variety of antibody related services. The company also provides comprehensive chemical stability, dissolution profiling, drug-drug interaction studies, and a host of bioequivalence studies.

A&M is also known for its proficiency in Cerebrospinal Fluid Analysis, Carbohydrate Structure Characterization, and CYP Induction and Inhibition Assays, among others. They offer advanced method development and validation, metabolite identification and quantification, and non-isotopic labeling services. A&M also provides an extensive range of pharmacokinetic screening for different species and toxicokinetic analysis.

The company is certified by the International Council for Harmonisation of Technical Requirements for Pharmaceuticals for Human Use (ICH), further solidifying its commitment to providing high-quality, reliable services in the field of bioanalytical and ADME services. The extensive list of services and reputable certification position A&M as a comprehensive solution for a wide range of bioanalytical needs.

title: ATLAS Biolabs
description:
Established in 2006, ATLAS Biolabs is a small business with a significant 1-10M TTM revenue. Despite not having a traditional headquarters, the company maintains a prominent presence at its site located in Aroser Allee 68, Berlin, 13407 Germany. 

The company specializes in an extensive range of services. These services encompass Amplicon 16s rRNA Sequencing, Bioinformatics, Bisulfite Sequencing (RRBS), Chromosomal Characterization, DNA/RNA Extraction & Purification, among others. It also offers De Novo Genome Sequencing, De Novo Transcriptome Sequencing, and Epigenomics Data Analysis. 

Further, ATLAS Biolabs provides Exome Sequencing, Expression Profiling, Genomic DNA Purification, Genotyping, Human CMA, and Karyotyping. Its expertise expands to Metagenomic Sequencing, Metagenomics Data Analysis, Methylation Analysis, Methylation Specific PCR, and Microbiome Data Analysis. 

Moreover, the company excels in Microbiome Services, NGS: Next Generation Sequencing, and PharmacoScan - A Pharmacogenomics Tool. It also conducts Phenotype Assays, RNA Extraction, RNA Profiling, RNA Sequencing, and RNA Sequencing/Resequencing. 

ATLAS Biolabs is renowned for its SNP Characterization, Sequence Based Methylation Analysis, Targeted Sequencing/Resequencing, and Total RNA Sequencing. It also performs Virus Detection Assays, Whole Genome Bisulphite Seq, Whole Genome Profiling, Whole Genome Sequencing, and miRNA sequencing.

In essence, ATLAS Biolabs is a one-stop solution for a comprehensive range of genetic and bioinformatics services, making significant contributions to the scientific community.

title: acCELLerate
description:
Founded in 2014, acCELLerate is a small-scale business, headquartered in Skillman, NJ, US, with a revenue range of 1-10 million USD. With additional sites located at Osterfeldstrasse 12-14, Hamburg, Germany, and 400 Route 518, Skillman, NJ, US, the company has established its global presence.

acCELLerate offers a wide array of services including Adherent Cell Culture, Assay Development, Biobanking, Cell Line Characterization, Cell Transfection, Cytotoxicity Testing, Flow Cytometry, and In Vitro Enzyme Activity Assay Development, among others. This extensive list reflects the company's commitment to providing diverse and comprehensive solutions to its clients.

One of the unique aspects of the company's offerings is the development of bioassays and the provision of assay-ready Frozen Instant Cells. These cells are cryopreserved in a highly functional state, eliminating the need for expansion or passage before use. This innovative approach confers flexibility in scheduling experiments and enhances the reliability and reproducibility of bioassays. The Frozen Instant Cells can be utilized in a variety of applications including high-throughput screening, toxicology assessment, clinical stage bioassays, and post-marketing lot releases.

acCELLerate maintains high standards in its operations, as evidenced by its International Organization for Standards 2001:2008 (ISO 9001:2008) certification. This reflects the company's dedication to quality and continuous improvement in delivering its services.

title: Aigora GmbH
description:
Aigora GmbH, with its primary location nestled in the bustling city of München, Germany, operates at the forefront of Big Data and machine learning technology. The company's primary site is located at Franz-Joseph-Str. 39 in München, 80801 Germany. Despite the absence of an established founding year, Aigora GmbH has made significant strides in the field. 

The services offered by Aigora GmbH span a broad spectrum, ranging from Data Asset Validation and Data Curation to the use of Machine Learning and AI. They specialize in various data fields - including but not limited to - COVID-19, Diagnostics/Laboratory, Electronic Medical Record (EMR), Genomics, Oncology, and Rare Diseases. They also manage multi-source data pools and Patient Reported Outcomes (PRO) databases. 

Aigora GmbH is instrumental in the field of Real-World Evidence and Real-World Data. The company handles Disease, Patient, and Product Registries. Additionally, they offer RWE/HEOR/Market Access Data Analytics. 

The company stands out in its effort to make high-quality medical image datasets accessible to AI researchers and developers. They collaborate with an extensive network of medical imaging centers, pathology labs, and clinics to provide diverse datasets for algorithm training and testing. This initiative significantly contributes to the AI development landscape, making Aigora GmbH a key player in its field.

title: Axxam
description:
Axxam, established in 2001, is a mid-sized business headquartered in Bresso, MI, Italy with additional sites in Naples, Italy. The company specializes in providing integrated services in early drug discovery across various life science industries including pharmaceuticals, crop protection, animal health, cosmetics, and nutrition.

Axxam's crucial role involves identifying bioactive molecules with desired pharmacological activity such as modulation of a target or cellular pathway, laying the foundation for the development of new drug compounds. The company offers a wide range of services including Assay Development, Biochemical or Cell-based assays, Phenotypic assays, High Throughput Screening (HTS), and High Content Screening (HCS) campaigns.

Other services include Molecular Biology such as gene editing, gene expression analysis, and TaqMan-based screening. Axxam also specializes in iPSC-derived cells for various assays and electrophysiology including manual and automated patch clamp. The company's hit validation and hit-to-lead services include potency determination, mechanism of action studies, cardiac safety, among others. 

Moreover, Axxam offers Biophysical tools, Analytical Chemistry, Medicinal Chemistry, and Computational Chemistry. The company also manages external libraries reformatting and storage. In addition, Axxam has developed a platform specialized in generating and developing novel, natural, and synthetic flavor and fragrance compounds for various industries.

Axxam holds multiple certifications including Biosafety Level 1 (BSL 1), Biosafety Level 2 (BSL 2), EcoVadis - Silver Scorecard, Gender Equality European & International Standard (GEEIS), International Organization for Standards 27001 (ISO 27001), and International Organization for Standards 9001 (ISO 9001).

title: Aurigon GmbH
description:
Established in 2008, Aurigon GmbH is a small business that has made a significant impact in the field of preclinical Contract Research Organization (CRO). Headquartered in Munich, Germany, with additional locations in Dunakeszi, Hungary and Planegger Str., Germany, Aurigon GmbH has a comprehensive reach across Europe. 

The company's GLP-certified laboratories in Hungary are equipped for small and large animal testing, including rodents, rabbits, dogs, and minipigs. These expansive facilities, situated on the outskirts of Budapest, also house their in vitro laboratories. In addition, Aurigon GmbH maintains a highly equipped bioanalytical department in Budapest, further extending their research capabilities. 

The strength of Aurigon GmbH lies in its dedicated and experienced staff. With up to 30 years of individual expertise, they have been instrumental in successfully completing more than 6000 studies across various test item classes. This includes New Chemical Entities (NCE), New Biological Entities (NBE), herbal extracts, vaccines, and oligonucleotides.

Aurigon GmbH offers a wide range of services, including safety assessments, ADME-PK studies, bioanalytics, and pharmacodynamics. From safety pharmacology and in vivo toxicology to bioanalytical method development and glucose tolerance tests, the company provides a comprehensive suite of services to meet diverse research needs.

To learn more about Aurigon GmbH and its wide array of services, visit their website at www.aurigon.eu.

sites.name: ATRC Aurigon Toxicological Research Center Ltd.

title: ATREIDE BIOSAMPLES
description:
Established in 2011, Atreide Biosamples is a small business headquartered in Hannover, DE, specifically located at Gretchenstraße 7 Hannover, 30161 Germany. With a revenue range of 1-10M TTM, this company specializes in the collection of human biological specimens and clinical information. 

Atreide Biosamples primarily serves the biomedical research community, which encompasses biotechnology, pharmaceutical, diagnostic, and academic research organizations. The company offers a wide range of services, distinctively dealing with various types of human biofluids, tissues, and cells. 

This includes but is not limited to BronchoAlveolar Lavage (BAL), Human Ascites, Human Blood, Human Bone Marrow Aspirates, Human Cerebral Spinal Fluid (CSF), Human Fecal Matter, and Human Peripheral Blood Mononuclear Cells (PBMCs). They also handle human plasma, saliva, serum, sputum, synovial fluid, umbilical cord blood, urine, and whole blood. 

Furthermore, Atreide Biosamples also provides services related to human tissue, which comprises of human fixed tissue, fresh tissue, and frozen tissue. With a comprehensive range of services, Atreide Biosamples is a valuable resource for organizations seeking to conduct detailed and extensive biomedical research.

title: ALSACHIM
description:
Established in 2005, ALSACHIM is a small business situated in Illkirch-Graffenstaden, Grand Est, France. With its headquarters nestled at 160 Rue Tobias Stimmer, the company falls within the 1-10M TTM revenue bracket, demonstrating its robust position in the market despite its size. 

ALSACHIM is a renowned contract research and development organization, best known for its expertise in stable isotope-labelled compounds, metabolites, and pharmaceutical-related substances. These competences are crucial for a range of analytical purposes, strengthening the company's standing in its field. 

The company offers a broad spectrum of services, including Chemistry, Manufacturing, and Controls (CMC), Chiral Separation, Compound Management, and Custom Building Blocks. The service list also extends to Headspace Gas Chromatography, High Resolution MS, Ion Exchange Chromatography, LCMS Analysis, Liquid Chromatography, and NMR Methods. ALSACHIM is also proficient in NMR Structure, Size Exclusion Chromatography, Stable Isotope Synthesis, and Structure Determination.

A unique attribute of ALSACHIM is its dedicated team that produces in-house stable labeled building Blocks, or labeled raw material. This strategic approach accelerates the production of stable labeled internal standards, offering an edge over competitors. 

Furthermore, ALSACHIM boasts the Enhancing Quality in Preclinical Data (EQIPD) certification, which is self-certified. This certification further emphasizes the company's commitment to delivering high-quality services and maintaining industry standards.

title: AnalytiCon Discovery
description:
AnalytiCon Discovery, established in 2000, is a small business with an annual revenue of 1-10M TTM, based in Potsdam, Brandenburg, DE. The company has an expansive global presence with sites located at 9601 Medical Center Drive Rockville, MD, 20850 United States, and Hermannswerder 17 Potsdam, Brandenburg, 14473 Germany.

The company specializes in an extensive range of services. These include Antioxidant Assays, Apoptosis Assays, Cell Based Assays, Cell Viability, Chemistry, and Manufacturing and Controls (CMC). They are also known for their expertise in Compound Integrity, Compound Purchase Consulting, Cytokine Release Assay, Cytotoxicity, High Throughput Screening, and Inflammation Assays.

AnalytiCon Discovery also provides LCMS Analysis, Luciferase Reporter Assay, Metabolomics Biomarker Discovery, Method Development and Validation, Microbiology, and NMR Structure. Their service list extends to Natural Product Libraries, Natural Product Screening, Peptide Derivatives, and Pharmaceutical Research Chemicals. Additionally, they offer Proteomics, Target-Focused Compound Libraries, and Wound Healing Assay services.

The company has made its mark in the drug discovery sector, specializing in natural products. Their offerings range from the isolation and structure elucidation of natural products to their total synthesis and derivatization. They also provide services related to target identification, assay development, screening, and hit-to-lead optimization. This broad spectrum of services positions AnalytiCon Discovery as a comprehensive solution for drug discovery needs.

title: Across Barriers
description:
Established in 1998, Across Barriers is a small-scale business headquartered in Saarbrücken, Saarland, DE. The company is dedicated to offering novel technologies and services for the pharmaceutical, cosmetics, and chemical industries, specifically within the research and development sector. 

Across Barriers specializes in the use of in-vitro models of cell and tissue systems, simulating the transport of substances and formulations across biological barriers. As a result, valuable insights can be drawn regarding permeability and absorption. The company's services range from 3D cell culture, API physical characteristics, and API stress testing studies to solubility studies and real-time stability tests. 

These comprehensive studies provide several benefits to the clients of Across Barriers. Early-stage identification of substances unsuitable for development leads to significant reduction in time and financial costs. The use of in-vitro models also minimizes the need for high-cost, ethically problematic animal experiments. Furthermore, these models allow the classification of formulations that can be administered via innovative forms such as inhalation aerosols or transdermal application, and enable mechanistic conclusions on the in-vivo behavior of substances. 

Across Barriers maintains laboratories for biological and radioactive operations and has permission to work with narcotics agents since 2003. It also provides strategies to help generic companies reduce or avoid clinical studies and provides methods for classifying substances consistent with the BCS guidelines regulated by the FDA. 

By using tissue and cell cultures in pre-clinic research, Across Barriers represents a progressive and innovative step towards faster, safer, and more cost-effective development of modern active substances and formulations. This gives its clients a competitive edge in forward-looking technology.

title: Axolabs
description:
Axolabs, a mid-sized business established in 2011, is a prominent Custom Research Organization (CRO) specializing in the discovery and preclinical development of oligonucleotide therapeutics and other nucleic acid medicines. The organization's headquarters are located in Kulmbach, Germany. 

With more than two decades of experience in the field, Axolabs is recognized for its comprehensive range of high-end preclinical solutions, all of which are customized to meet the specific needs of their clients. A part of the LGC group, Axolabs provides its clients with access to a broader spectrum of services and expertise. 

The company's services encompass an extensive range of analytical methods and procedures, including API Physical Characteristics, Accelerated Stability, Adherent Cell Culture, and many more. The company's capabilities stretch beyond just research; they are well-versed in Chemistry, Manufacturing and Controls (CMC), Good Clinical Practices (GCP), and Good Laboratory Practices (GLP), ensuring quality and reliability in all their operations.

Additionally, Axolabs provides services related to oligonucleotide manufacturing, both for research grade and GMP, as well as the custom synthesis of specialty phosphoramidites and solid supports. With such a diverse portfolio, Axolabs exemplifies a one-stop solution for the discovery and development of nucleic acid medicines, ensuring a seamless and efficient path from research to market.

title: Advanced Cell Diagnostics, Inc. (ACD)
description:
Advanced Cell Diagnostics, Inc. (ACD) is a mid-sized biotechnology company established in 2011. With its headquarters situated in Dublin, Ireland, ACD has a broad global presence with sites in the United Kingdom, Switzerland, Germany, France, and the United States. 

ACD's core offering revolves around its proprietary RNAscope® technology, a revolutionary multiplex fluorescent and chromogenic in situ hybridization platform. This technology is capable of detecting and quantifying single molecules of RNA in situ. ACD offers two product lines, RNAscope® and BaseScope™, which comprise of assay reagent kits and over 15,000 off-the-shelf probes. 

Through its Pharma Assay Services, ACD provides a unique opportunity for customers to run assays for their distinct targets swiftly. The RNAscope® technology has been cited in over 1500 publications since its first launch in 2011. It provides an innovative method of localizing and measuring RNA in situ with unparalleled levels of sensitivity, specificity, and the ability to multiplex. This considerably reduces the time needed to develop a new assay, often to just 2-3 weeks. 

ACD also offers a range of biomarker services, including biomarker clinical validation and discovery, clinical pathology, digital pathology, and more. The company's technology plays a crucial role in identifying and validating biomarkers for companion diagnostics, thus accelerating the path to personalized medicine. 

A team of highly trained specialists, scientists, and board-certified pathologists carry out services like tissue sectioning, ISH staining, high-resolution full slide scanning, scoring, and image analysis. This team, with direct access to the technology's developers, provides unmatched expertise in ACD’s ISH platforms, delivering fast, high-quality data to meet study objectives and timelines.

title: Azenta Life Sciences
description:
Azenta Life Sciences, established in 1999, is a prominent name in the field of life sciences and genomics. Headquartered in South Plainfield, NJ, this multinational corporation operates at various sites across the United States, the United Kingdom, and Germany. As a full-service provider, Azenta Life Sciences offers an extensive range of services including, but not limited to, Amplicon 16s rRNA Sequencing, Antibody Sequencing, Biomarker Discovery, DNA Mutagenesis, Genome Editing, and Next Generation Sequencing. 

The organization is well-regarded for its commitment to producing superior data quality and providing unparalleled technical support, thereby aiding researchers worldwide to expedite their scientific discoveries. Azenta Life Sciences serves an array of esteemed clients, including top-tier pharmaceutical and biotechnology firms, academic institutions, and innovative start-ups. 

The company's cutting-edge facilities are supported by highly-skilled scientific teams. The Pre-Clinical and Clinical Services located in South Plainfield, NJ, maintain rigorous quality systems based on Good Laboratory Practice (GLP), Clinical Laboratory Improvement Amendments (CLIA) regulations, and College of American Pathologist (CAP) standards. Additionally, the Azenta Life Sciences locations in Suzhou, China, and Takeley, UK, hold the ISO:9001 Quality Management Certification, a globally recognized certification that acknowledges operational excellence and quality standards. 

As a large business with more than 100 million TTM revenue, Azenta Life Sciences continues to lead the way in R&D genomics services.

title: Aldevron
description:
Established in 1998, Aldevron is a large-scale business with headquarters situated in Fargo, North Dakota. Renowned for its work in contract development and manufacturing, the company has been instrumental in providing the foundation for innovative biological breakthroughs. 

Aldevron maintains several sites across the United States, including locations at 4055 41st Avenue South Fargo, 3233 15th Street South Fargo, 3001 University Drive South Fargo in North Dakota, and 5602 Research Park Boulevard in Madison, Wisconsin. 

The company offers an extensive range of services. These encompass everything from API and Drug Product Storage and Distribution, Adherent Cell Culture, Affinity Tag Purification, to Antibody Conjugation, Humanization, and Purification. The company also provides Antibody Sequencing, Bacterial Expression, and Genome Editing, among many others. 

One of Aldevron’s major strengths lies in their custom services, such as Plasmid DNA production that meets quality standards from pre-clinical research through GMP, therapeutic mRNA transcripts and gRNA for gene editing, and protein design and manufacture that meet stringent quality and activity specifications. Additionally, the company also provides RG to GMP Cas9 nucleases, IVT enzymes for mRNA, and other enzymes tested for performance and evaluated by independent industry collaborators.

Aldevron's collaborative approach and dedication to quality enable the company to meet clients' precise requirements and offer innovative solutions to advance science. This commitment has established Aldevron as a driving force in the next generation of biological products.

title: BioCell Technology
description:
BioCell Technology, established in 1997, is a small business based in Orange, CA, US with an additional location in Elmshorn, Schleswig-Holstein, Germany. Despite its size, it has an impressive reach and influence in the health and wellness industry. BioCell Technology specializes in the research, development, branding, and distribution of unique dietary ingredients, with a strong foundation in scientific support. Its mission is to enhance the quality of life of its consumers.

However, the company's services extend beyond simply providing healthful ingredients. BioCell Technology also offers custom product formulation and contract manufacturing services. This means that they collaborate with other businesses to create tailored solutions, making BioCell Technology not just a supplier of innovative dietary ingredients, but a partner in creating wellness products.

By focusing on the science behind their products and using this to inform their development and branding strategy, BioCell Technology has carved out a unique niche for itself in the wellness industry. This commitment to scientific rigor and improvement of life quality makes BioCell Technology a standout in the field. With two strategic locations, in the United States and Germany, the company is well-positioned to serve both domestic and international markets. 

In summary, BioCell Technology is a small business with big impact, dedicated to improving lives through scientifically-supported dietary ingredients and customized wellness solutions.
